description: Sequestered in high mountains atop tall trees, the aarakocra evoke fear and wonder. Many of these birdfolk hail from the boundless vistas of the Elemental Plane of Air. They are immigrants, refugees, scouts, and explorers, their outposts functioning as footholds in a world both strange and alien.

traits.name: Flight
traits.description: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. To fly, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

subraces.name: Alia'eet
subraces.description:
To most other races, the Alia'eet are reported to be the only known subrace of Aarakocra, they make up the entirety of their military might. Their scouts and fighters are seen almost exclusively with all encounters with other races. They are typically the only subrace of the Aarakocra that bleed into the material plane, and as such, they are easily mistaken as the only Aarakocra archetype to exist within texts, eyewitness reports and lore books.

They are commonly mistaken for eagles given the height that they fly, with white feathered heads and strong curled yellow beaks. The core of their bodies are brown plumage with some extremities containing more white feathers like their posterior crest.

traits.name: Vicious Talons
traits.description: You have razor talons which you can use to make unarmed strikes, dealing slashing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier.

traits.name: Eagle Scream
traits.description: As a bonus action, you let out an intimidatingly shrill scream at a target within 60 ft. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failure, the target is frightened of you until the start of your next turn. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Eagle Scream
actions.description: You let out an intimidatingly shrill scream at a creature that can see or hear you within 60 ft. The target must make a DC {dc-str} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is frightened of you until the start of your next turn.

subraces.name: Bubo Vir
subraces.description:
The wise sages of the aarakocra family, these birdfolk are seen as the elders of their tribes. Often they are skilled healers, well versed in the druidic arts and have a quiet respect for nature. The Bubo Vir convey themselves with a proud sense of decorum when conducting their affairs. Not much can get under their feathers, always seemingly calm and collected, even within times of duress.

Bubo Vir have tawny plumage, flat pale feathered faces, prominent ear-tufts and barred plumage that distinguishes them from other Aarakocra. They are slightly smaller compared to other birdfolk and also have large yellow eyes and a short black curled beak.

traits.name: Talons
traits.description: You have hooked talons which you can use to make unarmed strikes, dealing slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier.  You can use your Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls with your talons.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You have darkvision out to 60 feet.

traits.name: Naturally Perceptive
traits.description: Being able to rotate your head almost completely around, you are naturally proficient in the Perception skill.

subraces.name: Anocetta
subraces.description:
Colorful, upbeat and driven, the Anocetta are known for keeping spirits high, expressing their inner soul to provide entertainment and boosting morale within Aarakocra culture. If something is colorful, musical or artistic, the equally expressive Anocetta are sure to let their boastful presence be known. They are regularly patrolling to be the life of the party or vying for attention, and can sometimes be garrulous in their ways, but they are eager to please and see cheering-up others as a challenge to always accept.

Anocetta are predominantly blue with a white chest and underparts, and a blue crest. They have a black, U-shaped collar around the neck and a black border behind their crest. They can also be found in an assortment of other colors ranging in red, orange and green, sometimes being darker or more mute in females.

traits.name: Birdsong
traits.description: Your natural morning birdsong can bestow tranquility to those around you. When you finish a long rest, one creature of your choice with whom you rested gains advantage on the next ability check they make.

traits.name: Natural Melody
traits.description: You are a natural when it comes to creating songs and tunes at a moments notice. You are proficient in the Performance skill, and your beak is considered a musical instrument with which you are proficient.

subraces.name: Tarius
subraces.description:
The Tarius are known to be skilled runners with very capable ground movement, and capable fighters able to exploit enemies when they are knocked down. They are skittish and quick to run, but typically it is towards the direction of danger not away. Tarius are eager to put a plan to action, usually as there is never a plan to begin with, getting frustrated when a situation isn't dealt with immediately. They are quiet and speak in short bursts and are surprisingly quite pleasant to engage with when they have nothing important on their minds, which are often racing with thoughts.

Tarius have stunning facial features, with distinct quill-like black feathers protruding from behind their heads and striking featherless red faces. Their bodies, however have mute grey feathers and a strong border to black plumage on their wingtips and exceptionally long legs, which tend to give the Tarius more height over their other Aarakocra cousins.

traits.name: Talons
traits.description: You have talons which you can use to make unarmed strikes, dealing slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier.  You can use your Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls with your talons.

traits.name: Ground Rake
traits.description: You can move through the space of prone creatures but not end your turn there. If you enter a prone creature's space, you can use your reaction to make a Talon attack against them.

actions.name: Ground Rake
actions.description: When you enter a prone creature's space, you can make an attack with your talons against them.

traits.name: Bounding
traits.description: Your legs are built for speed, your base movement speed is increased to 35ft.

subraces.name: Orvid
subraces.description:
Highly intelligent, stark creatures with a propensity to be overly curious. Their love to harvest arcane lore serendipitously dovetails with an almost unnatural affinity for shiny objects. They have a knack for finding mildly interesting magical trinkets and turn them into personal collections. Orvids are often magic users by consequence of this wanton lust of pretty devices and - despite their wandering eyes and meandering mind - are still considered the smartest of their kind.

The head, neck and breast area of Orvids' are glossy black with a metallic green and violet sheen, the wings are black glossed with green or purple striped with white and the legs and bill of the Orvids are black; the iris is dark brown. They are sometimes incorrectly identified as Kenku.

traits.name: Investigator
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Investigation skill.

traits.name: Shining Example
traits.description: You have an eye for finding shiny objects, gaining advantage on trying to find items or objects that can shine or glint in the light within 20 feet of you.

subraces.name: Pingui
subraces.description:
Nomadic folk of the far north, the Pingui lead simple lives of fishing and sailing. Having lost much of their race's need for flight due to the lack of predators, they rarely fly and prefer to swim, which they are exceptionally good at. They are an isolationist society that prefers to keep to themselves, but is not openly hostile towards strangers.

Pingui are more rotund than other aarakocra, possessing feathers of black and white and thick layers of blubber to keep them warm in the biting arctic cold. They are sometimes confused for the Dohwar, a similar race of penguin-like people that inhabit the Astral Sea.

traits.name: Fisherman
traits.description: You have proficiency with angler's tools and with vehicles (water).

traits.name: Arctic Swimmer
traits.description: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and have resistance to cold damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: You can hold your breath for up to 30 minutes.

subraces.name: Kiwi
subraces.description: Calm and serene, kiwi aarakocra are a pudgy breed with brown feathers and long, slender beaks.  They have a highly acute sense of smell, which they often use to seek out food.  Legendary among aarakocra for their cooking ability, all of their dishes are much more about the art and creativity than making something nutritious.

traits.name: Creative Chef
traits.description: You have proficiency with cook's utensils, and you can use your Charisma when making checks with them.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception), Wisdom (Survival), and Intelligence (Investigation) checks that involve smell.

traits.name: Kiwi's Serenity
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

name: Aarakocra

description:
Long ago, an elf wandering a forest heard birdsong so pure and wholesome that she was moved to tears. Following the music, she came upon a clearing where stood a handsome elf youth who had also paused to hear the bird's song. This was Fenmarel Mestarine, a reclusive elf god. His divine presence stole her heart as he fled, vanishing into the woods as if he was never there.

Though the elf searched the woods and called for her stranger, she found no sign of his passage. Driven to despair by her longing, she begged the gods to help her. Aerdrie Faenya, elf goddess of the sky, heard the elf's cries and was moved to her aid. She appeared as the bird whose song had entranced the outcast god, then taught that song of beauty and seduction to the elf.

When her singing failed to draw Fenmarel Mestarine to her side, the elf cursed the gods, invoking a dreadful power and transforming her into the first harpy. The curse worked its magic on the elf's spirit as well as her body, turning her desire for love into a hunger for flesh, even as her beautiful song continued to draw creatures to her deadly embrace.

traits.name: Flight
traits.description: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. To fly, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Siren Song
traits.description:
You can use your action to start singing a magical melody for the next minute, which can be heard out to 120 feet. When you do so, each creature of your choice that can hear your singing must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus.

On a failed save, a creature is charmed by you and incapacitated for the duration of the song. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from you, the target must move on its turn towards you by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from any source, a target can repeat its saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. A target that successfully saves is immune to your song for the next 24 hours.

You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. In addition, you have proficiency in the Performance skill.

actions.name: Harpy Song
actions.description:
You start singing a magical melody for the next minute, which can be heard out to 120 feet. When you do so, each creature of your choice that can hear your singing must make a DC {dc-cha} Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, a creature is charmed by you and incapacitated for the duration of the song. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from you, the target must move on its turn towards you by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from any source, a target can repeat its saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. A target that successfully saves is immune to your song for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Talons
traits.description: Your razor talons are natural weapons with which you can make unarmed strikes.  They deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier on a hit, and you can use your Dexterity modifier for attack rolls with them.

name: Harpy

description: Aasimar bear within their souls the light of the heavens. They are descended from humans with a touch of the power of Mount Celestia, the divine realm of many lawful good deities. Aasimar are born to serve as champions of the gods, their births hailed as blessed events. They are a people of otherworldly visages, with luminous features that reveal their celestial heritage. An aasimar, except for one who has turned to evil, has a link to an angelic being. That being - usually a deva - provides guidance to the aasimar, though this connection functions only in dreams. As such, the guidance is not a direct command or a simple spoken word. Instead, the aasimar receives visions, prophecies, and feelings.

traits.name: Celestial Resilience
traits.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage and radiant damage.

traits.name: Healing Hands
traits.description: As an action, you can touch a willing creature and cause it to regain a number of hit points equal to your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

actions.description: You touch a willing creature and cause it to regain {level} hit points.

subraces.name: Balance Aasimar
subraces.description: Some aasimar are born of celestial entities that are less concerned with rigid order or chaotic freedom, instead working to find a middle ground between the two. Originating from the plane of Elysium, their offspring are healers and warriors, leaders unafraid of either welcoming a friend with open arms or taking war to a foe.

traits.name: Trance
traits.description:
You don't need to sleep. Instead, you meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefits that most people do from 8 hours of sleep.

In addition, you know the Unhinging Inclination cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Cosmic Shape
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a number of powerful magical arms to unfold from your back. With these arms you can counteract the harm in a creature's past and guard it from pain in the future. As your power increases, more pairs of arms can be manifested at once, as shown on the table below.
LevelExtra Arm Pairs
3rd1
7th2
11th3
15th4
19th5
Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you use a bonus action to end it. For each pair of magical arms you have, you gain a pool of 5 points of healing energy and 5 temporary hit points. As a bonus action, you can transfer an equal number of each to a creature within 10 feet of you. Points left unspent when your transformation ends are lost.

In addition, each of your hands holds an incorporeal weapon or strikes with metaphysical force. Once on each of your turns, you can deal extra force damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell equal to 1 + the number of pairs of arms you summon.

Your magical arms are incorporeal and cannot be used to physically interact with objects or do anything else that would require any kind of action. They provide no bonus to any ability scores or checks. Your natural arms do not count towards the total when calculating healing, temporary hit points, or damage.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Cosmic Shape
actions.description:
You unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing {arms} pairs of powerful magical arms to unfold from your back. With these arms you can counteract the harm in a creature's past and guard it from pain in the future.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you use a bonus action to end it. You gain {hp} temporary hit points and a pool of {hp} hit points. As a bonus action, you can transfer an equal number of each to a creature within 10 feet of you. Points left unspent when your transformation ends are lost.

In addition, each of your hands holds an incorporeal weapon or strikes with metaphysical force. Once on each of your turns, you can deal {damage} extra force damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.

Your magical arms are incorporeal and cannot be used to physically interact with objects or do anything else that would require any kind of action. They provide no bonus to any ability scores or checks. Your natural arms do not count towards the total when calculating healing, temporary hit points, or damage.

subraces.name: Chainwrought Aasimar
subraces.description: The great prison of Carceri is not a place one would wish to live in often, but this breed of aasimar have not only survived living as constant wardens; they have flourished. As the foremost level of security, chainwrights are often charged with capture and containment, and they have gotten very good at it over the aeons.

traits.name: Arcane Resilience
traits.description: You have resistance to force damage and you know the Eidolic Chains cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Lawbringer
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to bring forth the order and power of the greatest jailers of Carceri, causing ethereal chains to emerge from your body and lash out at nearby objects, and your voice to become forceful and demanding. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. The first time you hit a creature with an attack on your turn, you cause magical chains to emerge from the ether and restrain it, making it unable to move more than 15 feet away from the space where you attacked it, unless teleportation or similar abilities are used.

Once before your transformation ends, if you fail a saving throw, you can choose to automatically succeed instead.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Lawbringer
actions.description: You bring forth the order and power of the greatest jailers of Carceri, causing ethereal chains to emerge from your body and lash out at nearby objects, and your voice to become forceful and demanding. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. The first time you hit a creature with an attack on your turn, you cause magical chains to emerge from the ether and restrain it, making it unable to move more than 15 feet away from the space where you attacked it, unless teleportation or similar abilities are used.

subraces.name: Fallen Aasimar
subraces.description: An aasimar who was touched by dark powers as a youth or who turns to evil in early adulthood can become one of the fallen-a group of aasimar whose inner light has been replaced by shadow.

traits.name: Fallen Terror
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Intimidation skill and you know the Gloom cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Necrotic Shroud
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to turn into pools of darkness and two skeletal, ghostly, flightless wings to sprout from your back. The instant you transform, other creatures within 10 feet of you that can see you must each succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra necrotic damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Necrotic Shroud
actions.description:
You unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to turn into pools of darkness and two skeletal, ghostly, flightless wings to sprout from your back. The instant you transform, other creatures within 10 feet of you that can see you must each succeed on a DC {dc-cha} Charisma saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, once on each of your turns, you can deal {prof} extra necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.

subraces.name: Primal Aasimar
subraces.description: While most people think of angels or perhaps other humanoid beings when they hear the word тАЬcelestials,тАЭ the Upper Planes are also home to innumerable celestial entities that take the form of animals, particularly in the wild environments of the Beastlands. Some would be familiar to visitors from the Material Plane, while others are unique to the plane they are found on or are even singular entities within the multiverse. Their descendants are fierce defenders of nature, protecting the flora and fauna of their homelands to the death. While no less beautiful than other aasimar, they are somewhat less charming and take on many bestial features. Most have claws and eyes similar to a cat or other predator, but they can also have antennae, spines, fur, scales, antlers, fangs, or feathers. In this case, it is perhaps best not to ask how their Prime ancestors combined their bloodline with that of a celestial...

traits.name: Beastsense
traits.description:
You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with beasts. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return.

In addition, you know the Primal Savagery cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Sacred Beast
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the beast within yourself. Your claws and eyes glow, and you move with inhuman speed.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you use a bonus action to end it. For the duration, your speed is increased by 15 feet, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level, and when you take the Attack action with at least one hand free, you can cast Primal Savagery as part of the same action once on each of your turns.

In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra radiant damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Sacred Beast
actions.description:
You unleash the beast within yourself. Your claws and eyes glow, and you move with inhuman speed.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you use a bonus action to end it. For the duration, your speed is increased by 15 feet, you gain {level} temporary hit points, and when you take the Attack action with at least one hand free, you can cast Primal Savagery as part of the same action once on each of your turns.

In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal {prof} extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.

subraces.name: Primordial Aasimar
subraces.description: Wielding the elements alongside divine magic, primordial aasimar are touched by both the light of the heavens and the chaos of the elemental planes.  Fighting an eternal battle between their duty to protect and their urge to destroy, they wield the most powerful spellcasting of all aasimar.

traits.name: Elemental Attunement
traits.description:
When you finish a long rest, you may choose an element from air, earth, fire, and water. Your attunement grants you a cantrip and resistance to a damage type, as follows:
AttunementCantripDamage Type
AirGustLightning
EarthMold EarthAcid
FireControl FlamesFire
WaterShape WaterCold
Your attunement lasts until you finish a long rest, upon which time you can continue the same attunement or change your attuned element. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the learned cantrip.

traits.name: Air Attunement
traits.description: You have resistance to lightning damage and you know the Gust cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Earth Attunement
traits.description: You have resistance to acid damage and you know the Mold Earth cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Fire Attunement
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage and you know the Control Flames cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Water Attunement
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage and you know the Shape Water cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Elemental Form
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to convert your body to raw elemental energy, causing your form to become indistinct and slightly glow with a color associated with your elemental attunement.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide and have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against being grappled or restrained. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra damage to one target of a type determined by your elemental attunement when you deal damage to it with an attack or spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Elemental Form
actions.description:
You can use your action to convert your body to raw elemental energy, causing your form to become indistinct and slightly glow with a color associated with your elemental attunement.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide and have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against being grappled or restrained. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal {prof} extra {elemental-damage} damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or spell.

subraces.name: Protector Aasimar
subraces.description: From a young age, protector aasimar are charged by the powers of good to guard the weak, to strike at evil wherever it arises, and to stand vigilant against the dark.

traits.name: Vigilant Defender
traits.description: You can choose to remain conscious during a long rest, though you must still refrain from strenuous activity to gain the benefit of the rest and you know the Resistance cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Radiant Soul
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to glimmer and two luminous, incorporeal wings to sprout from your back. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra radiant damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Radiant Soul
actions.description:
You unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to turn into pools of darkness and two skeletal, ghostly, flightless wings to sprout from your back. The instant you transform, other creatures within 10 feet of you that can see you must each succeed on a DC {dc-cha} Charisma saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, once on each of your turns, you can deal {prof} extra necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.

subraces.name: Razorwing Aasimar
subraces.description: Waging a divine war requires an army, and there is no better army than the spawn of gods who fall under the War domain and their underlings. With a deep sense of honor and barely contained bloodlust, razorwing aasimar are very much used to the flow of blood; whether their own or that of their enemies.

traits.name: Quick Step
traits.description: Your walking speed increases to 35 feet and you know the Sword Burst cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Bladed Warlord
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine potential within yourself, causing two razor-sharp wings to expand from your back and any armor you are wearing to fully cover you. The instant you transform, other creatures within 10 feet of you that can see you must each succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or take slashing damage equal to your level.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and you subtract 1 from all damage you take.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Bladed Warlord
actions.description:
You unleash the divine potential within yourself, causing two razor-sharp wings to expand from your back and any armor you are wearing to fully cover you.

The instant you transform, other creatures within 10 feet of you that can see you must each succeed on a DC {dc-cha} Dexterity saving throw or take {level} slashing damage.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and you subtract 1 from all damage you take.

subraces.name: Scourge Aasimar
subraces.description: Scourge aasimar are imbued with a divine energy that blazes intensely within them. It feeds a powerful desire to destroy evil - a desire that is, at its best, unflinching and, at its worst, all-consuming. Many scourge aasimar wear masks to block out the world and focus on containing this power, unmasking themselves only in battle.

traits.name: Superior Darkvision
traits.description: Your darkvision has a range of 120 feet and you know the Brightlance cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Radiant Consumption
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a searing light to radiate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to char you.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, you and each creature within 10 feet of you take radiant damage equal to your level. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra radiant damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Radiant Consumption
actions.description:
You unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a searing light to radiate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to char you.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, you and each creature within 10 feet of you take {level} radiant damage. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal {prof} extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.

subraces.name: Shimmer Aasimar
subraces.description: Shimmer aasimar are almost exclusively descended from couatls from Mount Celestia. Nearly as vibrant as their ancestors, most have a crown of iridescent feathers mixed into or in place of their hair, and they are remarkably beautiful even for aasimar. Despite this, they are also incredibly shy. They spend much of their time alone, wandering forgotten places until they find one that speaks to their soul. From then on, they are a hidden guardian of that place. Intruders hear entrancing voices in both their ears and minds, but any attempt to find the source fails. A fallen shimmer aasimar is an absolute terror to all who come upon them or their self-declared holy site.

traits.name: Mind Walker
traits.description:
You can speak telepathically to any number of creatures within 10 feet of you, or a single creature that is within 30 feet of you. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically. Additionally, creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it. This replaces your light bearer racial trait.

In addition, you know the Mind Sliver cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Psionic Beauty
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unveil your beauty from the world and become a deadly avatar of psionic energy.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you use a bonus action to end it. For the duration, you become invisible at the start of each of your turns. You remain invisible until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw.

In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra psychic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra psychic damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Psionic Beauty
actions.description:
You unveil your beauty from the world and become a deadly avatar of psionic energy.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you use a bonus action to end it. For the duration, you become invisible at the start of each of your turns. You remain invisible until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw.

In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal {prof} extra psychic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.

subraces.name: Titan Aasimar
subraces.description: Titan aasimar are empowered by the colossal strength of a celestial titan - most commonly, an empyrean.  They stand resolute against those who would do evil, though some, touched by a corrupted or cursed titan, may turn their ire towards the forces of good, seeking only to darken the light in the world.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, and lift and you know the Courage cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Divine Dynamo
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, setting your eyes ablaze with fury as your towering form swells. The instant you transform, your size is doubled in all dimensions, and your weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases your size category. If there isn't enough room to double in size, you attain the maximum possible size in the space available.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have advantage on Strength ability checks as well as Strength and Constitution saving throws. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or spell. This extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Divine Dynamo
actions.description:
You unleash the divine energy within yourself, setting your eyes ablaze with fury as your towering form swells. The instant you transform, your size is doubled in all dimensions, and your weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases your size category. If there isn't enough room to double in size, you attain the maximum possible size in the space available.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have advantage on Strength ability checks as well as Strength and Constitution saving throws. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal {prof} extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or spell.

subraces.name: Twilight Aasimar
subraces.description: Twilight aasimar remain in a grey half state between light and dark for their entire lives. Both the Heavens and Hells regard them with wary respect and fear, because neither has much claim on them and their twin souls give them great power over the forces of both. Were a twilight aasimar to choose a side, they would be a powerful weapon to whoever claimed them. As such, both powers work hard to convince any known twilight aasimars to join them.

traits.name: Mandate
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Persuasion skill and you know the Word of Radiance cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Beloved Pariah
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to cause your eyes to ripple between light and dark, and great shadowy wings shot through with radiance to rise from your back. Those nearby are compelled to worship in awe or cower from the Truth.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. When you transform, creatures within 10 feet of you that can see or hear you must make a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a fail, they become charmed or frightened by you (your choice for each creature) until your transformation ends or they take any damage.

In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant or necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Beloved Pariah
actions.description:
You cause your eyes to ripple between light and dark, and great shadowy wings shot through with radiance to rise from your back. Those nearby are compelled to worship in awe or cower from the Truth.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. The instant you transform, creatures within 10 feet of you that can see or hear you must make a DC {dc-cha} Charisma saving throw. On a fail, they become charmed or frightened by you (your choice for each creature) until the end of your next turn.

In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal {prof} extra radiant or necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.

name: Aasimar

description:
Aetherborn come into being spontaneously as part of the aether refinement process. Their bodies and minds are apparently formed out of some interaction between the volatile elements of aether that are removed during refinement and the psychic impressions created by the people involved in the process. But each aetherborn is a unique individual, not a mere copy of some other person's mind and shape. This race is little understood, and few aetherborn are willing to waste any of their short lives allowing vedalken scholars to study their biological and psychological characteristics.

Aetherborn are a strange living by-product of the process of aether refinement, cast in humanoid form but lacking any of the biological qualities of other races. They don't eat or sleep, and they don't reproduce-nor do they have any physical sexual characteristics. Language that categorizes people into male or female categories thus breaks down when it comes to aetherborn. Most aetherborn prefer that others use the pronoun "they" to refer to them, since it doesn't attribute a gender that they don't possess. Only a relative few prefer "he" or "she," having chosen to adopt a gender.

traits.name: Born of Aether
traits.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

traits.name: Menacing
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

traits.name: Artificial Nature
traits.description: You have resistance to poison damage and immunity to disease, and you have advantage on saving throws against being paralyzed or poisoned. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

traits.name: Sentry's Rest
traits.description: When you take a long rest, you spend at least 6 hours in an inactive, motionless state, instead of sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but you aren't unconscious.

traits.name: True Life
traits.description: If the Mending spell is cast on you, you can expend a Hit Die, roll it, and regain a number of hit points equal to the roll plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). In addition, your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Constructs: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

name: Aetherborn

description:
Arachnen resemble elf-like humanoids with the bodies of various arachnids where one would expect their legs to be. Most are at home in the Underdark or in dry, hot envrionments such as deserts or savannahs. Shunned at large by most peoples, arachnen have been outcasts for so long that it is difficult for them to accept kindness from anyone.

Though they are devilish, most arachnen resist the influence of Baator, and eek out what lives they can, far away from other civilization.

traits.name: Arachnid Build
traits.description:
You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag, and you have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone.

In addition, you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. At 3rd level, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: Most of your body is covered in a thick, chitinous exoskeleton. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

subraces.name: Araneae
subraces.description: Often mistaken for driders, araneae are arachnen with the bodies of spiders.  However, unlike driders, they possess no darkness.  In fact, araneae are famously caring beings who help those lost in the Underdark.

traits.name: Spider's Web
traits.description: You ignore movement restrictions caused by webbing, and you know the Web spell, for which Wisdom is your spellcasting ability.  You can cast Web using this trait once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.description: While in contact with a web, you know the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

subraces.name: Scorpinon
subraces.description: Similar to tlincalli, scorpinon arachnen possess the bodies of scorpions, complete with pincers and a stinging tail.

traits.name: Natural Weapons
traits.description:
Your razor pincers and stinging tail are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with your stinger, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, and your target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target takes 2d4 poison damage.

If you hit with your pincer attack, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, and the target is grappled (escape DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. You have two pincers, each of which can grapple only a single target.

actions.name: Pincers
actions.description: If you hit with your pincer attack, the target is grappled (escape DC {dc-str}). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. You have two pincers, each of which can grapple only a single target.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.description: If you hit with your stinger, your target must make a {dc-con} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d4 poison damage.

subraces.name: Theraphos
subraces.description: Theraphos arcachnen have the bodies of mighty tarantulas.  The largest and strongest of arachnen, they are surprisingly the least prone to violence.

traits.name: Arachnid Toughness
traits.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

traits.name: Tarantula's Strength
traits.description: Your powerful legs are natural weapons with which you can make unarmed strikes, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier on a hit.  In addition, you have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

traits.name: Tremorsense
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can gain tremorsense with a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes. You must be on a surface made of dirt or touching such a surface to use this tremorsense. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Arachnen

description:
Autognomes are mechanical beings built by rock gnomes in their image, usually with a particular purpose in mind. For example, a gnome might build an autognome to be a steadfast colleague or a loyal companion. Sometimes, because of a malfunction or a unique circumstance, an autognome becomes separated from its creator and strikes out on its own. An autognome bears a resemblance to its creator, and most autognomes are programmed to speak and understand Gnomish. The internal components used in an autognome's manufacture can vary wildly; one autognome might have an actual beating heart in its chest cavity, while another might be powered by stardust or intricate clockwork gears. Roll on the Autognome History table or choose an entry to determine what event set your auto gnome on the path to adventure. If nothing on the table appeals to you, work with your DM to create an origin story for your autognome. Like gnomes, autognomes can live for centuries, up to 500 years.
Autognome History
d8 Story
1 Your creator gave you autonomy and urged you to follow your dreams.
2 Your creator died, leaving you to fend for yourself.
3 A temporary malfunction caused you to harm your creator, and you fled rather than face reprisal.
4 A glitch caused you to forget your original programming. You don't remember who made you or where you came from.
5 You were stolen from your creator and long to return to them.
6 You didn't like how you were being treated by your creator, so you ran away from home.
7 Your creator built you to complete a special mission.
8 You felt trapped in the role for which you were built and abandoned your creator, determined to find a greater purpose.

traits.name: Armored Casing
traits.description: You are encased in thin metal or some other durable material. While you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

traits.name: Built for Success
traits.description: You can add a d4 to one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make, and you can do so after seeing the d20 but before the effects of the roll are resolved. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Built for Success
actions.description: You can add a d4 to one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make, and you can do so after seeing the d20 but before the effects of the roll are resolved.

traits.name: Artificial Nature
traits.description: You have resistance to poison damage and immunity to disease, and you have advantage on saving throws against being paralyzed or poisoned. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

traits.name: Sentry's Rest
traits.description: When you take a long rest, you spend at least 6 hours in an inactive, motionless state, instead of sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but you aren't unconscious.

traits.name: True Life
traits.description: If the Mending spell is cast on you, you can expend a Hit Die, roll it, and regain a number of hit points equal to the roll plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). In addition, your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Constructs: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

traits.name: Specialized Design
traits.description: You gain two tool proficiencies of your choice.

name: Autognome

description: Azapians are bee-folk that trace their origins back to the Summer Court of the fey.  Living in hives much like the insects they resemble, they act much like human nobles.  Those that adventure are typically solitary azapians born outside of a hive.

traits.name: Antaennae Reception
traits.description: You are aware of the presence of telepathic creatures within 30 feet of you can hear any telepathy within 5 feet of you.

traits.name: Flight
traits.description: You have thin wings that produce a buzzing sound when flying. You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. To fly, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.  While flying, you have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to move silently.

traits.name: Greentender
traits.description: You are proficient in Nature and you know the Druidcraft cantrip.  Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Secondary Arms
traits.description: You have two slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms. The secondary arms can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.

traits.name: Stinger
traits.description:
You have a sharp stinger that you can use to make unarmed strikes, dealing piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

If you hit with your stinger, you can choose to dislodge it in the target, poisoning it for 1 minute or until it uses an action to remove the stinger. After you dislodge your stinger, you can't make attacks with it until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.description: If you hit with your stinger, you can choose to dislodge it in the target, poisoning it for 1 minute or until it uses an action to remove the stinger.  After you dislodge your stinger, you can't make attacks with it until you finish a long rest.

name: Azapian

description: Called Simic Hybrids in Ravnica, bio-tinkers are scientists who modify their very bodies with biological enhancements.  Usually scientists of the oceans, they see the incredible abilities wielded by deep sea animals and envy these abilites for themselves.

traits.name: Ancestral Legacy
traits.description:
If you replace a race with this lineage, you gain any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.

If you don't keep any of those elements, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Ancestry
traits.description: You gain any traits that grant a climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from your original race.

traits.name: Skill Versatility
traits.description: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Animal Enhancements
traits.description: Your body has been altered with animal characteristics. You choose one animal enhancement now and one at 5th level.

If you are not incapacitated or wearing heavy armor, you can extend fin-like membranes and glide. When you do so, you can perform the following aerial maneuvers:
  • When you fall, you can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot you descend.
  • When you would take damage from a fall, you can use your reaction to reduce the fall's damage to 0.
You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

You have a writhing tentacle in addition to your existing limbs. The tentacle can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.
You can breathe air and water, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

If you are not incapacitated or wearing heavy armor, you can extend fin-like membranes and glide. When you do so, you can perform the following aerial maneuvers:
  • When you fall, you can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot you descend.
  • When you would take damage from a fall, you can use your reaction to reduce the fall's damage to 0.
You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

You have a writhing tentacle in addition to your existing limbs. The tentacle can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.
You can breathe air and water, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

As an action, you can spray acid at a target you can see within 30 feet of you.  The target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). The target takes 2d10 acid damage if they fail, or half as much if they succeed. The damage increases to 3d10 at 11th level and 4d10 at 17th level. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Acid Spit
actions.description: You spray acid at a target you can see within 30 feet of you.  The target must make a DC {dc-con} Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {damage} acid damage if they fail, or half as much if they succeed.

traits.description: Your skin in places is covered by a thick shell. You gain a +1 to your AC when not wearing heavy armor.

You have two special appendages growing alongside with your arms, for which you choose the appearance. As an action, you can use one of them to grapple a creature. Each one is also a natural weapon, which you can use to make an unarmed strike with. If you hit, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier. Immediately after you hit with an unarmed strike using one, you can try to grapple the target as a bonus action. These appendages are not dexterous enough to use weapons, magic weapons, and other specialized equipment.

name: Bio-Tinker

description: These canine humanoids create close, familial bonds with those who prove themselves worthy of loyalty. They will unflinchingly protect those with which they have pledged loyalty, putting the lives of their family over their own. Any bomok who forsakes a bond is cast out by others of their kind and considered a traitor to their very race. Blessed with sturdy builds and finely-honed senses, these canines are well-suited to becoming guards, sentries, or any number of other protective professions.

traits.name: Bite
traits.description: Because of your fierce bite, your teeth are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Fast Learner
traits.description: The time it takes you to learn a new language, tool, weapon, or skill proficiency is halved.

traits.name: Fierce Loyalty
traits.description:
When a creature you can see attacks a friendly creature within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

If the attack misses, you can choose to force the attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus) or become frightened of you until the end of its next turn.

You can force this saving throw a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Fierce Loyalty
actions.description: When a creature you can see attacks a friendly creature within 5 feet of you, you can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.  If the attack misses, you can choose to force the attacker to make a DC {dc-cha} Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Heightened Senses
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Hound's Vigilance
traits.description: Before you roll initiative, you can give yourself advantage on the roll. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Bomok

description: Bugbears rely on stealth and strength to attack, preferring to operate at night. When they're not in battle, bugbears spend much of their time resting or dozing, and bully weaker creatures into doing their bidding. From the viewpoint of the rest of the world, their aggression and savagery are thankfully offset by their rarity and lethargy.

traits.name: Long-Limbed
traits.description: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Sneaky
traits.description: You are proficient in the Stealth skill. In addition, without squeezing, you can move through and stop in a space large enough for a Small creature.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.description: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra 2d6 damage to it.

name: Bugbear

description: Cecaelias are curious and social half-octopus creatures with a love of novelty. A short-lived race, cecaelias search for every bit of enjoyment they can draw from life. They take pleasure in new experiences, from trying new land fare to meeting a previously unknown race and exploring unknown waters.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can breathe air and water

traits.name: Ink Cloud
traits.description: As an action, you can expel a burst of ink, which functions as the Fog Cloud spell underwater or the Grease spell on land.  Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.  You can use this feature once, and regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Jet
traits.description: You can take the Disengage action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Tentacles
traits.description: Your tentacles are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with your tentacle attack, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, and the target is grappled (escape DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and you can't attack another target with your tentacles.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.description: If you hit with your tentacle attack, the target is grappled (escape DC {dc-str}). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and you can't attack another target with your tentacles.

name: Cecaelia

description: Changelings can shift their forms with a thought. Many changelings use this gift as a form of artistic and emotional expression. It's also an invaluable tool for grifters, spies, and others who wish to deceive. This leads many people to treat changelings with suspicion.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.description:
As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait.

You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

actions.name: Shapechanger
actions.description:
You change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait.

You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

traits.name: Changeling Instincts
traits.description: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Persuasion, and Society.

traits.name: Divergent Persona
traits.description: You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice. Define a unique identity associated with that proficiency; establish the name, race, gender, age, and other details. While you are in the form of this persona, the related proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses that proficiency.

name: Changeling

description: The noble, armored knights of the Feywild, Daolagiath resemble all manner of beetles.  Strictly honorable and bound by codes as sturdy as their shells, one would be hard-pressed to find a more reliable ally among the denizens of the feywild.  They tower over the other insectile races, and are usually even more broad then they are tall.

traits.name: Hard Shell
traits.description: Due to your chitinous exoskeleton and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your exoskeleton provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

traits.name: Secondary Arms
traits.description: You have two slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms. The secondary arms can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.

subraces.name: Bombardier
subraces.description: The heavy artillery of the knights, bombardiers possess an innate weapon, a cannon-like shell on their backs that can spew forth deadly acid.

traits.name: Acid Cannon
traits.description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a spray of acid from your cannon shell in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d10 acid damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

You can use your Acid Cannon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Acid Cannon
actions.description: hen you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a spray of acid from your cannon shell in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC {dc-con} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {damage} acid damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

traits.name: Alchemical Mastermind
traits.description: You have proficiency with alchemist's supplies and poisoner's kits.

traits.name: Corrosive Acid
traits.description:
When you deal acid damage to a creature, you can choose to also reduce their Armor Class by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus until they finish a long rest.

You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

subraces.name: Hercules
subraces.description: The largest of the large, hercules are enormous beetle folk with long, curved horns they use to grab and throw their opponents.  As they grow old, their horn grows scarred and brittle, and they retire from adventuring when it eventually breaks off.

traits.name: Giant Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, and lift and you have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

traits.name: Horn
traits.description:
Your great horn is a natural weapon with which you are proficient. It deals piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier on a hit.

In addition, you can grapple a creature up to two sizes larger than you using your horn. You have advantage on checks made to manipulate the position of a creature grappled in such a way.

traits.name: Throwing Expert
traits.description: You have proficiency with improvised weapons and in the Athletics skill.

subraces.name: Ladybug
subraces.description: Just like the spotted bugs they resemble, these knights are a farmer's best friend.  They possess innate druidic magics that allow them to manipulate plantlife around them.

traits.name: Ladybug's Guidance
traits.description:
You know the Druidcraft cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Goodberry spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Pullulate spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast goodberry or pullulate with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

subraces.name: Moon
subraces.description: Tapping into the innate magic of their fey heritage, these beetle folk possess the ability to bioluminesce.  Also called lightning bugs, golden beetles, or glow worms, they use this ability both to light the way forward and to signal.

traits.name: Bioluminescence
traits.description:
You know the Light cantrip. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

In addition, your control over the Light cantrip allows you to relay messages to any creature, so long as your light is visible to them.

traits.name: Lucky
traits.description: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die. You must use the new result, even if it is a 1.

name: Daolagiath

description: Whether driven by fanatical beliefs, a hunger for personal power, or a genuine wish to help others by whatever means are available, some choose to undergo a ritual transformation that changes their body into an imitation of a true dragon. Other individuals concoct detailed magical experiments on unwilling subjects, exploring the limitations of the blood of dragons. Regardless of origin, the resulting creature is known as a demi-dragonтАФa being that was created rather than born.

traits.name: Inheritance
traits.description: Your connection to a particular type of true dragon manifests as a related skill. You gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: Arcana, Acrobatics, Deception, History, and Persuasion.

traits.name: Dragon Scales
traits.description: Your magical essence enhances your protective scales. While you aren't wearing armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Constitution modifier + your choice of your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier.

traits.name: Mythic Build
traits.description:
You count as one size category larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

Your claws have enough manual agility to manipulate objects as normal, but you have disadvantage on attack rolls made with weapons that have the ammunition or two-handed properties, and receive no benefit from wielding shields. In order to wear armor, you must have it specially constructed, costing twice the normal rate.

traits.name: Dragon's Fury
traits.description: You have access to an arsenal of natural weapons. These natural weapons count as martial melee weapons for you, and you are proficient with them. You can use them to make melee weapon attacks, and you add your Strength modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with them. Your fanged maw deals 1d12 piercing damage on a hit. Your lashing tail has the reach property and deals 1d10 bludgeoning damage. Your rending claws deal 1d6 slashing damage. When you take the Attack action and attack with your claw, you can use your bonus action to make an additional claw attack.

actions.name: Claws
actions.description: When you take the Attack action and attack with your claw, you can use your bonus action to make an additional claw attack.

traits.name: Aided Jump
traits.description: Your wings provide you with lift. Your maximum jump distance for high and long jumps is doubled, and you do not need to take a running start. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

name: Demi-Dragon

description:
Poised between the worlds of the living and the dead, dhampirs retain their grip on life yet are endlessly tested by vicious hungers. Their ties to the undead grant dhampirs a taste of a vampire's deathless prowess in the form of increased speed, darkvision, and a life-draining bite.

With unique insights into the nature of the undead, many dhampirs become adventurers and monster hunters. Their reasons are often deeply personal. Some seek danger, imagining monsters as personifications of their own hungers. Others pursue revenge against whatever turned them into a dhampir. And still others embrace the solitude of the hunt, striving to distance themselves from those who'd tempt their hunger.

Dhampir Hungers

Every dhampir knows a thirst slaked only by the living. Those who overindulge their thirst risk losing control and forever viewing others as prey. Those who resist might find exceptional ways of controlling their urges or suppress them through constant, molar-grinding restraint. In any case, temptation haunts dhampirs, and circumstances conspire to give them endless reasons to indulge.

While many dhampirs thirst for blood, your character might otherwise gain sustenance from the living. Roll on or choose an option from the Dhampir Hungers table to determine what tempts your character to feed.

d6 Hunger
1 Blood
2 Flesh or raw meat
3 Cerebral spinal fluid
4 Psychic energy
5 Dreams
6 Life energy
Dhampir Origins

Dhampirs often arise from encounters with vampires, but all manner of macabre bargains, necromantic influences, and encounters with mysterious immortals might have transformed your character. The Dhampir Origins table provides suggestions for how your character gained their lineage.

d8 Origin
1 You are the reincarnation of an ancestor who was a vampiric tyrant.
2 Your pact with a predatory deity, fiend, fey, or spirit causes you to share their hunger.
3 You survived being attacked by a vampire but were forever changed.
4 A parasite lives inside you. You indulge its hunger.
5 Tragedy interrupted your transformation into an immortal.
6 You are a diminished form of an otherworldly being. Slaking your hunger hastens your renewal.
7 One of your parents was a vampire.
8 A radical experiment changed your body, making you reliant on others for vital fluids.

traits.name: Ancestral Legacy
traits.description:
If you replace a race with this lineage, you gain any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.

If you don't keep any of those elements, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Ancestry
traits.description: You gain any traits that grant a climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from your original race.

traits.name: Skill Versatility
traits.description: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Deathless Nature
traits.description: You don't need to breathe and you don't age.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, at 3rd level, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

traits.name: Lifedrink
traits.description:
You can drain a creature's life using a natural weapon, which counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. You can add your Dexterity modifier, instead of your Strength modifier, to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with this attack. It deals 1d6 bludgeoning or piercing damage on a hit. While you are missing half or more of your hit points, you have advantage on attack rolls you make with this attack.

When you attack with this and hit a creature that isn't a Construct or an Undead, you can empower yourself in one of the following ways of your choice:

  • You regain hit points equal to the damage dealt by the attack.
  • You gain a bonus to the next ability check or attack roll you make; the bonus equals the mundane damage dealt by the attack.

You can empower yourself with this attack a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Lifedrink
actions.description:
When you attack with this and hit a creature that isn't a Construct or an Undead, you can empower yourself in one of the following ways of your choice:
  • You regain hit points equal to the damage dealt by the attack.
  • You gain a bonus to the next ability check or attack roll you make; the bonus equals the mundane damage dealt by the attack.

name: Dhampir

description: The dragonborn walk proudly through a world that greets them with fearful incomprehension. Shaped by the dragons themselves, dragonborn originally hatched from dragon eggs as a unique race, combining the best attributes of dragons and humanoids.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d10 damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

The type of saving throw and damage are determined by your subrace.

traits.name: Draconic Legacy
traits.description: You have an additional feature determined by your draconic legacy, selected from the options below:

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.name: Forceful Presence
traits.description: When you make a Intimidation or Persuasion check, you can do so with advantage once per short or long rest.

traits.name: Chromatic Infusion
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can touch a weapon and infuse it with your breath weapon. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 damage of the same damage type as your breath weapon when it hits. After you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Chromatic Infusion
actions.description: You can touch a weapon and infuse it with your breath weapon. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 {breath-damage} damage when it hits.

traits.name: Psionic Mind
traits.description:
You can telepathically speak to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

In addition, you learn the Mage Hand cantrip, and the spectral hand is invisible when you cast it.

traits.name: Metallic Breath Weapon
traits.description: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. The save DC for this breath is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. The specific nature of your Metallic Breath Weapon is determined by your subrace.  Once you use your Metallic Breath Weapon, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Sleep Breath
traits.description: Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become unconscious until the start of your next turn or until they take any damage or a creature within 5 feet of them uses an action to shake or slap them awake.

actions.name: Sleep Breath

The target remains there until the start of your next turn, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
