traits.name: Antithetical Breath
traits.description:
Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take force damage in an amount determined by how different their alignment is from your own. the target takes 1d10 force damage if its moral identity (good, neutral, or evil) differs from your own. Additionally, if the target's ideals towards society and order (lawful, neutral, or chaotic) also differ from your own, it takes an additional 1d10 force damage. If the target shares your alignment, the breath has no effect. This breath does not reveal a creature's alignment to you.

Both instances of damage increase by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

Instead of eating food, you must eat at least one pound of metal each week to avoid starvation.

In addition, you can innately sense any metal within 30 feet of you.

traits.name: Planar Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Infernal.

subraces.name: Tarterian
subraces.description: Planar subrace (Carceri)

traits.name: Draconic Resilience
traits.description: You have resistance to force damage. Your breath weapon deals force damage and imposes a Strength saving throw.

actions.name: Force Breath
actions.description: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with {desc} in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC {dc-con} {save-type} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {damage} {damage-type} damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

traits.name: Warden
traits.description: Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they take the Disengage action before leaving your reach.

traits.name: Planar Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal.

traits.name: Draconic Resilience
traits.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage. Your breath weapon deals necrotic damage and imposes a Constiution saving throw.

actions.name: Necrotic Breath
actions.description: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with {desc} in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC {dc-con} {save-type} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {damage} {damage-type} damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

traits.name: Superior Darkvision
traits.description: The range of your darkvision increases to 120 feet.

name: Dragonborn

description: Born from legends of beheaded cavaliers, dullahans are often brought to serve as the cavalry of the Raven Queen.  Warwearied and unpaid, keeping these soldiers in rank and file is no easy task, but their queen manages to keep them on retainer by finding and witholding their lost heads.  Not all heads are claimed by the queen, of course.  It is precisely in the pursuit of their heads that causes many dullahans take up a life of adventuring.

traits.name: Deathless Nature
traits.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage and immunity to disease and poison.  You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

traits.name: Expert Cavalryman
traits.description: You have proficiency with cavalry sabres, lances, and longhammers.

traits.name: Headless Horseman
traits.description:
You know the Find Steed spell, which you can cast as at will without expending a spell slot, but only as a ritual.

In addition, while mounted on your steed, you gain the following benefits:

  • You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid being knocked off of your mount.
  • You can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead.
  • If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Soulbound
traits.description: Your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Undead: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

name: Dullahan

description: Kingdoms rich in ancient grandeur, halls carved into the roots of mountains, the echoing of picks and hammers in deep mines and blazing forges, a commitment to clan and tradition, and a burning hatred of goblins and orcs - these common threads unite all dwarves.

traits.name: Dwarven Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

traits.name: Tool Proficiency
traits.description: You have proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice.

traits.name: Squat Stature
traits.description: You are considered a small creature for the purposes of mounting.

traits.name: Stonecunning
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can gain tremorsense with a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes. You must be on a stone surface or touching such a surface to use this tremorsense. The stone can be natural or worked.  You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Stonecunning
actions.description: You gain tremorsense with a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes. You must be on a stone surface or touching such a surface to use this tremorsense. The stone can be natural or worked.

traits.name: Dwarven Toughness
traits.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

traits.name: Dwarven Armor Training
traits.description: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

traits.name: Relentless Endurance
traits.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Relentless Endurance
actions.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Brisk Foot
traits.description: Your base movement speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Stone Marcher
traits.description: When you use the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost you extra movement on that turn.

traits.name: Master Sailor
traits.description: You have proficiency with navigator's tools and astral vehicles or water vehicles.

traits.name: Merchant's Tongue
traits.description: You have advantage on checks made to haggle.

subraces.name: Azer
subraces.description: Natives of the Elemental Plane of Fire, azers are master crafters, expert miners, and sworn foes of the efreet. In appearance and manner, an azer resembles a dwarf, which has led some scholars to speculate that azer may be descended from dwarves. Beneath its metallic looking skin, an azer is a being of fire, which outwardly manifests in its fiery hair and beard.

traits.name: Being of Fire
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

traits.name: Elemental Nature
traits.description: Your creature type is Elemental, rather than Humanoid.

traits.name: Fiery Weapons
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can set a weapon you are holding ablaze.  For the next minute, attacks with that weapon deal an additional 1d4 fire damage on a hit, and the weapon shines bright light in a 10 foot radius and dim light 10 feet beyond that.  You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Fiery Weapons
actions.description: You set a weapon you are holding ablaze.  For the next minute, attacks with that weapon deal an additional 1d4 fire damage on a hit, and the weapon shines bright light in a 10 foot radius and dim light 10 feet beyond that.

traits.name: Superior Darkvision
traits.description: Your darkvision has a range of 120 feet.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Duergar Psionics
traits.description: When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Enlarge/Reduce spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Invisibility spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

name: Dwarf

description: Elves are a magical people of otherworldly grace, living in places of ethereal beauty, in the midst of ancient forests or in silvery spires glittering with faerie light, where soft music drifts through the air and gentle fragrances waft on the breeze. Elves love nature and magic, art and artistry, music and poetry.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Trance
traits.description: Elves do not sleep. Instead they meditate deeply, remaining semi-conscious, for 4 hours a day. The Common word for this meditation is "trance." While meditating, you dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive after years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit a human would from 8 hours of sleep.

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Astral Fire
traits.description: You know one of cantrip of your choice from the Divine spell list. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Astral Trance
traits.description: Whenever you finish a long rest using your Trance trait, you gain two proficiencies, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you finish your next long rest.

traits.name: Radiant Soul
traits.description: When you succeed on a death save, you can regain a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Flight
traits.description: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

traits.name: Wind Speaker
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Auran.

traits.name: Resourceful Survivor
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Survival skill.

traits.name: Desert Born
traits.description: You are naturally adapted to hot climates.

traits.name: Mirage
traits.description: You can cast the Blur spell once using this trait.  Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.  You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Superior Darkvision
traits.description: Your darkvision has a range of 120 feet.

traits.name: Drow Magic
traits.description: You know the Dancing Lights cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Faerie Fire spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Darkness spell once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Seasonal Fey Step
traits.description: When finishing a long rest, any eladrin can change their season. An eladrin might choose the season that is present in the world or perhaps the season that most closely matches the eladrin's current emotional state. For example, an eladrin might shift to autumn if filled with contentment, another eladrin could change to winter if plunged into sorrow, still another might be bursting with joy and become an eladrin of spring, and fury might cause an eladrin to change to summer.

traits.name: Autumnal Fey Step
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. When you reach 3rd level, immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

levels.1: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
levels.3: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a DC {dc-cha} Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

traits.name: Vernal Fey Step
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. When you reach 3rd level, when you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

levels.1: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
levels.3: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

traits.name: Estival Fey Step
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. When you reach 3rd level, immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

levels.1: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
levels.3: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes {dc-cha} fire damage.

traits.name: Hibernal Fey Step
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. When you reach 3rd level, when you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

levels.1: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
levels.3: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a DC {dc-cha} Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

traits.name: Firey Nature
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.  In addition, you can touch a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried by another creature to set it alight.

traits.name: Burning Gaze
traits.description:
Your heritage burns brightest in your eyes. If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of you and the two of you can see each other, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failed save, the creature is blinded for 1 minute and takes 3d6 fire damage. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the blinded effect. The effect also ends if the creature starts its turn more than 30 feet away from you.

You can use this ability once, after which you must complete a long rest before doing so again.

actions.name: Burning Gaze
actions.description:
If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of you and the two of you can see each other, you can force the creature to make a DC {dc-cha} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is blinded for 1 minute and takes 3d6 fire damage. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the blinded effect. The effect also ends if the creature starts its turn more than 30 feet away from you.

You can use this ability once, after which you must complete a long rest before doing so again.

traits.name: Arcane Gift
traits.description: You know one cantrip of your choice from the Arcane spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Polyglot
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write one additional language of your choice.

traits.name: Incisive Sense
traits.description: You have advantage on Investigation and Insight checks.

traits.name: Blessing of the Moonweaver
traits.description: You know the Light cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast Sleep once, and it recharges after a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast Invisibility (Self Only) once, and it recharges after a long rest. You do not need the material components required of the spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, and lift.

traits.name: Rock Climber
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Resilient
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against disease.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Friend of the Sea
traits.description: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed.

traits.name: Wave Speaker
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Aquan.

traits.name: Necrotic Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

traits.name: Blessing of the Raven Queen
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

levels.1: You can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
levels.3: You can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, and you gain resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

traits.name: Stargazer
traits.description: You have spent your life studying the stars. If you can see the night sky, you can cast the Augury spell without expending a spell slot or material components. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Eye for Detail
traits.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to discern the details of unmoving objects.

traits.name: Agile Scaler
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Mask of the City
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by crowds, smoke, structures, and other urban features.

traits.name: Streetwise
traits.description: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Intimidation, Persuasion, Sleight of Hand, Society, or Stealth.

traits.name: Fleet of Foot
traits.description: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

name: Elf

description:
The Feywild is home to many fantastic peoples, including fairies. Fairies are a wee folk, but not nearly as much so as their pixie and sprite friends. The first fairies spoke Elvish, Goblin, or Sylvan, and encounters with human visitors prompted many of them to learn Common as well.

Infused with the magic of the Feywild, most fairies look like Small elves with insectile wings, but each fairy has a special physical characteristic that sets the fairy apart. For your fairy, roll on the Fey Characteristics table or choose an option from it. You're also free to come up with your own characteristic if none of the suggestions below fit your character.
Fey Characteristics
d8 Characteristic
1 Your wings are like those of a bird.
2 You have shimmering, multicolored skin.
3 You have exceptionally large ears.
4 A glittering mist constantly surrounds you.
5 You have a small spectral horn on your forehead, like a little unicorn horn.
6 Your legs are insectile.
7 You smell like fresh brownies.
8 A noticeable, harmless chill surrounds you.

traits.name: Tiny
traits.description: Fairies are among the smallest of peoples.  Due to your size, you are unable to use weapons with the Heavy or Massive properties.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Fairy Magic
traits.description: You know the Druidcraft cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Faerie Fire spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Enlarge/Reduce spell with this trait. Once you cast Faerie Fire or Enlarge/Reduce with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

traits.name: Flight
traits.description: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.

name: Fairy

description: Imps are found throughout the Lower Planes, either running errands for their infernal masters, spying on rivals, or misleading and waylaying mortals. An imp will proudly serve an evil master of any kind, but it can't be relied on to carry out tasks with any speed or efficiency.

traits.name: Tiny
traits.description: Imps are among the smallest of peoples.  Due to your size, you are unable to use weapons with the Heavy or Massive properties.

traits.name: Animal Shape
traits.description:
As an action, you can magically transform into a Tiny beast with a CR of 0, or back into your true form. Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the creature's bonus instead of yours. If the creature has any legendary or lair actions, you can't use them.

When you transform, you assume the beast's hit points and Hit Dice. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. However, if you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form, For example, if you take 10 damage in animal form and have only 1 hit point left, you revert and take 9 damage. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked unconscious.

You can't cast spells, and your ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of your beast form. Transforming doesn't break your concentration on a spell you've already cast, however, or prevent you from taking actions that are part of a spell, such as Call Lightning, that you've already cast.

You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, you can't use any of your special senses, such as darkvision, unless your new form also has that sense.

Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. You revert to your true form if you die.

actions.name: Animal Shape
actions.description:
You magically transform into a Tiny beast with a CR of 0, or back into your true form. Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the creature's bonus instead of yours. If the creature has any legendary or lair actions, you can't use them.

When you transform, you assume the beast's hit points and Hit Dice. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. However, if you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form, For example, if you take 10 damage in animal form and have only 1 hit point left, you revert and take 9 damage. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked unconscious.

You can't cast spells, and your ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of your beast form. Transforming doesn't break your concentration on a spell you've already cast, however, or prevent you from taking actions that are part of a spell, such as Call Lightning, that you've already cast.

You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, you can't use any of your special senses, such as darkvision, unless your new form also has that sense.

Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. You revert to your true form if you die.

traits.name: Fiendsight
traits.description: You can see in magical darkness within 10 feet of you as though it were dim light.

traits.name: Flight
traits.description: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.

traits.name: Invisibility
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.description: You magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw.

name: Imp

description: Firbolgs are fey-oriented half-giants. Their tribes cloister in remote forest strongholds, preferring to spend their days in quiet harmony with the woods. When provoked, firbolgs demonstrate formidable skills with weapons and druidic magic.

traits.name: Firbolg Magic
traits.description: You can cast Detect Magic and Disguise Self with this trait, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability for them. Once you cast either spell, you can't cast it again with this trait until you finish a short or long rest. When you use this version of disguise self, you can seem up to 3 feet shorter than normal, allowing you to more easily blend in with humans and elves.

traits.name: Hidden Step
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Hidden Step
actions.description: You magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
traits.description: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with beasts and plants. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.

name: Firbolg

description: Those who think of other planes at all consider them remote, distant realms, but planar influence can be felt throughout the world. It sometimes manifests in beings who, through an accident of birth, carry the power of the planes in their blood. The genasi are one such people, the offspring of genies and mortals.

subraces.name: Air Genasi
subraces.description:
Most air genasi are descended from the djinn. As changeable as the weather, your moods shift from calm to wild and back again with little warning. You are intimately aware of the world around you, and you revel in this, traveling far and wide to experience as much as you can.

Air genasi typically have pale skin, hair, and eyes. A faint but constant breeze accompanies them, tousling the hair and stirring the clothing. Some air genasi speak with breathy voices, marked by a faint echo. A few display odd patterns or crystals in their flesh.

traits.name: Unending Breath
traits.description: You can hold your breath indefinitely while you're not incapacitated.

traits.name: Windflow
traits.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

traits.name: Light as a Feather
traits.description: When you are not incapacitated, you cannot fall at a rate greater than 60 feet per round, take no damage when you land, and always land on your feet. You can extend this effect to two Small or Medium creatures or one Large creature you are touching. When falling alone and not wearing heavy armor, you can move up to 3 feet horizontally for every foot you descend.

traits.name: Becalming Presence
traits.description: You do not suffer disadvantage on hearing-based perception checks and ranged attack rolls due to strong winds (magical or mundane).

traits.name: Mingle with the Wind
traits.description: You can cast the Dust Devil and Gust of Wind spells once each with this trait, requiring no material components and regaining the ability to cast them this way when you finish a long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level or higher. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subraces.name: Ash Genasi
subraces.description:
At some point in life, every creature stops growing and starts dying. You don't know of a time when your gradual and impending death was not something you were intimately aware of. Every day you have a little less energy to sustain you. And yet there is some memory just beyond your grasp of what it feels like to have life burning in your veins, and you desperately want it back, a hunger you can rarely satisfy. You have a fierce determination to feel anything and everything, leaving you susceptible to dangerous vices and risks. And yet you generally can't spare the energy to do these thingsтАж.unless you take that energy from someone else.

Ash genasi grow only for the first decade or so of life, after which their elemental nature begins to consume them. They are small, sickly, and have a gray pallor to their flaking skin. They don't have the energy to care about their appearance, and their dirty skin, hair, and clothes combined with an unnerving aura means that few people like spending time around them. Between their own poor health and the lack of support from others, few ash genasi reach much more than middle age, even if they look ancient. They are about as close to being undead as a being can get while still being alive.

traits.name: Failed Flame
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage and fire damage

traits.name: Heat Leech
traits.description:
Like the ash elementals you are descended from, you can steal body heat from others to feed your own fading energy. As an action, you can force all creatures within 10 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the creature takes 2d6 cold damage. Regardless of whether a successful save is made, you regain 1d6 hit points for each creature within range. Creatures who have unnaturally low body temperatures, but not cold-blooded creatures like reptiles, are not affected by this feature, nor do you gain health from their presence.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Heat Leech
actions.description: You force all creatures within 10 feet of you to make a DC {dc-con} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d6 cold damage. Regardless of whether a successful save is made, you regain 1d6 hit points for each creature within range. Creatures who have unnaturally low body temperatures, but not cold-blooded creatures like reptiles, are not affected by this feature, nor do you gain health from their presence.

traits.name: Chilling Presence
traits.description: You can also use your heat-draining abilities to a less extreme degree to cool those around you. While you are not incapacitated, creatures of your choosing within 10 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against effects caused by extreme heat.

traits.name: Dying Gasp
traits.description:
You fear death more than anything else, and it has to fight to keep its hold on you. When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Dying Gasp
actions.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

subraces.name: Dust Genasi
subraces.description:
Many genasi are driven by strong emotions that are imperfect expressions of the elemental force that touched them. As a dust genasi, you are the same, but the emotion that drives you before all others is hate. You hate anything that others have, and not because you want it, but just because it is. You are vengeful, but you take no joy in your vengeance, you simply cannot abide a slight against you. All things must end, and if you have your way you will be the one to end them.

Dust genasi are tall and gaunt, with nondescript faces beyond eyes that are either solid black or white. Regardless, their eyes are generally dead orbs in dark, hollow sockets. Their tanned skin is papery and dry, and their lips are cracked no matter how much water they might consume. Dust falls from their hair or rises in clouds under their every step. Most live in deserts and wear clothes suited to the heat there.

traits.name: Poison Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to poison damage

traits.name: Dune Walker
traits.description: You do not need to drink water and cannot gain levels of exhaustion due to being dehydrated. You also have advantage on saving throws against extreme heat and you are not affected by quicksand.

traits.name: Sand Swimmer
traits.description: When there is sand, ash, or other loose earthen material at least 3 feet deep, you can choose to swim through it like water with a movement speed of 20 feet. While doing so you have tremorsense out to 15 feet. This sense does not extend beyond the surface of the material you are moving through, though you are aware of the presence of creatures and objects that are standing on the surface.

traits.name: Dust to Dust
traits.description:
You release a blast of scouring sand that works to destroy everything it touches. As an action, you can force a creature you can see within 30 feet to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 slashing damage and has its AC reduced by 1. This penalty is removed on a long rest.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, after which you must complete a long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Dust to Dust
actions.description: You force a creature you can see within 30 feet to make a DC {dc-con} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 slashing damage and has its AC reduced by 1. This penalty is removed on a long rest.

traits.name: Hateful Blows
traits.description: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

subraces.name: Earth Genasi
subraces.description:
As an earth genasi, you are likely descended from the dao genies. You have inherited some measure of control overearth, as well as a steady nature backed by solid confidence. You tend to avoid rash decisions, pausing to consider all your options before taking action.

Elemental earth manifests differently from one individual to the next. Some earth genasi always have bits of dust falling from their bodies and mud clinging to their clothes, never getting clean no matter how often they bathe. Others are studded with gemstones, with skin tones of deep brown or black, eyes sparkling like agates. Earth genasi can also have smooth metallic flesh, dull iron skin spotted with rust, or a rough, pebbled hide.

traits.name: Stone Body
traits.description:
Your skin has a coating of stone or hardened earth. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal if you use your natural armor.

In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against being petrified.

traits.name: Earthworker
traits.description: You know the Mold Earth cantrip.  Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.description: You have a burrowing speed of 20 feet, which you can use to move through dirt, mud, and sand. Burrowing through solid stone halves this speed. You may choose to leave a hole large enough for Medium or smaller creatures to follow unhindered by reducing your burrowing speed by half.

subraces.name: Fire Genasi
subraces.description:
As a fire genasi, you have inherited the volatile mood and keen mind of an efreet or some other native of the Elemental Plane of Fire. You tend toward impatience and making snap judgments. Rather than hide your distinctive appearance, you exult in it.

Nearly all fire genasi are feverishly hot as if burning inside, an impression reinforced by flaming red, coal black, or ash-gray skin tones. The more human-looking have fiery red hair that writhes under extreme emotion, while exotic specimens sport actual flames dancing on their heads. Fire genasi voices might sound like crackling flames, and their eyes flare when angered. Some are accompanied by the faint scent of brimstone.

traits.name: Firey Nature
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.  In addition, you can touch a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried by another creature to set it alight.

traits.name: Hearthflame
traits.description: While you are not incapacitated, creatures of your choosing within 10 feet of you (including yourself) have advantage on saving throws against effects caused by extreme cold.

traits.name: Infusion of Warmth
traits.description: You can use a bonus action to give creatures of your choosing within 10 feet of you a number of temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier. You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a short or long rest before doing so again.

actions.description: You give creatures of your choosing within 10 feet of you {mod-con} temporary hit points.

traits.name: Reach to the Blaze
traits.description: You know the Produce Flame and Control Flames cantrips. You can cast the Flaming Sphere spell once with this trait, requiring no material components and regaining the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subraces.name: Ice Genasi
subraces.description:
As a child of the Plane of Ice, you are coldly rational, analyzing every situation to find the perfect outcome. You may not have a full understanding of the emotions of other people, which can make you seem cruel, and many ice genasi are detached and distant to spare themselves the pain of rejections stemming from this misunderstanding. Despite this, you still have a core of strong emotion. You are more likely than other genasi to have a lawful alignment, disliking change or chaos.

Ice genasi have sharp, delicate features even when their Prime parents do not. They may have a blue tint to their skin or be unusually pale, with hair and eyes in matching colors. Frost sometimes forms on things they touch, and many breathe frosty plumes even in warm weather. Even slight amounts of heat are uncomfortable to them, and they rarely wear heavy clothes.

traits.name: Cold Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage

traits.name: Analysis
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Investigation skill.

traits.name: Ice Floe
traits.description: You can move across difficult terrain created by ice or snow without expending extra movement. Additionally, you can freeze a thin layer of ice under your feet as you walk, allowing you to move across water as if it were a solid surface. This requires you to maintain concentration as if concentrating on a spell. The ice melts as soon as your foot leaves its surface, and can support no more than your own weight plus additional weight up to five times your Strength score.

traits.name: Cold Snap
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, as a reaction when a creature hits you with a weapon attack, you can cause the temperature around you to drop drastically just before the attack connects, forming a thin layer of ice. You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier. If the triggering attack consumes these temporary hit points, the ice shatters, doing 1d6 cold damage and 1d6 magical slashing damage to the attacking creature if it is within 5 feet. The cold damage increases to 2d6 at 5th level, 3d6 at 11th level, and 4d6 at 17th level.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Cold Snap
actions.description: When a creature hits you with a weapon attack, you can cause the temperature around you to drop drastically just before the attack connects, forming a thin layer of ice. You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your <{level} + {mod-con}>. If the triggering attack consumes these temporary hit points, the ice shatters, doing {damage} cold damage and 1d6 magical slashing damage to the attacking creature if it is within 5 feet.

traits.name: Arctic Magic
traits.description: You know the Ray of Frost and Frostbite cantrips. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subraces.name: Lightning Genasi
subraces.description:
The Plane of Lightning is a deadly plane formed from a skeleton of electricity around pockets of heavily charged air and boiling black storm clouds. As one touched by it, you are constantly on edge, filled with vibrant energy and delighted to spring into any situation at a moment's notice. Your enthusiasm can be overwhelming both in battle and in conversation, and with your boundless energy, you can't really understand why people sometimes need a break.

Lightning genasi have pale skin that can be tinged blue, yellow, or red, with those colors becoming particularly vibrant along the тАЬedgesтАЭ of their body, such as their jawlines, extremities, and joints. Veins of pulsing light sometimes run through their body, and their eyes often spark, particularly when they get excited (although few can tell the difference between calm and excited). They tend to wear light clothes that won't restrict their movement, and they love metal jewelry that can catch and shape the sparks they create.

traits.name: Lightning Step
traits.description: You have resistance to lightning damage. Additionally, your base walking speed is 40 feet.

traits.name: Conductive
traits.description: You can channel your internal lightning through your hands, making every punch a devastating blow. When you make an unarmed strike, you can choose to have it deal lightning damage, in which case it deals damage equal to 1d6 + your Dexterity modifier, instead of the amount of bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Lightning Core
traits.description: You have boundless energy that sustains you when others lag behind. You are not immune to spells and effects that put you to sleep, but natural sleep is a largely foreign concept to you. To gain the benefits of a long rest, you only need to spend 4 hours doing light activity.

traits.name: Thunderbolts
traits.description: You know the Lightning Lure and Zap cantrips. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subraces.name: Magma Genasi
subraces.description:
Magma is the union of earth and flame, the most stable element combined with the most chaotic. You have a serene countenance that masks a wild heart, surviving your mad plans through the simple fact that you were too tough for them to kill you. You are quick to laugh and are beloved for the joy you bring to those around you, but you are an equally terrible and implacable foe to those who upset you.

Magma genasi are generally rather stocky and not particularly tall. Their rough, rocky skin is uncomfortably hot to the touch, and when they bleed, it appears more orange than red and will scald those who touch it. Even those born to wealth wear relatively poor quality clothes, since their wearers don't expect the fabrics to long survive whatever antics they might get into.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: Your skin has a coating of igenous rock such as pumice, scoria, obsidian, or basalt. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal if you use your natural armor.

traits.name: Earth's Blood
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage. Additionally, you can treat lava and magma as if it were water, taking no damage while moving through it. Your resilience extends to items you are wearing or carrying. You have a swim speed equal to your walking speed when moving through lava or magma.

traits.name: Pyroclastic Burst
traits.description:
As an action, you can shatter your rocky carapace and release a cloud of blisteringly hot magma, ash, and stone around you. Every creature within 10 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 fire damage and 1d6 bludgeoning damage. Regardless of the result, if a creature in the area is of size Large or smaller, it is knocked prone.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Pyroclastic Burst
actions.description: You shatter your rocky carapace and release a cloud of blisteringly hot magma, ash, and stone around you. Every creature within 10 feet of you must make a DC {dc-con} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 fire damage and 1d6 bludgeoning damage. Regardless of the result of their saving throw, if a creature in the area is of size Large or smaller, it is knocked prone.

subraces.name: Mineral Genasi
subraces.description:
The Plane of Minerals holds all the riches of the earth within it, and you are a similar treasure to those around you. Solid, dependable, and giving of yourself, you enrich the lives of those around you. However, you may be susceptible to the weaknesses of avarice and may covet the material treasures of others.

Mineral genasi, like most other genasi with some elemental earth energy, often have skin formed from earthen materials. Unlike others, they rarely have dull or rocky colorations, instead being coated in precious metals, jewels, or at the very least stone like fine marble. Gemstone eyes are also not uncommon. As such, they can rarely pass for human, but often their birth is interpreted as a sign of some divine favor, even going so far as to be mistaken for aasimar.

traits.name: Gemcutter's Eye
traits.description: You have proficiency in jeweler's tools and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make to use them.

traits.name: Enrich
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, as an action, you can temporarily bolster the mind and body of a creature you touch by infusing them with minerals. The affected creature has advantage on saving throws for an ability score of your choice for 1 hour and gains temporary hit points equal to your level. This is not a magical effect and cannot be dispelled.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Enrich
actions.description: You can temporarily bolster the mind and body of a creature you touch by infusing them with minerals. The affected creature has advantage on saving throws for an ability score of your choice for 1 hour and gains {level} temporary hit points. This is not a magical effect and cannot be dispelled.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: Your skin is shot through with metal or gemstone. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.name: Razor's Edge
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can reshape one or both of your hands into a razor-sharp crystalline blade that you can use as a natural melee weapon. The blades do 1d8 slashing damage and have the finesse and light properties, but while a hand is transformed it cannot precisely manipulate anything, perform the somatic component of spells, or wield other weapons, magic items, or other specialized equipment. Changing your hands back requires a bonus action.

traits.name: Transmute
traits.description: You can spend 1 minute to convert 1 cubic inch of metal, stone, or gemstone that you are touching into a different earthen material of equivalent value.

subraces.name: Mist Genasi
subraces.description:
Mist is a veil, a keeper of mystery, and as such you delight in collecting the secrets of others. You aren't necessarily a gossip, but everyone knows that you know, and you aren't averse to making a bit of coin from your knowledge. On the other hand, you are incredibly private, and despise when others delve into your own secrets. Mist can be warm and comforting as a sauna or bitterly cold enough to sap the life from your body, as those who plan to cross you would do well to remember.

Mist genasi are the pale reflections of smoke genasi, looking as if much of the color has leeched out of them. Most of their hair goes grey in their teens, becoming immaterial near the ends and stirring in every breath of air. Their grey eyes have an odd silver sheen that just can't quite be mistaken for natural, and wisps of mist sometimes spill out of their mouth when they speak. Many wear brightly colored clothing, get extreme hair cuts, or have numerous piercings to make themselves more distinct, but they all have less conspicuous outfits for when they want to sneak around.

traits.name: Collector of Secrets
traits.description: You may choose proficiency in two of the following skills: Insight, Investigation, Perception, or Stealth.

traits.name: Boil or Freeze
traits.description: When you complete a long rest, you can choose resistance to either fire or cold damage.

traits.name: Hazy Outline
traits.description: You can hide when only lightly obscured by cloudy substances like fog, smoke, and mist. Your vision is less impaired in areas that are similarly obscured, treating heavy obscurement as light obscurement and ignoring light obscurement.

traits.name: Fog Bank
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to create a 30-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on a point within 60 feet of you. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the 1 hour or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Fog Bank
actions.description: You create a 30-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on a point within 60 feet of you. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the 1 hour or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

traits.name: Conductive Vapor
traits.description:
As a reaction when you take lightning damage, you can release a blast of steam to disperse the energy. You gain resistance to the triggering damage. Additionally, all creatures within 5 feet of you take lightning damage equal to a quarter of the dice rolled to determine the triggering damage, rounded down (minimum one die). For example, if you are hit with 10d8 lightning damage, creatures within 5 feet of you take 2d8 lightning damage.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Conductive Vapor
actions.description: When you take lightning damage, you can release a blast of steam to disperse the energy. You gain resistance to the triggering damage. Additionally, all creatures within 5 feet of you take lightning damage equal to a quarter of the dice rolled to determine the triggering damage, rounded down (minimum one die).

subraces.name: Ooze Genasi
subraces.description:
After a lifetime of people being repulsed by their appearance, many ooze genasi are quite jaded towards other people. You prefer your own company or that of other outcasts, and are often unwilling to help others without seeing some benefit to yourself. On the other hand, you are susceptible to blind loyalty towards those who treat you kindly, ignoring some of the flaws you would normally be quick to spot.

Ooze genasi can range from those who look nearly human beyond a sickly tint to their eyes or skin to amorphous yet humanoid shapes that look like melted wax. Rarely are they accounted beautiful by the standards of most other races. Their skin is often coated with a slime that ruins any clothes they wear, and many who flee to isolated homes in the wild go without to save themselves the pointless exertion of trying to clean them.

traits.name: Swamp Thing
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against the poisoned condition, as well as resistance to poison and acid damage.

traits.name: Abnormal Anatomy
traits.description: Your internal organs are in different positions than most people would expect them to be. As such, when an enemy rolls a critical hit with an attack roll or makes a cunning strike against you, they must confirm the additional damage by rolling a d4. On a roll of 1, any additional damage from the cunning strike or critical hit is negated.

traits.name: Cutaneous Respiration
traits.description:
You can breathe both air and water, and you do so by taking in oxygen through your skin. As such, you can breathe effectively as long as some portion of your skin is still exposed to viable air or water.

However, you are incapable of willingly holding your breath.

traits.name: Slime Wave
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can cause the slippery ooze that coats you to erupt outward. The area in a 15-foot radius around you becomes difficult terrain. Each creature except you standing in the area when you use this ability, that enters the area, or ends its turn there must succeed a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or fall prone.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a long rest before doing so again.

actions.name: Slime Wave
actions.description: You cause the slippery ooze that coats you to erupt outward. The area in a 15-foot radius around you becomes difficult terrain. Each creature except you standing in the area when you use this ability, that enters the area, or ends its turn there must succeed a DC {dc-con} Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

subraces.name: Radiance Genasi
subraces.description:
Many people mistakenly identify radiance genasi as aasimar, and while technically incorrect, they're not far off. As a radiance genasi, you are confident in your beauty and power. From birth you have probably been viewed with awe and showered with the best things in life, including a top-notch education at a temple or academy. This may have left you with a number of flaws such as vanity or a tendency to be be overconfident or self-centered. This is tempered by the fact that you likely ended up in the care of goodly people who tried to instill kindness and generosity within you as well.

While some have skin in tones natural for the race of their Prime relatives, radiance genasi can be born with brilliantly colored skin in any shade you could think of. Some even have opalescent skin or slowly change colors over the course of few days. Tiny motes of light often float around them like stars, and glowing irises and hair are quite common. Most have access to rich fabrics, and jewels are of particular fascination to them for their refractive properties.

traits.name: Radiant Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to radiant damage

traits.name: Brightflame
traits.description: Light and heat are simply two sides of the same shining coin. Whenever you would deal fire damage to a creature, you can convert half that damage to radiant damage instead. You determine the amount of radiant damage after rolling for fire damage but before applying resistances to damage.

traits.name: Overload
traits.description: When you complete a long rest, you can choose one creature other than yourself and infuse them with positive energy. Roll a number of d4s equal to your Constitution modifier. The affected creature has their hit point maximum increased by the resulting amount until they complete a long rest.

actions.name: Overload
actions.description: When you complete a long rest, you can choose one creature other than yourself and infuse them with positive energy. The affected creature has their hit point maximum increased by {mod-con}d4 until they complete a long rest.

traits.name: Inner Radiance
traits.description:
You can cause your body to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius around you and dim light for 10 feet beyond that, requiring no action to initiate or end this effect. Magical darkness created by a spell of 2nd level or lower does not affect this light.

Additionally, as a bonus action you can create up to five fist-sized orbs of light that float within 120 feet of you. Each one sheds dim light in a color of your choosing in a 10-foot radius around them. You can use your bonus action on subsequent turns to move the orbs up to 60 feet, but they cannot move more than 120 feet away from you. You can extinguish them at will, requiring no action.

actions.name: Inner Radiance
actions.description: You can cause your body to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius around you and dim light for 10 feet beyond that. Magical darkness created by a spell of 2nd level or lower does not affect this light.

actions.name: Inner Radiance
actions.description: You create up to five fist-sized orbs of light that float within 120 feet of you. Each one sheds dim light in a color of your choosing in a 10-foot radius around them. You can use your bonus action on subsequent turns to move the orbs up to 60 feet, but they cannot move more than 120 feet away from you. You can extinguish them at will, requiring no action.

subraces.name: Salt Genasi
subraces.description:
You do not understand most of the actions others take, nor do you particularly enjoy their presence. Your greatest desire is to be left alone, in a world that is not changed by the random whims of every passing being. Despite this, you have a fascination with novelties, and often build collections of mundane items that have piqued your interest.

Salt genasi have pale white or brown skin, often with a similarly colored powder or light crusting of crystals on their skin. Even when they are found within the societies of others, they tend to be loners and care little for the application of fashion or beauty standards. While they may not look it, salt genasi can live twice if not three times as long as most humans or genasi.

traits.name: Archivist
traits.description: The static nature of books appeals to most salt genasi. This, combined with their often inherited collections of preserved objects, means that they generally have an expansive knowledge of the past. You have proficiency in the History skill.

traits.name: Toughness
traits.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

traits.name: Dehydrate
traits.description:
You can satisfy your own need for water by stealing the moisture from another creature. As an action, you can draw moisture from another creature and force it to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on all attack rolls and saving throws for an hour or until it can drink sufficient water to rehydrate itself. If you have any levels of exhaustion, they are removed. If you do not, you can roll a number of d6s equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1). You regain a number of hit points equal to the total. Constructs and other creatures without liquid within their bodies are immune to this feature, and plants automatically fail the saving throw.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Dehydrate
actions.description: You draw moisture from another creature and force it to make a DC {dc-con} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on all attack rolls and saving throws for an hour or until it can drink sufficient water to rehydrate itself. If you have any levels of exhaustion, they are removed. If you do not, you regain {mod-con}d6 hit points. Constructs and other creatures without liquid within their bodies are immune to this feature, and plants automatically fail the saving throw.

traits.name: Salt in the Wound
traits.description:
As a reaction when you make a successful weapon attack, you can cause the wound to become exceptionally painful. The target takes necrotic damage equal to half your level (rounded up) at the start of its next turn.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Salt in the Wound
actions.description: When you make a successful weapon attack, you can cause the wound to become exceptionally painful. The target takes <{level} / 2> necrotic damage at the start of its next turn.

subraces.name: Smoke Genasi
subraces.description:
As the manifestation of a para-elemental plane born from the finality of flame carried on the roiling rise of air, you have little in the way of motivation, simply drifting where the universe may take you. While you are not hedonistic, many likely consider you lazy. Despite this, you always seem to rise through the ranks of wherever you end up (be it through luck or skill), high enough that others envy you but not so high that you might miss out on your nap.

Unsurprisingly, most smoke genasi have a lingering scent of their namesake around them, with the scent growing stronger on the rare occasions they grow irritated or excited. Quite often their hair billows in a cloud-like fashion, becoming wispy and immaterial near the ends. All their features generally have a dark cast to them, though their eyes may occasionally flare with fiery light. They tend to wear clothes in similar colors, and these clothes are always well-made, practical, and comfortable. There is no point in fancy clothes if you can't breathe or stretch in them.

traits.name: Lazy Man's Luck
traits.description: When you fail an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check by 1, you instead succeed.

traits.name: Black Lung
traits.description:
You can breathe normally inside any area covered in nonmagical poisonous gas, smoke, or other gaseous substance. If the substance is magical, you have advantage on saving throws against its effects.

Additionally, you may use a bonus action to inhale such substances, clearing a 10-foot radius centered on you.

actions.name: Black Lung
actions.description: You harmlessly inhale a 10-foot radius of a nonmagical gaseous substance such as poisonous gas or smoke, clearing it.

traits.name: Hazy Outline
traits.description: You can hide when only lightly obscured by cloudy substances like fog, smoke, and mist. Your vision is less impaired in areas that are similarly obscured, treating heavy obscurement as light obscurement and ignoring light obscurement.

traits.name: Miasma
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can choose a point within 60 feet. Black smoke spreads out from the target in a 10-foot radius, moving around corners. The area is heavily obscured. The smoke persists for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Miasma
actions.description: Choose a point within 60 feet. Black smoke spreads out from the target in a 10-foot radius, moving around corners. The area is heavily obscured. The smoke persists for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it.

traits.name: Dissipate
traits.description:
As a reaction when you would take nonmagical damage or fire damage, you can momentarily turn into smoke. You gain resistance to the triggering damage and all other nonmagical or fire damage until the start of your next turn, and you have advantage on Dexterity and Constitution saving throws.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Dissipate
actions.description: When you would take nonmagical damage or fire damage, you can momentarily turn into smoke. You gain resistance to the triggering damage and all other nonmagical or fire damage until the start of your next turn, and you have advantage on Dexterity and Constitution saving throws.

subraces.name: Vacuum Genasi
subraces.description:
You desire nothing. Truly, literally, nothing. Things have no meaning and power is something for others to hold. This sets you apart from most other beings in an irreconcilable way, but that doesn't matter either. Even your movement is odd, because how does nothing move?

Vacuum genasi generally have purple-black skin with shimmering metallic markings scattered across it. Their eyes and hair are equally dark. However, from time to time, a ripple of immaterialness will roll through their flesh, making them appear wispy or even disappear from sight completely.

traits.name: Needless
traits.description: You do not need to breathe, eat or drink, though you can if you wish to.

traits.name: Embrace Emptiness
traits.description:
You have proficiency in Stealth. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Embrace Emptiness
actions.description: You magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw.

traits.name: Suffocate
traits.description: As a bonus action, you create a field of vacuum around yourself with a 10-foot radius for 1 minute. The field is not detectable by mundane senses before it is entered, nor does it register as magical to divination magic. Any poisonous gases, smoke, fog or other gaseous substances are cleared within the area for the duration and take one round after the effect ends to reenter the space. A creature within the field begins suffocating and has disadvantage on any attack rolls, ability checks, or saving throws using Strength, Dexterity, or Intelligence due to the lack of oxygen. Creatures that do not breathe are immune to the effect, and a creature that is holding its breath when it enters the field ignores the effects.

actions.name: Suffocate
actions.description: You create a field of vacuum around yourself with a 10-foot radius for 1 minute. The field is not detectable by mundane senses before it is entered, nor does it register as magical to divination magic. Any poisonous gases, smoke, fog or other gaseous substances are cleared within the area for the duration and take one round after the effect ends to reenter the space. A creature within the field begins suffocating and has disadvantage on any attack rolls, ability checks, or saving throws using Strength, Dexterity, or Intelligence due to the lack of oxygen. Creatures that do not breathe are immune to the effect, and a creature that is holding its breath when it enters the field ignores the effects.

subraces.name: Water Genasi
subraces.description:
The lapping of waves, the spray of sea foam on the wind, the ocean depths тАФ all of these things call to your heart as the descendant of a water elemental such as a marid. You wander freely and take pride in your independence, though others might consider you selfish.

Most water genasi look as if they just finished bathing, with moisture collecting on their skin and hair. They smell of fresh rain and clean water. Blue or green skin is common, and most have overlarge eyes, blue-black in color. A water genasi's hair might float freely, swaying and waving as if underwater, and their voices have undertones reminiscent of whale song or trickling streams.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You can breathe water as well as air, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.  In addition, your range of vision is doubled underwater.

traits.name: Shared Breath
traits.description: You can extend your ability to breathe both air and water to creatures of your choosing within 10 feet of you. If a creature leaves the area or you are incapacitated, the effect ends and they must hold their breath as normal at the start of their next turn.

traits.name: Call to the Wave
traits.description:
You know the Shape Water cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Create Or Destroy Water spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Dancing Wave spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast create or destroy water or dancing wave with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

name: Genasi

description: Long after their remains have turned to dust, the spirit of an individual can linger still. There are as many reasons for a ghost to haunt the world as there are folk in it. Ghosts are forcibly tied to the material plane by deep magic and are only able to move on when their unfinished business is concluded. Most ghosts awaken confused, and must discover what it is that holds their attachment to the world of the living, as if discovering a final piece of themselves that they must confront before entering the next phase of their existence.

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.description: While upon the material plane, you can see into the ethereal plane up to a distance of 30 feet, and vice-versa.

traits.name: Ethereal Jaunt
traits.description: As a bonus action, you enter the Ethereal Plane. At the end of your next turn, return to the plane you originated from in the spot you currently occupy. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain expended uses of it when you complete long rest.

actions.name: Ethereal Jaunt
actions.description: You enter the Ethereal Plane. At the end of your next turn, return to the plane you originated from in the spot you currently occupy. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

traits.name: Ethereal Rest
traits.description: When you take a short or long rest, you become inert, entering the ethereal plane until the end of your rest. While inert you enter deeper into the Ethereal Plane, and are completely unaware of the goings-on of other planes. You cannot leave your inert state of your own volition until the required duration of your short or long rest has passed.

traits.name: Speak with Dead
traits.description: You can cast the Speak with Dead spell once and regain the ability to so do when you finish a short rest. If you cast the spell during a short or long rest, you can make a Wisdom (Insight) check to speak with a deceased soul of your choice that is also upon the Ethereal Plane. The difficulty of the check is determined by the Dungeon Master, and might include such factors as where you entered the Ethereal Plane from, your familiarity with the individual, or the availability of the individual's spirit.

traits.name: Ghostly Nature
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed. You are immune to poison damage, and you can't be diseased or poisoned. You don't require air, food, drink, or sleep. If your ghost dies, your essence is irrevocably dispersed, and you are unable to be resurrected.

traits.name: Soulbound
traits.description: Your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Undead: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

name: Ghost

description: Ghouls are undead borne to unlife through envy and greed, and they are consumed with desire for all the things they never have attained in life, usually wealth. While most ghouls lack the ambition to rise above mere graverobbing and feasting upon the recently deceased (or even the occasional gravedigger), some recall their unmet ambitions in more detail, and become obsessed with them.

traits.name: Ghoulish Claws
traits.description: You are proficient with your unarmed strikes, which deal 1d6 slashing damage on a hit.

traits.name: Paralyzing Strike
traits.description: When you hit a humanoid or beast with your claws, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier). If the creature fails its saving throw, it is paralyzed for up to 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

actions.name: Paralyzing Strike
actions.description: When you hit a humanoid or beast with your claws, you can force the target to make a DC {dc-wis} Constitution saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is paralyzed for up to 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Ghoulish Nature
traits.description: You are immune to poison damage and can't be diseased or poisoned. You must maintain a diet of rotting flesh (at least 72 hours after death), in equal portion to the amount of food a living member of your original race would require. Your muscles require the same amount of rest that your original race would in order to stave off exhaustion.

traits.name: Soulbound
traits.description: Your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Undead: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

name: Ghoul

description: Hyena-like humanoids created by the demon lord Yeenoghu, gnolls are a primal people.  Almost always living as nomadic tribes, they are infamous for attacking at random, without warning.  Expert hunters and trackers, gnolls who are not savage beasts are often recruited for help in finding people or things.

traits.name: Bite
traits.description: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Carrion Eater
traits.description: You are immune to disease.

traits.name: Predatory Instincts
traits.description: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Nature, Perception, Stealth, or Survival.

traits.name: Rampage
traits.description:
When you score a critical hit or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, you can use a bonus action to move up to your speed and make a bite attack against a creature of your choice.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Rampage
actions.description: When you score a critical hit or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, you can move up to your speed and make a bite attack against a creature of your choice.

name: Gnoll

description: A constant hum of busy activity pervades the warrens and neighborhoods where gnomes form their close-knit communities. Louder sounds punctuate the hum: a crunch of grinding gears here, a minor explosion there, a yelp of surprise or triumph, and especially bursts of laughter.
