Gnomes take delight in life, enjoying every moment of invention, exploration, investigation, creation, and play.

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
traits.description: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saves against magic.

traits.name: Natural Illusionist
traits.description: You know the Minor Illusion cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for it.

traits.name: Speak with Small Beasts
traits.description: Through sound and gestures, you may communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts.

traits.name: Artificer's Lore
traits.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to magical, alchemical, or technological items, you can add twice your proficiency bonus instead of any other proficiency bonus that may apply.

traits.name: Tinker
traits.description: You have proficiency with tinker's tools. Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time. When you create a device, choose an item of Adventuring Equipment that costs 20 gp or less. The device replicates the function of that piece of equipment.

traits.name: Superior Darkvision
traits.description: Your darkvision has a range of 120 feet.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.description: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

name: Gnome

description: Giff are tall, broad-shouldered folk with hippo-like features. Some have smooth skin, while others have short bristles on their faces and the tops of their heads. As beings of impressive size and unforgettable appearance, giff are noticed wherever they go.

traits.name: Astral Sailor
traits.description: You have proficiency with navigator's tools and astral vehicles or water vehicles.

traits.name: Firearm Expert
traits.description:
You have proficiency with all firearms and with tinker's tools, and can reload or unjam any firearm as an object interaction.

In addition, attacking at long range with a firearm doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack roll.

traits.name: Headfirst Charge
traits.description: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line towards a Large or smaller creature and hit them with a melee attack, they must make a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus) or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Headfirst Charge
actions.description: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line towards a Large or smaller creature and hit them with a melee attack, they must make a DC {dc-str} Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Giant Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, and lift and you have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

name: Giff

description: The warlike githyanki and the contemplative githzerai are a sundered people - two cultures that utterly despise one another. The brutal githyanki are trained from birth as warriors, while the githzerai hone their minds to a razor's edge in their fortresses within Limbo. But before there were githyanki or githzerai, these creatures were a single race enslaved by the illithids.

traits.name: Psychic Resilience
traits.description: You have resistance to psychic damage.

subraces.name: Githghaik
subraces.description: Though most gith were able to break away from their illithid masters, one hidden colony of illithids managed to be insulated from their rebellion.

traits.name: Expert Hunter
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Survival skill.

traits.name: Githghaik Psionics
traits.description: You know the Mage Hand cantrip, and the hand is invisible when you cast the cantrip with this trait. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Command spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Hold Person spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast them with this trait, they don't require components.

traits.name: Astral Knowledge
traits.description: You can mystically access a reservoir of experiences of entities connected to the Astral Plane. Whenever you finish a long rest, you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice and with one weapon or tool of your choice, as you momentarily project your consciousness into the Astral Plane. These proficiencies last until the end of your next long rest.

traits.name: Githyanki Psionics
traits.description: You know the Mage Hand cantrip, and the hand is invisible when you cast the cantrip with this trait. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Jump spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Misty Step spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast them with this trait, they don't require components.

traits.name: Mental Discipline
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against the charmed and frightened conditions.

traits.name: Githzerai Psionics
traits.description: You know the Mage Hand cantrip, and the hand is invisible when you cast the cantrip with this trait. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Shield spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Detect Thoughts spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast them with this trait, they don't require components.

name: Gith

description: Goblins occupy an uneasy place in a dangerous world, and they react by lashing out at any creatures they believe they can bully. Cunning in battle and cruel in victory, goblins are fawning and servile in defeat.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.description: You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

traits.name: Goblin Grit
traits.description: You have resistance to fire and psychic damage. In addition, when you are wearing no armor, your AC is equal to 11 + your Dexterity modifier.

traits.name: Animal Tamer
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Animal Handling skill.

traits.name: Lavasteppe Grit
traits.description: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky or subterranean environments.

traits.name: Agile Climber
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Fury of the Small
traits.description: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Fury of the Small
actions.description: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal {level} extra damage to the creature.

traits.name: Urban Cunning
traits.description: You have proficiency with thieves' tools and in the Sleigth of Hand skill.

name: Goblin

description: Goliaths, also known as half-giants, are towering humanoids that resemble all manner of giant-kin.  Though not truly related to giants, they tie their history to the ordning, and most goliaths worship giant gods.

traits.name: Giant Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift and you have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

subraces.name: Cloud Goliath
subraces.description: A cloud goliath prefers physical distance from other creatures, and have reputations for paying little heed to the plights of the world.

traits.name: Atmospheric Arcana
traits.description: You know the Light cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Fog Cloud spell as a 1st level spell once with this trait. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Misty Step spell once with this trait. You regain the ability to cast these spells when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them.

traits.name: Gentle Descent
traits.description: At the end of a fall, you only take 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 20 feet you fall, rather than every 10 feet. In addition, you do not land prone, even if you take damage from the fall.

subraces.name: Fire Goliath
subraces.description: As a member of the fire goliath, you find comfort by the heat of the forge or in warm, even volcanic environments.

traits.name: Legacy of War
traits.description:
You learn one 1st-degree Martial Exploit and can use it once with this trait. For the purposes of using the exploit, your Exploit Die is a d4.

If the exploit requires your target to make a saving throw to resist its effects, the saving throw DC is 8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus. You regain the use of your exploit when you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Master Metallurgist
traits.description: You have proficiency with blacksmith's tools.

traits.name: Heat of the Forge
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage and are acclimated to extreme heat.

subraces.name: Frost Goliath
subraces.description: Frost goliaths are fierce and hardy in battle, and they take pride in their scars and grisly trophies taken from their fallen enemies, which they fashion into armor, weapons, and jewelry.

traits.name: Glacial Fortitude
traits.description: When you fail a Constitution saving throw, you can reroll the save and must use the new roll. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

actions.name: Glacial Fortitude
actions.description: When you fail a Constitution saving throw, you can reroll the save and must use the new roll.

traits.name: Tanner
traits.description: You have proficiency with leatherworker's tools.

traits.name: Arctic Born
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage and are accliamted to extreme cold.

subraces.name: Golyclops
subraces.description: Golyclopses are derived from cyclopes. Legend says that cyclopes are derived from a line of giants who had their eyes plucked out by their god, Grolantor, and replaced with one large eye in the center of their forehead.

traits.name: Depth-Impaired
traits.description: You have disadvantage on any ranged attack at a range greater than 30 feet.

traits.name: Retinal Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being blinded.

traits.name: All-Seeing Eye
traits.description:
You have advantage on saving throws against illusions.

In addition, when you make an Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern whether something within 30 feet of you is an illusion, you can use your reaction to automatically succeed on the check. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: All-Seeing Eye
actions.description: When you make an Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern whether something within 30 feet of you is an illusion, you can choose to automatically succeed on the check.

traits.name: Grotesque Coercion
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

subraces.name: Hill Goliath
subraces.description: Hill goliaths have a tendency to doze off in broad daylight atop whatever hill they find themselves on. They are prone to fits of violent destruction, especially when they realize someone has tried to deceive them or make a fool of them.

traits.name: Superior Slumber
traits.description: When you finish a long rest, you regain all expended hit dice, rather than half.

traits.name: Rampage
traits.description:
As a bonus action, you can go on a rampage, which lasts until the start of your next turn. While on a rampage, when you roll damage for a melee weapon attack using Strength, your Strength modifier is doubled.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Rampage
actions.description: You go on a rampage, which lasts until the start of your next turn. While on a rampage, when you roll damage for a melee weapon attack using Strength, your Strength modifier is doubled.

subraces.name: Stone Goliath
subraces.description: At the highest mountain peaks dwell the reclusive stone goliaths, wandering a bleak realm of rock, wind, and cold. Their bodies look as if they are carved from mountain stone and give them great physical power. Their hearts are infused with the cold regard of their frigid realm, leaving each goliath with the responsibility to earn a place in the tribe or die trying.

traits.name: Stone's Endurance
traits.description: You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Stone's Endurance
actions.description: When you take damage, you can reduce the damage by 1d12 + {mod-con}.

traits.name: Mountain Born
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage and are acclimated to high altitudes.

subraces.name: Storm Goliath
subraces.description: Goliaths with storm ancestry believe that storm giants were too proud to willingly create lesser, humanoid offspring and too powerful to be forced to, so they were magically subdued and had their blood stolen.

traits.name: Storm Strike
traits.description: You know the Zap cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Thunderwave spell as a 1st level spell once with this trait. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Lightning-Flash Strike spell once with this trait. You regain the ability to cast these spells when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them.

traits.name: Tempestuous Resilience
traits.description: You have resistance to lightning damage.

name: Goliath

description: Grung are aggressive froglike humanoids found in rain forests and tropical jungles. They are fiercely territorial and see themselves as superior to most other creatures.

traits.name: Sticky Fingers
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.  In addition, at 3rd level, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You can breathe air as well as water.

traits.name: Poison Resilience
traits.description: You have immunity to poison damage and the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.description: Your maximum jump distance for high and long jumps is doubled, and you do not need to take a running start. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

name: Grung

description: Bullywugs consider themselves the right and proper rulers of the swamps. They follow an etiquette of sorts when dealing with outsiders and each other, subject to the whims and fancies of their leader-a self-styled lord of the muck. Bullywugs introduce themselves with grand-sounding titles, make great shows of bowing and debasing themselves before their superiors, and endlessly vie to win their superiors' favor.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You can breathe air as well as water, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Court Culture
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Society skill.

traits.name: Speak with Frogs
traits.description: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with frogs, toads, and the like.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.description: Your maximum jump distance for high and long jumps is doubled, and you do not need to take a running start. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

traits.name: Swamp Camouflage
traits.description: Whenever you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check made to hide in swamp-like terrain, you are considered proficient in the Stealth skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

name: Bullywug

description:
Hadozees are people with simian features that long ago adapted to live among the tall trees of their home world. They are natural climbers, with feet as dexterous as their hands, even to the extent of having opposable thumbs. Membranes of skin hang loosely from their arms and legs. When stretched taut, these membranes enable a hadozee to glide.

The first hadozees were hunted by large natural predators. To survive in this hostile environment, they developed an instinctual sense of community. Today, that same instinct compels many hadozees to cultivate friendships, knowing there is safety in numbers. They are particularly fond of sailing, and many crews on the seas are full of hadozee.

traits.name: Dexterous Feet
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can use your feet to manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, or pick up or set down a Tiny object.  In addition, you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Glide
traits.description:
If you are not incapacitated or wearing heavy armor, you can extend your skin membranes and glide. When you do so, you can perform the following aerial maneuvers:
  • When you fall, you can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot you descend.
  • When you would take damage from a fall, you can use your reaction to reduce the fall's damage to 0.

traits.name: Hadozee Resilience
traits.description:
The magic that runs in your veins heightens your natural defenses. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a d6. Add your proficiency bonus to the number rolled, and reduce the damage you take by an amount equal to that total (minimum of 0 damage).

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Hadozee Resilience
actions.description: When you take damage, you can reduce the damage by 1d6 + {prof}.

traits.name: Astral Sailor
traits.description: You have proficiency with navigator's tools and astral vehicles or water vehicles.

name: Hadozee

description:
Harengons originated in the Feywild, where they spoke Sylvan and embodied the spirit of freedom and travel. In time, these rabbitfolk hopped into other worlds, bringing the fey realm's exuberance with them and learning new languages as they went.

Harengons are bipedal, with the characteristic long feet of the rabbits they resemble and fur in a variety of colors. They share the keen senses and powerful legs of leporine creatures and are full of energy, like a wound-up spring. Harengons are blessed with a little fey luck, and they often find themselves a few fortunate feet away from dangers during adventures.

traits.name: Hare-Trigger
traits.description: You can add your proficiency bonus to your initiative rolls.

traits.name: Leporine Senses
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Lucky Footwork
traits.description: When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to roll a d4 and add it to the save, potentially turning the failure into a success. You can't use this reaction if you're prone or your speed is 0.

actions.name: Lucky Footwork
actions.description: When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, you can roll a d4 and add it to the save, potentially turning the failure into a success.  You can't do so if you're prone or your speed is 0.

traits.name: Rabbit Hop
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can jump a number of feet equal to five times your proficiency bonus, without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this trait only if your speed is greater than 0. You can use it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Rabbit Hop
actions.description: You jump up to <{prof} * 5> feet, without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this trait only if your speed is greater than 0.

name: Harengon

description: Half-dwarves often showcase the best of both of their parents' heritage. Like dwarves, they often place high value on honor and reputation. And, although they are not considered full members of their respective dwarven clans, most half-dwarves will go to great lengths to prevent bringing shame upon the clan of their dwarven parent.

traits.name: Dwarven Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

traits.name: Tool Proficiency
traits.description: You gain proficiency in one type of artisan's tools of your choice, and you can add double your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make that uses your chosen set of artisan's tools.

traits.name: Dwarven Versatility
traits.description: You have proficiency with one skill and one tool of your choice, and you can add double your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make that uses your chosen set of tools.

traits.name: Dwarven Toughness
traits.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

traits.name: Relentless Endurance
traits.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Relentless Endurance
actions.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Stone Marcher
traits.description: When you use the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost you extra movement on that turn.

traits.name: Master Sailor
traits.description: You have proficiency with navigator's tools and astral vehicles or water vehicles.

traits.name: Fiery Weapons
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can set a weapon you are holding ablaze.  For the next minute, attacks with that weapon deal an additional 1d4 fire damage on a hit, and the weapon shines bright light in a 10 foot radius and dim light 10 feet beyond that.  You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Fiery Weapons
actions.description: You set a weapon you are holding ablaze.  For the next minute, attacks with that weapon deal an additional 1d4 fire damage on a hit, and the weapon shines bright light in a 10 foot radius and dim light 10 feet beyond that.

traits.name: Duergar Psionics
traits.description: When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Enlarge/Reduce spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Invisibility spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

name: Half-Dwarf

description: Walking in two worlds but truly belonging to neither, half-elves combine what some say are the best qualities of their elf and human parents: human curiosity, inventiveness, and ambition tempered by the refined senses, love of nature, and artistic tastes of the elves.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Skill Versatility
traits.description: You have proficiency with two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Radiant Soul
traits.description: When you succeed on a death save, you can regain a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Mirage
traits.description: You can cast the Blur spell once using this trait.  Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.  You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Drow Magic
traits.description: You know the Dancing Lights cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Faerie Fire spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Darkness spell once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Seasonal Fey Step
traits.description: Choose the season you are bound to.  Unlike a full-blooded eladrin, you cannot change your season. An eladrin might choose the season that is present in the world or perhaps the season that most closely matches the eladrin's current emotional state. For example, an eladrin might shift to autumn if filled with contentment, another eladrin could change to winter if plunged into sorrow, still another might be bursting with joy and become an eladrin of spring, and fury might cause an eladrin to change to summer.

traits.name: Autumnal Fey Step
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. When you reach 3rd level, immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

levels.1: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
levels.3: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a DC {dc-cha} Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

traits.name: Vernal Fey Step
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. When you reach 3rd level, when you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

levels.1: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
levels.3: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

traits.name: Estival Fey Step
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. When you reach 3rd level, immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

levels.1: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
levels.3: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes {dc-cha} fire damage.

traits.name: Hibernal Fey Step
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. When you reach 3rd level, when you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

levels.1: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
levels.3: You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a DC {dc-cha} Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

traits.name: Burning Gaze
traits.description:
Your heritage burns brightest in your eyes. If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of you and the two of you can see each other, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failed save, the creature is blinded for 1 minute and takes 3d6 fire damage. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the blinded effect. The effect also ends if the creature starts its turn more than 30 feet away from you.

You can use this ability once, after which you must complete a long rest before doing so again.

actions.name: Burning Gaze
actions.description:
If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of you and the two of you can see each other, you can force the creature to make a DC {dc-cha} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is blinded for 1 minute and takes 3d6 fire damage. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the blinded effect. The effect also ends if the creature starts its turn more than 30 feet away from you.

You can use this ability once, after which you must complete a long rest before doing so again.

traits.name: Arcane Gift
traits.description: You know one cantrip of your choice from the Arcane spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Blessing of the Moonweaver
traits.description: You know the Light cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast Sleep once, and it recharges after a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast Invisibility (Self Only) once, and it recharges after a long rest. You do not need the material components required of the spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, and lift.

traits.name: Rock Climber
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can breathe air and water

traits.name: Friend of the Sea
traits.description: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed.

traits.name: Blessing of the Raven Queen
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

levels.1: You can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
levels.3: You can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, and you gain resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

traits.name: Stargazer
traits.description: You have spent your life studying the stars. If you can see the night sky, you can cast the Augury spell without expending a spell slot or material components. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Mask of the City
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by crowds, smoke, structures, and other urban features.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

name: Half-Elf

description: When alliances between humans and orcs are sealed by marriages, half-orcs are born. Some half-orcs rise to become proud chiefs of orc tribes, their human blood giving them an edge over their full-blooded orc rivals. Some venture into the world to prove their worth among humans and other more civilized races. Many of these become adventurers, achieving greatness for their mighty deeds and notoriety for their barbaric customs and savage fury.

traits.name: Menacing
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

traits.name: Relentless Endurance
traits.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Relentless Endurance
actions.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Savage Attacks
traits.description: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

name: Half-Orc

description: The comforts of home are the goals of most halflings' lives: a place to settle in peace and quiet, far from marauding monsters and clashing armies. Others form nomadic bands that travel constantly, lured by the open road and the wide horizon to discover the wonders of new lands and peoples. Halflings work readily with others, and they are loyal to their friends, whether halfling or otherwise. They can display remarkable ferocity when their friends, families, or communities are threatened.

traits.name: Lucky
traits.description: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die. You must use the new result, even if it is a 1.

traits.name: Brave
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Nimble
traits.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

traits.name: Silent Speech
traits.description: You can speak telepathically to any creature within 30 feet of you. The creature understands you only if the two of you share a language. You can speak telepathically in this way to one creature at a time.

traits.name: Naturally Stealthy
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only obscured by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

traits.name: Timberwalk
traits.description: Ability checks made to track you are at disadvantage and you can move through difficult terrain made of non-magical plants and overgrowth without expending extra movement.

traits.name: Children of the Woods
traits.description: You know the Druidcraft cantrip. At 3rd level, you can cast the Entangle spell once per long rest. At 5th level, you can cast Spike Growth spell once per long rest. These spells don't require the material components normally required. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Astute Merchant
traits.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence check related to appraising the value of a good or service, you have advantage on the check.

traits.name: Keen Sense
traits.description: You can take the Search action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Stout Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance to poison damage.

name: Halfling

description: Where wishing fails, ancient magic can offer a heart's desire-at least, for a time. Hexbloods are individuals infused with eldritch magic, fey energy, or mysterious witchcraft. Some who enter into bargains with hags gain their deepest wishes but eventually find themselves transformed. These changes evidence a hag's influence: ears that split in forked points, skin in wild shades, lengthy hair that regrows if cut, and an irremovable living crown. Along with these marks, hexbloods manifest hag-like traits, such as long life, darkvision, and a variety of magical methods to beguile the senses and avoid the same.

traits.name: Ancestral Legacy
traits.description:
If you replace a race with this lineage, you gain any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.

If you don't keep any of those elements, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Ancestry
traits.description: You gain any traits that grant a climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from your original race.

traits.name: Skill Versatility
traits.description: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Fey Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Magic Token
traits.description:
As an action, you can harmlessly pull out one of your nails, a tooth, or a lock of hair. This token is imbued with magic until you finish a long rest. While the token is imbued in this way, you can use an action to send a telepathic message to the creature holding or carrying the token, as long as you are on the same plane of existence and are within 10 miles of it. The message can contain up to twenty-five words.

In addition, while you are within 10 miles of the token, you can use an action to enter a trance for 1 minute, during which you can see and hear from the token as if you were located where it is. While you are using your senses at the token's location, you are blinded and deafened in regard to your own surroundings. Afterward, the token is harmlessly destroyed.

Once you create a token using this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, at which point your missing part regrows.

actions.name: Magic Token
actions.description:
You harmlessly pull out one of your nails, a tooth, or a lock of hair. This token is imbued with magic until you finish a long rest. While the token is imbued in this way, you can use an action to send a telepathic message to the creature holding or carrying the token, as long as you are on the same plane of existence and are within 10 miles of it. The message can contain up to twenty-five words.

In addition, while you are within 10 miles of the token, you can use an action to enter a trance for 1 minute, during which you can see and hear from the token as if you were located where it is. While you are using your senses at the token's location, you are blinded and deafened in regard to your own surroundings. Afterward, the token is harmlessly destroyed.

traits.name: Hex Magic
traits.description: You can cast the Disguise Self and Hex spells with this trait. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spells slots you have.

name: Hexblood

description: War is the lifeblood of hobgoblins. Its glories are the dreams that inspire them. Its horrors don't feature in their nightmares. Cowardice is more terrible to hobgoblins than dying, for they carry their living acts into the afterlife. A hero in death becomes a hero eternal.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Saving Face
traits.description: Hobgoblins are careful not to show weakness in front of their allies, for fear of losing status. If you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check or a saving throw, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum bonus of +3). You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Saving Face
actions.description: If you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check or a saving throw, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum bonus of +3).

traits.name: Fey Gift
traits.description:
You can use this trait to take the Help action as a bonus action, and you can do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Starting at 3rd level, choose one of the options below each time you take the Help action with this trait:
  • Hospitality. You and the target of your Help action each gain a number of temporary hit points equal to 1d6 plus your proficiency bonus.
  • Passage. You and the target of your Help action each increase your walking speeds by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
  • Spite. Until the start of your next turn, the first time you or the target of your Help action hits a creature with an attack roll, that creature has disadvantage on the next attack roll that it makes within the next minute.

levels.3:
You take the Help action, and you gain one of the following benefits of your choice:
  • Hospitality. You and the target of your Help action each gain 1d6 + {prof} temporary hit points.
  • Passage. You and the target of your Help action each increase your walking speeds by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
  • Spite. Until the start of your next turn, the first time you or the target of your Help action hits a creature with an attack roll, that creature has disadvantage on the next attack roll that it makes within the next minute.

name: Hobgoblin

description: In the reckonings of most worlds, humans are the youngest of the common races, late to arrive on the world scene and short-lived in comparison to dwarves, elves, and dragons. Perhaps it is because of their shorter lives that they strive to achieve as much as they can in the years they are given. Or maybe they feel they have something to prove to the elder races, and that's why they build their mighty empires on the foundation of conquest and trade. Whatever drives them, humans are the innovators, the achievers, and the pioneers of the worlds.

traits.name: Skill Versatility
traits.description: You have proficiency with one skill of your choice

subraces.name: Cityborn Human
subraces.description: These humans hail from heavily urbanized environments, having grown up in a place where crime and disease run rampant.  They typically know how to deal with criminal activities, most of them having some experience doing so, even if only as children.

traits.name: Streetwise
traits.description: You have proficiency with thieves' tools, the Sleight of Hand skill, and can speak, read, and write Thieves' Cant.

subraces.name: Desertborn Human
subraces.description: Hailing from hot, dry environments such as deserts or plateaus, these humans are natural survivalists.  Their resilience allows them to survive in even the harshest of envrionments.

traits.name: Agile and Strong
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Athletics and Survival skills.

traits.name: Arid Wanderer
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against extreme heat. In addition, once per long rest when you would gain a level of exhuastion, you can choose to not gain a level of exhaustion.

subraces.name: Enhanced Human
subraces.description: These humans underwent significant physical enhancement through magic or technology.  They tend to be larger and stronger than other humans.

traits.name: Enhanced Physiology
traits.description:
Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

traits.name: Physical Training
traits.description: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Acrobatics, Athletics, Endurance, Sleight of Hand, or Stealth.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

subraces.name: Forestborn Human
subraces.description: These humans, hailing from forests, jungles, or even swamps, are trackers and hunters, with an innate connection to the natural world.

traits.name: Children of the Wild
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Nature skill and you gain proficiency with the herbalism kit.

traits.name: Fleet of Foot
traits.description: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

traits.name: Forest Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poisons and diseases.

traits.name: Watcher of the Woods
traits.description: Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) checks while in a forest, you are considered proficient in the Perception skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead your normal proficiency bonus.

subraces.name: Mountainborn Human
subraces.description: These humans hail from mountaintops or even subterranean cave systems.  Natural smiths and masons, these humans have cultural influence from dwarves.

traits.name: Stone People
traits.description: You have proficiency with blacksmith's tools, mason's tools, or whitesmith's tools.

traits.name: Mountaineer
traits.description: You ignore difficult terrain when moving through rocky terrain. Whenever you make a Strength (Athletics) check to climb rocks, you are considered proficient in the Athletics skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Strong as a Rock
traits.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

subraces.name: Plainsborn Human
subraces.description: These humans come from flat, rather empty land such as plains or savannahs.  Nomads and wanderers at heart, they are also usually excellent craftsmen.

traits.name: Versatile Culture
traits.description: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Crafting Expertise
traits.description: You gain proficiency in one artisan's tools of your choice. When you craft an object using the artisan's tools you're proficient with, you count as two characters working for determining the amount of gp worth of effort for every day spent creating the item, allowing you to craft objects faster than others.

subraces.name: Seaborn Human
subraces.description: From cultures that rule the waves, these humans are sailors or pirates.  Their affinity for the ships they sail, and broad cultural influence, make them renowned merchants.

traits.name: Appraiser
traits.description: You have advantage on checks to determine the value and craftwork of items.

traits.name: Master of the Seas
traits.description: You gain proficiency with vehicles (water). You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Natural Trader
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Deception and Persuasion skills. Additionally, you have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks when negotiating prices with others that aren't hostile toward you.

subraces.name: Spaceborn Human
subraces.description: Spaceborn possess no true home, wandering the Astral Sea on astral vehicles.  Seekings to chart the Astral Sea, they are an ambitious lot with an affinity for tinkering.

traits.name: Astral Sailor
traits.description: You have proficiency with navigator's tools and astral vehicles, and you suffer no disadvantage from being weightless.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.

traits.name: Versatile Training
traits.description: You gain an extra feat of your choice.

subraces.name: Winterborn Human
subraces.description: Winterborn hail from the far north, a place where one fights simply to stay alive.  Resilient, practical people, these humans know what it takes to survive.

traits.name: Courageous
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Glory Over Death
traits.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Glory Over Death
actions.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Winter Fortitude
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against extreme cold, and you have proficiency in the Survival skill.

name: Human

description:
Extraplanar invaders with heads resembling cephalopods, illithids are more accurately the consciousness borrowing the flesh of others, as they are created through use of a tadpole that destroys a victim's mind and changes their body to match the hive. Illithid adventurers are those whose ceremorphosis went wrong, causing them to remain in control.
Cereomorphosis Fault

During cereomorphosis, something went wrong which caused your body to be transformed, but your mind to remain intact. While you feel the pull of the elder brain, you are in no way bound by it. However, the mystery of what exactly caused this to happen remains. Roll on or choose an option from the Cereomorphosis Faults table to determine what allowed you to remain free.

d6 Fault
1 Your will was powerful enough to overpower the control. What caused this to be the case? Are there any other side effects of such a powerful will?
2 A god from above or below intervened. Do they demand your servitude? What is your role?
3 You made a contract with an otherworldly being. Who did you bargain with? What was your end of the deal?
4 Magic was used to attempt to stop or reverse it, but it didn't work completely. Who did the magic? Why didn't it work?
5 Another being already holds stake in your mind. Who is it? Are you truly free?
6 There was simply a random fluke, and your tadpole failed to succeed. Why was your tadpole weakened? Does it still live?

traits.name: Ancestral Legacy
traits.description:
If you replace a race with this lineage, you gain any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.

If you don't keep any of those elements, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Ancestry
traits.description: You gain any traits that grant a climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from your original race.

traits.name: Skill Versatility
traits.description: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Mind Blast
traits.description:
You can unleash a special psionic attack known as a mind blast. As an action, you force creatures of your choice within a 15 foot cone to make Intelligence saving throws (DC = 8 + your Intelligence modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 1d6 psychic damage and is stunned until the start of their next turn. This damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You can use your Mind Blast a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Mind Blast
actions.description: You can unleash a special psionic attack known as a mind blast. You force creatures of your choice within a 15 foot cone to make DC {dc-int} Intelligence saving throws. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {damage} psychic damage and is stunned until the start of their next turn.

traits.name: Illithid Psionics
traits.description:
You know the Mage Hand cantrip, and the hand is invisible when you cast the cantrip with this trait. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Command spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Detect Thoughts spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast them with this trait, they don't require components.

name: Illithid

description: Moody and perplexing, isolated and elegant, tough and passionate, the ways in which one might describe the ivathi are many. These moth-like peoples are a quiet breed with a tendency toward nature - solitary, yet intimate creatures with a penchant for thought and ritual. Often on their feet or in the skies, even the most fierce and untamed of ivathi carry an attitude of worldly place that comes from their nomadic lifestyle. They owe their lives to the land they come from, and often find themselves responsible for its protection. Pensive, loving, determined, and gentle, the ivathi are hidden away, but not to be overlooked.

traits.name: Flight
traits.description: You have large, cloak-like wings. You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. To fly, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

traits.name: Natural Camouflage
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

traits.name: Secondary Arms
traits.description: You have two slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms. The secondary arms can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.

subraces.name: Luna
subraces.description: Luna ivathi are by far the most reclusive and mysterious, to the point where in some places they are merely considered the stuff of myth and legend. The greatest philosophers and seers of the ivathi are found among them, and they carry a deep reverence for nature. Graceful and beautiful creatures, these ivathi have semi-transluscent wings hued in green, blue, pink, or yellow, and their exoskeletons are covered by a thick coat of soft white fur.

traits.name: Close to Nature
traits.description: Choose one cantrip from the Primal spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Lightweight
traits.description: You are immune to damage caused by falling, and always land on your feet after a fall.

traits.name: Soothing Appearance
traits.description: You have advantage on Animal Handling checks to calm hostile or agitated animals.

subraces.name: Diamondback
subraces.description: Diamondback ivathi are the hardiest, most warrior-like breed. With their thick earthen carapaces and slender brown, grey, black, or tan wings, they blend into the rocky deserts and mountains of their origin. Diamondbacks are excellent hunters, trackers, and fighters, with a powerful, armor-like exoskeleton.

traits.name: Hardened Carapace
traits.description: While you aren't wearing armor, your carapace gives you a base Armor Class of 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.name: Warrior's Training
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

subraces.name: Royal
subraces.description: Diplomatic, professional, and never at a loss for words, the Royal ivathi are by far the most accepted by general society. As their name suggests, many Royals are nobles, diplomats, or negotiators. As a people, they have managed to throw off most of the common misconceptions and elements of the uncanny surrounding ivathi culture - a large part of this simply due to the fact that most of them simply don't speak Ivathi nor engage in more "mothly" behaviors when around the more "common" folk. The fact that their multicolored wings tend to be emblazoned with beautiful, intricate patterns helps in this as well.

traits.name: Polyglot
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write two extra languages of your choice.

traits.name: High Class
traits.description: You can double your proficiency bonus for Charisma checks when speaking with noble or high-class creatures.

traits.name: Well-Mannered
traits.description: Whenever you make a Deception, Performance, or Persuasion check, you can treat a d20 roll of 4 or lower as a 5.

name: Ivathi

description: The kalashtar are a compound race created from the union of humanity and renegade spirits from the plane of dreams - spirits called quori. Kalashtar are often seen as wise, spiritual people with great compassion for others. But there is an unmistakable alien quality to the kalashtar, as they are haunted by the conflicts of their otherworldly spirits.

traits.name: Mental Discipline
traits.description: You have advantage on all Wisdom saving throws and resistance to psychic damage.

traits.name: Mind Link
traits.description:
You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within 120 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

When you're using this trait to speak telepathically to a creature, you can use your action to give that creature the ability to speak telepathically with you for 1 hour or until you end this effect as an action. To use this ability, the creature must be able to see you and must be within this trait's range. You can give this ability to only one creature at a time; giving it to a creature takes it away from another creature who has it.

actions.name: Mind Link
actions.description: When you're using this trait to speak telepathically to a creature, you can give that creature the ability to speak telepathically with you for 1 hour or until you end this effect as an action. To use this ability, the creature must be able to see you and must be within 120 feet of you. You can give this ability to only one creature at a time; giving it to a creature takes it away from another creature who has it.

traits.name: Severed From Dreams
traits.description: Kalashtar sleep, but they don't connect to the plane of dreams as other creatures do. Instead, their minds draw from the memories of their otherworldly spirit while they sleep. As such, you are immune to magical spells and effects that require you to dream, like the Dream spell, but not to spells and effects that put you to sleep, like the Sleep spell.

name: Kalashtar

description:
Kender are diminutive Humanoids that look like humans with pointed ears and diverse appearances. Kender have a supernatural curiosity that drives them on to adventures big and small. This curiosity is said to be connected to the whimsical magic of the Feywild, that some believe kender have a high affinity for. Due to their curiosity, many kender have found themselves falling through gates and portals to other planes and worlds.

Unknown to most mortals, a magical phenomenon surrounds a kender. Spurred by their curiosity and love for trinkets, curios, and keepsakes, a kender's pouches or pockets will be magically filled with these objects. No one knows where these objects come from, not even the kender. This has led many kender to be mislabeled as thieves when they fish these items out of their pockets.

traits.name: Brave
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Taunt
traits.description:
You have a supernatural ability to home in on a creature's emotional raw nerves and craft a taunt that flusters that creature. As a bonus action, you can unleash a barrage of insults at a creature within 60 feet of you that can hear and understand you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier), or it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Taunt
actions.description: You unleash a barrage of insults at a creature within 60 feet of you that can hear and understand you. The target must succeed on a DC {dc-cha} Wisdom saving throw, or it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

traits.name: Kender Ace
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you possess a magical ability to pull an item out of a bag or another container; as a bonus action, you can reach into a container you're carrying and roll on the Kender Aces table to determine what item you pull out. The object glimmers softly and disappears after 1 hour.

You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Kender Aces

actions.description:
You reach into a container you're carrying and roll on the Kender Aces table to determine what item you pull out. The object glimmers softly and disappears after 1 hour.

You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Kender

description: These mysterious ravenfolk once served an ancient deity or otherworldy power, one they betrayed.  As punishment, their patron stripped them of their wings and voices, and only a lucky few have managed to break free of their curse.

subraces.name: Accursed Kenku
subraces.description: Haunted by an ancient crime that robbed them of their wings, the flightless kenku wander the world as vagabonds and burglars who live at the edge of human society. Kenku suffer from a sinister reputation that is not wholly unearned, but they can prove to be valuable allies.

traits.name: Expert Forgery
traits.description: You can duplicate other creatures' handwriting and craftwork. You have advantage on all checks made to produce forgeries or duplicates of existing objects.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.description: You can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices, which is the only way you can speak. A creature that hears the sounds you make can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check opposed by your Charisma (Deception) check.

traits.name: Stealth Training
traits.description: You are proficient in your choice of two of the following skills: Acrobatics, Deception, Stealth, and Sleight of Hand.

subraces.name: Blessed Kenku
subraces.description: Though most kenku suffer from the mysterious curse that plagues their race, a lucky few have achieved freedom from this curse, whether through divine means or others.  These blessed kenku delight in creativity and flight.

traits.name: Beloved Wings
traits.description: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. To fly, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

traits.name: Spark of Creativity
traits.description: You can imagine the most wondrous ideas. You have advantage on all checks made to produce new objects or inventions.

traits.name: Voice of an Angel
traits.description: You take great delight in using your own voice, which allows you to excel in social scenarios. You are proficient in two skills of your choice from the following list: Deception, Intimidation, Persuasion, and Society.

name: Kenku

description:
The khenra are tall and lean, with graceful bodies and heads that strongly resemble jackals. Their snouts are long and sharp, and their angular ears rise straight above their heads. Their bodies are covered in dark, sleek hair that ranges from the brown of the desert sands to ebony black. Despite their sharp teeth, they consider biting to be an uncouth and unworthy combat tactic.

Nearly every khenra is born a fraternal or identical twin, and a pair of khenra twins forms an extremely close emotional bond unknown to most other peoples. The death of one twin in training or the trials causes a tremendous shock to the survivor, who typically grows more aggressive and foolhardy in battle. The rare khenra who are born without twins are believed to have killed their siblings in the womb, and are thus viewed as natural-born initiates.

traits.name: Khenra Twin
traits.description: If your twin is alive and you can see your twin, whenever you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. If your twin is dead (or if you were born without a twin), you can't be frightened.

traits.name: Living Twin
traits.description: While you can see your twin, whenever you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

traits.name: No Twin
traits.description: You are immune to being frightened.

traits.name: Hardy
traits.description: You are acclimated to extreme heat.

traits.name: Tough
traits.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

name: Khenra

description: Kobolds are often dismissed as cowardly, foolish, and weak, but these little reptilian creatures actually have a strong social structure that stresses devotion to the tribe, are clever with their hands, and viciously work together in order to overcome their physical limitations.

traits.name: Distraction
traits.description: As a bonus action on your turn, you can distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, you and your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that can see you. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Distraction
actions.description: You distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, you and your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that can see you.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.description: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Draconic Legacy
traits.description: The kobold connection to dragons can manifest in unpredictable ways in an individual kobold. Choose one of the following legacy options when you select this race:
You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
You can make unarmed strikes with your tail. When you hit with it, the strike deals 1d8 + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
You know one cantrip of your choice from the Arcane spell list. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for that cantrip.

subraces.name: Urd
subraces.description: Rarely, a kobold will be born with leathery, bat-like wings.  These kobolds are thought to be blessed by the god Kuraulyek, who stole a pair of wings from the aarakocra.

traits.name: Urd Wings
traits.description: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. To fly, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

name: Kobold

description:
Deeply reverent of the land and its sacred sites, the nomadic kor live a spare existence defined by their constant travels. Masters of ropes and hooks, they scale sheer cliffs and cross yawning chasms with such skill and agility that they sometimes seem almost to take flight.

Kor are tall, slender humanoids with light hair and gray, blue-gray, or ivory skin. All kor have slightly pointed ears, and males have short, fleshy barbels on their chins. They paint softly glowing geometric patterns on their faces and bodies. Their clothing tends to leave their arms and shoulders free to facilitate climbing, and they keep most of their gear in pouches and slings at their waists.

The kor have a nonverbal language of hand signs and gestures that allows communication despite significant distance (particularly when augmented with whirling ropes) or howling winds. They also use this sign language among themselves when they wish to avoid being overheard, giving rise to misguided rumors that they are incapable of speech. When they do speak, they typically use as few words as possible to convey their meaning.

traits.name: Athletic
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Athletics and Acrobatics skills.

traits.name: Kor Climbing
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Lucky
traits.description: When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

traits.name: Brave
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

name: Kor

description: The koradi race is a secretive and protective one defined by the natural environment. Though they rarely interact with outsiders, they live in clan-like communities that share in a mutual relationship with the lands they call home.

traits.name: Folk Remedies
traits.description: You have proficiency with herbalism kits.

traits.name: Natural Camouflage
traits.description: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when trying to hide in dense foliage such as in swamps and forests, and you can take the Hide action while only lightly obscured by foliage. You lose these benefits if you don medium or heavy armor.

traits.name: Verdant Being
traits.description: You know the Druidcraft cantrip. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

subraces.name: Deepgrown
subraces.description:
The rarest of the koradi race can be found deep inside caves or the Underdark, known as the deepgrown. Despite being surrounded by notoriously evil creatures, deepgrown koradi rarely have evil motivations. However, they are far more likely to attack in retaliation. These koradi especially rely upon their reclusive habits for self preservation and protection.

Your biology has shifted slightly to resemble the fungi of the Underdark. Your skin tone ranges between shades of gray and purple and features prominent red or white spotting.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Toxic Touch
traits.description: Your skin can secrete a mild toxin that is harmful to most creatures. As a bonus action, you can force a creature grappling you, grappled by you, or otherwise in prolonged contact with you to make a Constitution saving throw (save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target becomes poisoned until the end of its next turn. You must then finish a short or long rest before you can use this trait again.

actions.name: Toxic Touch
actions.description: You force a creature grappling you, grappled by you, or otherwise in prolonged contact with you to make a DC {dc-con} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes poisoned until the end of its next turn.

subraces.name: Mossheart
subraces.description:
As a mossheart koradi, you are used to the damp soil and bogs of dense swamps. You are extremely well-versed in navigating the rivers of the region and have adapted to a life surrounded by dangerous plants and creatures.

Mossheart skin tends to be slightly lighter than that of wildhearts, often with an olive or turquoise hue to it. Your skin is soft to the touch and shimmers slightly in the light as if it were perpetually damp.

traits.name: Born Swimmers
traits.description: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes.

traits.name: Poison Resilience
traits.description: The deadly toxins common in your homeland have forced you to evolve a natural resistance against them. You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and gain resistance to poison damage.

subraces.name: Wildheart
subraces.description:
As a wildheart koradi, you come from a heavily-forested region such as those found deep within the Feywild. You long for the untamed wilds - those places untouched by civilization, and your biology shows it.

Wildhearts tend to have dark green or brown skin characterized by visible patches of rough, bark-like texture. Your skin is thicker than most other creatures', resembling the bark on the trees from your homeland.

traits.name: Thick Hide
traits.description: Your skin has adapted to protect you without the need for cumbersome armor. You gain a +1 bonus to your AC while you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor.

traits.name: Tree Climber
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

subraces.name: Winterborn
subraces.description:
A special subrace of koradi known as the winterborn exists in the tundras and evergreen forests of the world. Unlike koradi from the swamps and woods who create permanent dwellings for themselves, winterborn rarely stay in one place for an extended period of time. The harsh cold and strong winds of such regions make farming extremely difficult, so winterborn instead migrate alongside the local animals.

Winterborn koradi have pine green or dusty brown skin tones with dark striations resembling pine needles. They often decorate their thick, dreadlock-like hair to resemble the native coniferous forests.

traits.name: Arctic Acclimation
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage and are naturally adapted to cold climates.

traits.name: Nomadic Physiology
traits.description: Your body has evolved to allow you to travel across vast swaths of frozen terrain. You can travel twice as long as other creatures without risking exhaustion, and difficult terrain made of ice or snow doesn't cost you extra movement.

name: Koradi

description: Prides of these nomadic, lion-like humanoids rarely interact with other peoples, having all they need in their shimmering homeland and knowing the treachery of strangers. Still, some leonin wonder what lies beyond their valley's border mountains and seek to test themselves in a wider world.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you can deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

traits.name: Hunter's Instincts
traits.description: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Athletics, Intimidation, Perception, or Survival.

traits.name: Daunting Roar
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can let out an especially menacing roar. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. The DC of the save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Daunting Roar
actions.description: You let out an especially menacing roar. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a DC {dc-con} Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

name: Leonin

description: Leshies are small plantfolk created when a druid performs a special ritual on plant matter.  A spirit is drawn from nature that inhabits a suitable vessel, such as a gourd or a small cactus, and brings it to life.  Most start as companions to their creating druids, and then strike out on their own later in life.

traits.name: Botanical Healing
traits.description: If you lose a body part, you can re-grow it over the course of 1d4 long rests.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: While you remain motionless, you are nearly identical to an ordinary plant, gaining advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

traits.name: Natural Magic
traits.description: You know the Druidcraft cantrip.  Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Plant Nourishment
traits.description: You gain nourishment in the same way that the plants or fungi that match your body type normally do, through some combination of photosynthesis, absorbing minerals with your roots, or scavenging decaying matter. You typically do not need to pay for food. If you normally rely on photosynthesis and go without sunlight for 1 week, you begin to starve. You can derive nourishment from specially formulated bottles of sunlight instead of natural sunlight, but these bottles cost 10 times as much as standard rations.

traits.name: Needle Arm
traits.description: Your fists are covered in slender spines, which are natural weapons that you can make unarmed strikes with.  The spines deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier on a hit.

traits.name: Spiny Body
traits.description: Spines cover your body from head to toe.  While you are grappled by or grappling a creature, the creature takes 1d4 piercing damage at the start of each of their turns.

traits.name: Fruit Bearing
traits.description: You know the Goodberry spell, for which Wisdom is your spellcasting ability.  In addition, creatures who consume the fruits produced by the spell gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.  You can cast Goodberry using this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You have darkvision out to 60 feet.

traits.name: Fungal Resistance
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

traits.name: Gourd Storage
traits.description: Your hollow gourd body can be used to store items.  It can store Tiny creatures or objects with a combined weight less than or equal to your Strength score.  Things stored within your body cannot be spotted without a successful Wisdom (Perception) check contested by your passive Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) score.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: Your gourd body is tough and rigid, granting you some measure of defense.  When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.name: Leaf Glide
traits.description:
If you are not incapacitated or wearing heavy armor, you can extend leaves and glide. When you do so, you can perform the following aerial maneuvers:
  • When you fall, you can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot you descend.
  • When you would take damage from a fall, you can use your reaction to reduce the fall's damage to 0.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.
