traits.name: Water Walk
traits.description: So long as you are not wearing heavy armor, you can move across water without falling during your move.

traits.name: Hardy
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage.

traits.name: Towering Growth
traits.description: You know the Enlarge/Reduce spell, for which Wisdom is your spellcasting ability.  You can cast the spell using this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Earthen Bound
traits.description: You ignore difficult terrain when moving across surfaces made of soil.

traits.name: Rooted Down
traits.description: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws against being forcefully moved or knocked prone.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You can breathe water as well as air, and have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Aqua Attunement
traits.description: You know the Shape Water cantrip.  Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Vine Grasp
traits.description:
The vines of your body can be used to grasp targets. You know the Thorn Whip cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Entangle spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Web spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast Entangle or Web with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

name: Leshy

description: Lizardfolk possess an alien and inscrutable mindset, their desires and thoughts driven by a different set of basic principles than those of warm-blooded creatures. Their dismal swamp homes might lie hundreds of miles from the nearest human settlement, but the gap between their way of thinking and that of the smooth-skins is far greater.

traits.name: Bite
traits.description: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

traits.name: Hunter's Lore
traits.description: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Nature, Perception, Stealth, or Survival.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

subraces.name: Chameleonic Lizardfolk
subraces.description: Chameleonic lizardfolk are smaller, frailer lizardfolk with scales that they can change the colors of to blend into their environments.

traits.name: Chameleonic Scales
traits.description: As an action, you can change the color of your scales to match the color and texture of your surroundings, giving you advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in those surroundings.

actions.name: Chameleonic Scales
actions.description: You change the color of your scales to match the color and texture of your surroundings, giving you advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in those surroundings.

subraces.name: Crocodilian Lizardfolk
subraces.description: Larger lizardfolk with long, slender jaws that can crush steel, these lizardfolk are less clever, but are useful for their incredible strength.

traits.name: Mighty Jaws
traits.description: Your jaws are stronger, and deal piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier. In addition, you can grapple a creature of your size or smaller using your jaws. A creature grappled in such a way takes 1d4 piercing damage at the start of each of its turns while grappled.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, and lift.

subraces.name: Geckkota Lizardfolk
subraces.description: Geckkota lizardfolk are particularly small, and have pads on their hands and feet that allow them to climb walls.

traits.name: Gecko Climbing
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, at 3rd level, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

subraces.name: Monitor Lizardfolk
subraces.description: The most common type of lizardfolk, monitor lizardfolk are little more than tribal barbarians who have a penchant for forging weapons from the bones of their fallen enemies.

traits.name: Hungry Jaws
traits.description: In battle, you can throw yourself into a vicious feeding frenzy. As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points (minimum of 1) equal to your Constitution modifier, and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

actions.name: Hungry Jaws
actions.description: You can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain {mod-con} temporary hit points.

traits.name: Cunning Artisan
traits.description: As part of a short rest, you can harvest bone and hide from a slain beast, construct, dragon, or plant creature of size Small or larger to create one of the following items: a shield, a club, a javelin, or 1d4 darts or blowgun needles. To use this trait, you need a blade, such as a dagger, or appropriate artisan's tools, such as leatherworker's tools.

subraces.name: Razortail Lizardfolk
subraces.description: Many reptiles derive their body warmth and energy from the sun, but the razortail lizardfolk are fueled by an inner fire of zeal. Open with their emotions, razortail lizardfolk can be hot-tempered, but they are also quick to their hissing laughter, and they easily form close bonds of friendship. They are fierce warriors and passionate advocates for their guilds and causes.

traits.name: Lashing Tail
traits.description: Your semi-prehensile tail is tipped with a bony blade. Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you deals damage to you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make an unarmed strike against that creature with your tail. If you hit, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

actions.name: Lashing Tail
actions.description: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you deals damage to you with a melee attack, you can make an unarmed strike against that creature with your tail.

name: Lizardfolk

description: These resilient and proud fish-folk have endured war, slavery, and mistreatment at the hands of other aquatic creatures. They dwell in submerged tribal communities along seacoasts, and hunt both above and below the water.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You can breathe air as well as water, and have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.name: Observant and Athletic
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Athletics and Perception skills.

traits.name: Leviathan Will
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned, or put to sleep.

name: Locathah

description: Loxodons are often oasis of calm. They hum or chant in sonorous tones and move slowly or sit in perfect stillness. As they say, "There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man."

traits.name: Giant Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift, and you have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: You have thick, leathery skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.name: Trunk
traits.description: You can grasp things with your trunk, and you can use it as a snorkel. It has a reach of 5 feet, and it can lift a number of pounds equal to five times your Strength score. You can use it to do the following simple tasks: lift, drop, hold, push, or pull an object or a creature; open or close a door or a container; grapple someone; or make an unarmed strike. Your DM might allow other simple tasks to be added to that list of options. It can't wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of a spell.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.description: Thanks to your large ears and trunk, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception), Wisdom (Survival), and Intelligence (Investigation) checks that involve hearing or smell.

subraces.name: Elephanti Loxodon
subraces.description: The smaller elephanti loxodon are the more common variety, and are serene and wise.

traits.name: Elephant's Serenity
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

subraces.name: Mammuthus Loxodon
subraces.description: The larger cousins of elephanti loxodon, mammuthus loxodon are less serene, but are far stronger.

traits.name: Tusks
traits.description: Your tusks are a natural weapon with which you are proficient. They deal 1d8 + your Strength modifier bludgeoning or piercing damage on a hit.

traits.name: Woolly Hide
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage and are acclimated to extreme cold.

subraces.name: Tapiri Loxodon
subraces.description: The smallest of loxodon, tapiri have a reputation as sages and mystics, with strange abilities related to sleep and dreams.

traits.name: Tapir's Magic
traits.description: You can cast the Lullaby cantrip.  Wisdom your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Dreamspeak
traits.description:
You can telepathically speak to any sleeping creature within 30 feet. You do not have to share a language to speak, however, they must be able to speak a language. The creature must be capable of dreaming for you to speak with them in this way, and you appear in their dreams when you speak with them.

If you were the one who put the creature to sleep, through magic, poison, or the like, you have advantage on ability checks made to influence them when you speak to them in this way.

name: Loxodon

description: Merfolk are an amphibious race, born and at home in the water but comfortable on dry land. Humanoid in form on land, their legs fuse into a fishlike tail while in or near water. They have skin of ivory, silver, russet, blue, or deep purple. The hairlike growths on their heads are either thick and bristly like the needles of a sea urchin, or long and wavy, resembling fine seaweed. In either case, these growths typically range in color from red to warm brown to black. Male merfolk have similar growths extending down from their cheekbones.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You can breathe water as well as air, and have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

traits.name: Sea Witch
traits.description: You know the Seance cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Practicioner's Rites spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Totemic Cowl spell once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Creed of the Trickster
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Sleight of Hand and Stealth skills.

traits.name: Storyteller
traits.description: You know the Vicious Mockery cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Beguile spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Suggestion spell once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Knowledge of the Waters
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the History and Nature skills.

traits.name: Arcanist
traits.description: You know the Prestidigitation cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Detect Magic spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Borrowed Knowledge spell once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subraces.name: Merrow
subraces.description: A demonic mixture a merfolk and a shark, merrow are terrifying underwater predators with razor claws.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are a natural weapon you can use to make unarmed strikes. They deal 1d6 + your Strength modifier slashing damage on a hit instead of the usual damage for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Predator
traits.description: Your speed increases to 35 feet and you have proficiency in the Athletics and Survival skills.

name: Merfolk

description: Minotaurs are barrel-chested humanoids with heads resembling those of bulls. Their horns range in size from about 1 foot long to great, curling weapons easily three times that length. They often ornament their horns with metal rings or sheathe them in metal to protect them from damage.

traits.name: Horns
traits.description: Your horns are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning or piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Goring Rush
traits.description:
Immediately after you take the Dash action on your turn and move 15 feet in a straight line, you can make a special attack with your horns. If the attack hits, the target takes additional damage based on your level: 2d6 at 1st level, 3d6 at 5th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 17th level. The target takes an additional 1d6 damage if you dashed at least 30 feet in a straight line before making the attack. The target must also make a Strength saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus. If they fail, they are shoved up to 15 feet and knocked prone. Creatures that are at least two sizes larger than you automatically succeed on this saving throw.

You can use your Goring Rush a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Goring Rush
actions.description: Immediately after you take the Dash action on your turn and move 15 feet in a straight line, you can make a special attack with your horns. If the attack hits, the target takes {damage} additional damage. The target takes an additional 1d6 damage if you dashed at least 30 feet in a straight line before making the attack. The target must also make a DC {dc-str} Strength saving throw. If they fail, they are shoved up to 15 feet and knocked prone. Creatures that are at least two sizes larger than you automatically succeed on this saving throw.

traits.name: Giant Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift, and you have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

subraces.name: Baphomet's Brood
subraces.description: Your bloodline was corrupted by the Prince of Beasts himself.

traits.name: Monstrous Skill
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice:  Deception, Intimidation, and Religion.

traits.name: Abyssal Legacy
traits.description: You know the Thaumaturgy cantrip and the Cause Fear spell. You can cast Cause Fear once per long rest without expending a spell slot, or with any spell slots you have. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subraces.name: Labyrinth-Born
subraces.description: You come from a lineage of minotaurs bred to stalk endless mazes, and hunt unlucky wanderers.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Maze Prowler
traits.description: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: History, Perception and Stealth.

traits.name: Labyrinth Sense
traits.description: You always know which direction is north, and you have advantage on any Wisdom (Survival) check you make to navigate or track. Additionally, you cannot become lost on any path you have previously traveled, and you are immune to the Maze spell.

subraces.name: Seafarer
subraces.description: You come from a society of rugged sailors and pirates, with a proud nautical tradition.

traits.name: Rider on the Waves
traits.description: You gain proficiency in navigator's tools and water vehicles or astral vehicles, and in one of the following skills of your choice: Acrobatics, Perception, and Survival.

subraces.name: Wildhorn
subraces.description: You are in touch with your bull's ancestry, and retain some of the power and grace of the wilds.

traits.name: Born to the Wild
traits.description: You can can speak, read, and write Sylvan. You gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Nature, and Survival.

traits.name: Nomad
traits.description: You can ignore difficult terrain caused by nonmagical plants or terrain features.

name: Minotaur

description: The life of the Mousefolk is one spent close to the ground.  With no great empires or kingdoms to call home, the Mousefolk spend their lives carving a place for themselves in the cities of the larger races or in the untamed wilds.  They form tight-knit communities where every member is expected to contribute to the success of the whole.  Some Mousefolk study a trade skill to support their families, while others use their natural agility and intellect for contract services.

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Nimble Dodge
traits.description: When you are targeted by an opportunity attack, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Nimble Dodge
actions.description: When you are targeted by an opportunity attack, you can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Scavenger
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Survival skill and advantage on checks made to find food an water.

traits.name: Squirm
traits.description: You can move through spaces sized for a Tiny creature without squeezing.

traits.name: Brave
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Speak With Small Beasts
traits.description: You can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts.

name: Mousefolk

description: Mummies become undead not long after their deaths, but most do not awaken until a long slumber has passed. The contingencies that animate them are not always up to them. Most mummies are protectors and guardians, meant to keep something - cursed treasure, powerful artifacts, or unspeakable evils contained. Some are meant only to watch over the remains of a royal family, ensuring their tombs stay undisturbed. Depending on the length of their slumber, an awakened mummy might find themselves in a world they scarcely recognize. However, the time that has passed has no effect on their preservation, nor their compulsion to see the will of their creators done, until what has been done has been undone, at which time the mummy will resume their slumber until they are called to reanimate again.

traits.name: Superior Preservation
traits.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level. In addition, you know the Blade Ward cantrip.

traits.name: Strength of Will
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed. You are immune to poison damage, and you can't be diseased or poisoned. You don't require air, food, drink, or sleep, but must rest motionless in order to regain abilities that may require a short or long rest.

traits.name: Necrotic Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

traits.name: Soulbound
traits.description: Your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Undead: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

name: Mummy

description: Though not true giants, lesser giants are oversized humanoids with nasty reputations.  Ettins, ogres, trolls, and the like are beings related to giants that occasionally adventure, but usually only when they've had an encounter that alters their view on the world.

subraces.name: Cyclops
subraces.description: Cyclopes are one-eyed giants that eke out a meager existence in wild lands. Isolationists by nature, they avoid contact with other races and try to drive away strangers in their territory.

traits.name: All-Seeing Eye
traits.description:
You have advantage on saving throws against illusions.

In addition, whenever you make an Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern whether something within 30 feet of you is an illusion, you can use your reaction to automatically succeed on the check. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: All-Seeing Eye
actions.description: When you make an Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern whether something within 30 feet of you is an illusion, you can choose to automatically succeed on the check.

traits.name: Poor Depth Perception
traits.description: You have disadvantage on any ranged attack at a range greater than 30 feet.

traits.name: Retinal Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being blinded.

subraces.name: Ettin
subraces.description: An ettin is a foul, two-headed giant with the crude characteristics of an orc. The twin heads of an ettin are two individuals trapped in the same brutish body. Each head has its own mind, personality, and name, and possesses unique preferences and quirks.

traits.name: Two-Headed
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.description: When one of the your heads is asleep, its other head is awake.  You can choose to remain conscious during a long rest, though you must still refrain from strenuous activity to gain the benefit of the rest.

subraces.name: Ogre
subraces.description: Hulking giants known for their great strength and even greater stupidity, ogres are written off by most as little more than quick-tempered, unsociable, and easily fooled oafs. While this accurately describes many ogres, it does not encompass the totality of their people, and many scholars are still largely ignorant of the rather unfortunate origin of these creatures.

traits.name: Might Makes Right
traits.description: When interacting with other giants, if you make an ability check that would normally add your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier, you may instead add your Strength modifier to the roll.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: Your skin is thick and difficult to pierce.  When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

subraces.name: Oni
subraces.description: In nursery rhymes, oni are fearsome bogeymen that haunt the nightmares of children and adults alike, yet they are very real and always hungry. Oni look like demonic ogres with blue or green skin, dark hair, and a pair of short ivory horns protruding from their foreheads. Their eyes are dark with strikingly white pupils, and their teeth and claws are jet black.

traits.name: Change Shape
traits.description: You can use an action to magically polymorph into a Medium or Small humanoid for 1 hour or until you take an action to revert to your true form.  If the you die, you revert to your true form.  Other than your size, your statistics remain identical.  You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.description: You magically polymorph into a Medium or Small humanoid for 1 hour or until you take an action to revert to your true form.  If the you die, you revert to your true form.  Other than your size, your statistics remain identical.

traits.name: Waking Nightmare
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Intimidation skill.  While you are in your true form, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks made against children.

subraces.name: Troll
subraces.description: Trolls are tall, lanky giants with green, rubbery skin. Smashing a troll's bones and slashing through its rubbery hide only makes it angry. A troll's wounds close quickly. Born with horrific appetites, trolls eat anything they can catch and devour.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: You can use a bonus action to spend one hit die to heal yourself. You regain a number of hit points equal to a roll of the hit die plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). If you take acid or fire damage, you cannot use this feature until the end of your next turn.

actions.name: Regeneration
actions.description: You  spend one hit die to heal yourself. You regain a number of hit points equal to a roll of the hit die plus {mod-con}.

subraces.name: Yeti
subraces.description: A yeti's windborne howl sounds out across remote mountains, striking fear into the hearts of the scattered miners and herders that dwell there. These hulking creatures stalk alpine peaks in a ceaseless hunt for food. Their snow-white fur lets them move like ghosts against the frozen landscape. A yeti's icy simian eyes can freeze its prey in place.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description:
Your fierce claws are natural wepaons with which you can make unarmed strikes. They deal slashing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier on a hit.

In addition, while you are not wearing footwear, you ignore difficult terrain composed of ice or snow.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Iceborn Predator
traits.description: You are adapted to travel in sub-zero conditions. You are resistant to cold damage, are acclimated to extreme cold, and have advantage on Dexterity (stealth) checks in snowy or icy terrain.

name: Lesser Giant

description: Savage and fearless, orc tribes are ever in search of elves, dwarves, and humans to destroy. Motivated by their hatred of the civilized races of the world and their need to satisfy the demands of their deities, the orcs know that if they fight well and bring glory to their tribe, Gruumsh will call them home.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

actions.name: Aggressive
actions.description: You move up to your speed toward an enemy that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

traits.name: Primal Intuition
traits.description: You have proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Insight, Intimidation, Medicine, Nature, Perception, or Survival.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Relentless Endurance
traits.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Relentless Endurance
actions.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

name: Orc

description: When creatures not native to the Shadowfell give birth within its gloomy domain, there is a chance that their souls are marked with the essence of Shadowfell otherwise known as, shadowstuff. While not initially showing it, as they grow they take on the characteristics of the creatures native to the plane. Elves born here are cursed to become new shadar-kai, while other humanoids become nocturnes. Such features include an overall darker complexion, enhanced vision in darkness, and a largely nocturnal lifestyle. These traits make them adapt to the perpetual darkness of the Shadowfell and natural hunters of the night, taking down prey with swift and efficient movements as they move through the shadow like a ripple across an otherwise still lake.

traits.name: Fellvision
traits.description: You can't discern color, only shades of gray, and are effectively colorblind. However, you can see in dim light and darkness within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light.

traits.name: Gloom
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

traits.name: Shade Walk
traits.description: When you move through an area of darkness, you can move an additional foot for every foot of darkness you travel through, to a maximum additional distance traveled equal to half your base walking speed. When you move this way, to any creature that sees you, you appear as a formless mass that moves through the shadow.

traits.name: Shadowfell Metabolism
traits.description: You, like the Shadowfell are slow to change with your long drawn out metabolism. You can go without food and drink for twice as long as a normal Medium-sized creature and when affected by a potion or poison, the effects take twice as long to leave your system, doubling the duration.

name: Nocturne

description: Historically solitary and primitive in nature, panserbjorn have, under recent leadership, begun forming increasingly larger communities. This burgeoning civilisation has begun adopting social norms and morals much closer to those found within 'civilised' cultures. Indeed, magical universities now include panserbjorn amongst their alumni, and remote mountain-top temples highly prize these bear-people as monks and clerics. Even the more solitary panserbjorn are sought after as guides for trading caravans or adventurers delving into the tundra.

traits.name: Ursine Claws
traits.description: Your claws are as long as a child's hand, and a natural weapon you can use to make unarmed attacks. If you hit with them you deal slashing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike. In addition, if you are not wearing footwear, you can move across non-magical difficult terrain made of ice and snow without expending additional movement.

traits.name: Olfactory Hunter
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Forgers of Sky-Iron
traits.description:
You have proficiency with blacksmith's tools and craft a bespoke suit of armor of cold iron (sometimes called sky-iron), as important to you as your own soul. This magical armor can be enchanted and is not destroyed by disenchantment.

Whenever an increase to your proficiency bonus would lead to an increase in your AC, you must purchase sky-iron with a gold cost of 100 x your character level and spend 8 hours at a forge in order to gain this benefit.

You tailor this metal to the armor style with which you are proficient:
Armor TypeAC
None11 + your Dexterity modifier
Light13 + your Dexterity modifier
Medium13 + your Dexterity modifier (maximum of +2) + half your proficiency bonus (rounded down)
Heavy16 + half your proficiency bonus (rounded down)
Your bespoke armor grants you an Armor Class equal to 11 + your Dexterity modifier.
Your bespoke armor grants you an Armor Class equal to 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
Your bespoke armor grants you an Armor Class equal to 13 + your Dexterity modifier (maximum of +2) + half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).
Your bespoke armor grants you an Armor Class equal to 16 + half your proficiency bonus.

traits.name: Giant Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift, and you have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

subraces.name: Cultured Panserbjorn
subraces.description: Originally a wild people, some panserbjorn have managed to grow more cultured over time, integrating themselves into society.  Still often seen as outcasts in many places due in part to their rarity, they are eager learners.

traits.name: Studious
traits.description: You are proficient in one of the following skills of your choice: Arcana, History, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, Religion, or Society.

traits.name: Linguistic Assimilation
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write one additional language of you choice. Additionally, you can cast the Comprehend Languages spell once with this trait, requiring no material or somatic components, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest.

subraces.name: Forest Panserbjorn
subraces.description: Though panserbjorn are native to the far, arctic north of many worlds, those that emigrated to warmer locale found themselves with a very different environment, and evolved different abilities.  Most resembling black bears or brown bears, they have a connection to the druidic spirits often found in forests.

traits.name: Curved Claws
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Hunter-Gatherer
traits.description: You are proficient in one of the following skills of your choice: Nature, Perception, Stealth, or Survival.

traits.name: Beast Speech
traits.description: You can cast the Speak With Animals spell, and must finish a long rest before you can do so again.  Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

subraces.name: Spiritual Panserbjorn
subraces.description: Spiritual panserbjorn have less in common with their brethren, usually having patterned fur.  Blessed with an innate affinity for the energy known as ki that monks use, they are more often found in temperate environments.

subraces.name: Wild Panserbjorn
subraces.description: Brutal survivalists resembling bears of the far north, usually polar bears or brown bears, wild pasernbjorn live on the outskirts of civilization.  Historically more numerous, those still in the wild have become fewer as younger panserbjorn integrate themselves into society.

traits.name: Iceborn Predator
traits.description: You are adapted to travel in sub-zero conditions. You are resistant to cold damage, are acclimated to extreme cold, and have advantage on Dexterity (stealth) checks in snowy or icy terrain.

traits.name: Eye for Deception
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Insight skill.

name: Panserbjorn

description: Plasmoids are amorphous beings with no typical shape. In the presence of other folk, they often adopt a similar form, but there's little chance of mistaking a plasmoid for anything else. They consume food by osmosis, the way an amoeba does, and excrete waste through tiny pores. They breathe by absorbing oxygen through another set of pores,and their limbs are strong and flexible enough to grasp and manipulate weapons and tools. Although most plasmoids are translucent gray, they can alter their color and translucence by absorbing dyes through their pores.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.description: You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided you are wearing and carrying nothing. You also have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.

traits.name: Natural Resilience
traits.description: You have resistance to acid and poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

traits.name: Shape Self
traits.description: If you are not incapacitated, you can reshape your body to give yourself a head, one or two arms, one or two legs, and makeshift hands and feet, or you can revert to a limbless blob (no action required). As a bonus action, you can extrude a pseudopod that is up to 6 inches wide and 10 feet long or reabsorb it into your body. You can use this pseudopod to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour out the contents of a container. The pseudopod can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.description: You extrude a pseudopod that is up to 6 inches wide and 10 feet long, or reabsorb it into your body. You can use this pseudopod to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour out the contents of a container. The pseudopod can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

name: Plasmoid

description:
Within rocky coves and coastal inlets, praedaren build their dens. Atop the blood-soaked docks these creatures call home, carcasses of great sea monsters are hoisted by net and harpoon, and the stench of iron and salt permeates the air. Longshoremen work tirelessly to load and unload their vessels, harvest the remains of slain beasts, and repair or dismantle ships that have been salvaged or captured by competing fleets.

These lands are barren and bleak, and largely inhospitable. As a result, the praedaren repurpose much of that they scavenge into their infrastructure. In this wooden, rusting bricolage, one might find any number of foreign ships repurposed for a home, archways carved from monstrous jawbones, or tattered sails strung up for some protection against the elements.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You can breathe water as well as air, and have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Abyssal Mariner
traits.description: You ignore any of the drawbacks caused by a deep, underwater environment. Additionally, you gain proficiency with the Intimidation skill, and water vehicles or astral vehicles.

traits.name: Bite
traits.description: You have a mouth rowed with jagged, razor like, teeth, and it is a natural weapon which you can make attacks with. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

traits.name: Blood in the Water
traits.description: You can sense the general direction of a creature below half of its maximum hit points that is within 100 feet of you. Furthermore, when a creature you damaged on your last turn ends its turn further away from you than it started, you can use your reaction to move up to 30 feet closer to it.

actions.name: Blood in the Water
actions.description: When a creature you damaged on your last turn ends its turn further away from you than it started, you can move up to 30 feet closer to it.

subraces.name: Carver
subraces.description: Carvers are most notably defined by their blade-tipped tail, which is twice the length of their entire body. As a carver, you will use your tail masterfully both in combat as a weapon to flay scale from flesh, and out of combat to cut through water at remarkable speeds.

traits.name: Tail Whip
traits.description: Much like the blade of an urumi, your lengthy tail fin is hard, pliant, and razor sharp, allowing you to use it as a natural weapon which you can make attacks out to 10 feet with. You use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls. If you hit with it, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d8 + your chosen modifier.

traits.name: Cutthroat
traits.description: When you roll an 18 or 19 with an attack using your tail whip, you can choose to score a critical hit. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

actions.name: Cutthroat
actions.description: When you roll an 18 or 19 with an attack using your tail whip, you can choose to score a critical hit.

traits.name: Improved Swimming Speed
traits.description: Your swimming speed increases to 40 feet.

subraces.name: Hauler
subraces.description: As a hauler, your responsibilities often involve the protection and transportation of important objects. Haulers are the largest of all the praedaren subraces. They have huge bellies that are surrounded by thick layers of fat. They use their large stomach and wide gaping mouths to swallow precious loot and store it for safe keeping. They've also been been known to repair metal objects using a salivary gland unique to their kind.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Devour
traits.description:
As an action, you can make a bite attack against a creature of a smaller size than yourself that you are grappling in an attempt to swallow it whole. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside of you, and it takes 2d4 acid damage at the start of each of your turns. You can have only one target swallowed at a time. Your armor class when targeted by an attack made by a creature that is swallowed is 10.

If you become incapacitated the swallowed creature is no longer restrained and can escape using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone. Otherwise the creature can attempt to escape by using it's action as if attempting to escape a grapple. As an action, you can regurgitate a swallowed creature into an adjacent unoccupied space.

Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Devour
actions.description:
You make a bite attack against a creature of a smaller size than yourself that you are grappling in an attempt to swallow it whole. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside of you, and it takes 2d4 acid damage at the start of each of your turns. You can have only one target swallowed at a time. Your armor class when targeted by an attack made by a creature that is swallowed is 10.

If you become incapacitated the swallowed creature is no longer restrained and can escape using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone. Otherwise the creature can attempt to escape by using it's action as if attempting to escape a grapple. As an action, you can regurgitate a swallowed creature into an adjacent unoccupied space.

traits.name: Store the Hoard
traits.description: You can store metallic items in your gut for safe keeping. The space in your gut is equivalent to that of a large burlap sack.

traits.name: Amending Acids
traits.description: The acids in your belly have restorative properties for metallic materials. A metallic item stored in your gut for 1 hour is repaired as if effected by the Mending cantrip.

subraces.name: Looter
subraces.description: Looters are much smaller than the other praedaren bloodlines. They utilize their size to maneuver through the tight confines present in shipwrecks and undersea caverns, where they're often tasked with retrieving treasure from. Besides their small size, looters also have protruding nostrils, sunken eyes, and a menacing grin, all of which contribute to them occasionally being mistaken as a goblinoid.

traits.name: Blood and Plunder
traits.description: When you successfully hit a creature with a melee attack, you can use your bonus action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check to plant something on someone else, conceal an object on a creature, lift a purse, or take something from a pocket.

traits.name: Trap Finder
traits.description: You have advantage on Perception and Investigation checks made to detect the presence of traps.

traits.name: Master Thief
traits.description: You have proficiency with thieves' tools.

subraces.name: Seeker
subraces.description: This subset of praedaren have a distinguishing head shaped like that of a hammer. Seekers have retained much of their ancestor's sensory capabilities, and because of their usefulness in finding hidden treasures, they are treated like kings by their crew mates.

traits.name: Eyes of the Deep
traits.description: Your eyes are well attuned to the dark, watery, depths. Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) check to see or find something while fully submerged under water, you have advantage on the roll.

traits.name: Electroreception
traits.description: You are aware of the presence of living creatures and metal objects within 30 feet of yourself but not their exact location. You can use your bonus action to identify their current location and track their movement until the start of your next turn.

subraces.name: Sinker
subraces.description: Known for their superior jaw strength, muscular build, and all around combat prowess, praedaren of the sinker type are considered the most fearsome foe to have on the sea. Sinkers get their name from their ability to rip holes in the haul of a ship using nothing but their own teeth.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Improved Bite
traits.description: You posses a maw capable of tearing through metal as if it's meat. Your bite attack deals 1d8 + your Strength modifier instead. Furthermore, the damage from your bite attack is doubled and maximized when attacking objects and structures.

traits.name: Sink or Swim
traits.description: You have an indomitable attitude, which drives you to succeed in dire straits. Whenever you have below half of your maximum hit points remaining, and roll damage for your bite attack, make a Strength check, or a Strength saving throw, you may roll 1d4 and add it to the result.

name: Praedaren

description: Forced off of their homeworld by sapient constructs of their own creation, quarian are exiled nomads that now travel the stars in search of a new homeland.

traits.name: Enviro-Suit
traits.description:
An enviro-suit consists of a reinforced, skin-tight, hermetically sealed body suit and a helmet.

While wearing the enviro-suit helmet, you can breathe normally in any environment and you have advantage on saving throws made against harmful gases and vapors (such as cloudkill and stinking cloud effects, inhaled poisons, and the breath weapons of some dragons).

While wearing the enviro-suit body, you are immune to contracting any disease. As the body suit is skin-tight, you can wear armor over it.

If you are not wearing your enviro-suit body and helm, you automatically fail saving throws against disease.

When you are the victim of a critical hit that does piercing or slashing damage, your enviro-suit is punctured. While the suit is punctured, you have disadvantage on saving throws against disease. You can repair the suit with 1 hour of work with Tinker's Tools or with the Mending cantrip.

traits.name: Salvage
traits.description: You know the Mending cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

subraces.name: Cerebral Augmentations
subraces.description: Cerebral implants are embedded in the brains of quarian to enhance mental prowess and to protect against mind-altering effects.

traits.name: Mind Shielding Unit
traits.description:
You have advantage on saving throws against mind-altering effects (such as being charmed, confused, compelled, frightened, or put to sleep) by magic.

In addition, your mind cannot be read by magical means.

subraces.name: Muscular Augmentations
subraces.description: Muscular augments are implants placed strategically at the shoulders and hips to direct pulses of energy through muscle fibers, allowing for bursts of speed, strength, and flexibility.

traits.name: Overclock Unit
traits.description: You can activate your muscular augments for a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you recharge the unit by moving 0 feet on one of your turns.

actions.name: Overclock Unit
actions.description: When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn.

traits.name: Peak Fitness
traits.description: You have proficiency in either the Acrobatics or Athletics skill.

subraces.name: Ocular Augmentations
subraces.description: Quarians with ocular augments replace their eyes with enchanted orbs that allow their sight to persist even in the most unfavorable conditions.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Clarity Unit
traits.description:
You have advantage on saving throws against being blinded.

Additionally, you can see in an area within 30 feet of you that is lightly obscured as if it were unobscured, and can see in an area within 15 feet of you that is heavily obscured as if it were only lightly obscured.

subraces.name: Visceral Augmentations
subraces.description: Quarians with visceral augments have implants inserted within the organs to enhance the body's natural healing ability, protecting the body from toxins and injury.

traits.name: Detoxification Unit
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

name: Quarian

description:
Death isn't always the end. The reborn exemplify this, being individuals who have died yet, somehow, still live. Some reborn exhibit the scars of fatal ends, their ashen flesh or bloodless veins making it clear that they've been touched by death. Other reborn are marvels of magic or science, being stitched together from disparate beings or bearing mysterious minds in manufactured bodies. Whatever their origins, reborn know a new life and seek experiences and answers all their own.

Faded Memories

Reborn suffer from some manner of discontinuity, an interruption of their lives or physical state that their minds are ill equipped to deal with. Their memories of events before this interruption are often vague or absent. Occasionally, the most unexpected experiences might cause sensations or visions of the past to come rushing back.

Rather than sleeping, reborn regularly sit and dwell on the past, hoping for some revelation of what came before. Most of the time, these are dark, silent stretches. Occasionally, though, in a moment of peace, stress, or excitement, a reborn gains a glimpse of what came before. When you desire to have such a dreamlike vision, roll on the Lost Memories table to inspire its details.

Lost Memories
d8 Memory
1 You recall a physically painful moment. What mark or scar on your body does it relate to?
2 A memory brings tears to your eyes. Is it a bitter or cheerful memory? Does recalling it make you feel the same way?
3 You recall a childhood memory. What about that event or who you were still influences you?
4 A memory brings with it the voice of someone once close to you. How do they advise you?
5 You recall enjoying something that you can't stand doing now. What is it? Why don't you like it now?
6 A memory carries a vivid smell or sensation. What are you going to do to recreate that experience?
Reborn Origins

Reborn might originate from circumstances similar to those of various undead or constructs. The Reborn Origins table provides suggestions for how your character became reborn.

Reborn Origins
d10 Origins
1 You were magically resurrected but something went wrong.
2 Stitches bind your body's mismatched pieces, and your memories come from multiple different lives.
3 After clawing free from your grave, you realized you have no memories except for a single name.
4 You were a necromancer's undead servant for years. One day, your consciousness returned.
5 You awoke in an abandoned laboratory alongside complex designs for clockwork organs.
6 You were released after being petrified for generations. Your memories have faded, though, and your body isn't what it once was.
7 Your body hosts a possessing spirit that shares its memories and replaces your missing appendages with phantasmal limbs.
8 In public, you pass as an unremarkable individual, but you can feel the itchy straw stuffing inside you.
9 You clung to this life due to a task you have left unfinished. You cannot rest until you complete your task.
10 You were slain, but an otherworldly being brought you back as a partially undead servant. Your patron will not let you rest until your duties are finished.

traits.name: Ancestral Legacy
traits.description:
If you replace a race with this lineage, you gain any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.

If you don't keep any of those elements, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Ancestry
traits.description: You gain any traits that grant a climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from your original race.

traits.name: Skill Versatility
traits.description: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Knowledge From a Past Life
traits.description: You temporarily remember glimpses of the past, perhaps faded memories from ages ago or a previous life. When you make a skill check, you can roll a d6 immediately after seeing the number on the d20 and add the number on the d6 to the check. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Knowledge From a Past Life
actions.description: When you make a skill check, you can roll a d6 immediately after seeing the number on the d20 and add the number on the d6 to the check.

traits.name: Deathless Nature
traits.description:
You have escaped death, a fact represented by the following benefits:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against disease and being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.
  • You have advantage on death saving throws.
  • You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
  • You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

name: Reborn

description: Some beings look at their frail, mortal bodies with disgust.  They seek to replace their flesh with the cold certainty of steel, and will go to any means to do so.  They transform themselves into biomechanical constructs of their own design, wielding their technological prowess to be better than those around them.

traits.name: Ancestral Legacy
traits.description:
If you replace a race with this lineage, you gain any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.

If you don't keep any of those elements, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Ancestry
traits.description: You gain any traits that grant a climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from your original race.

traits.name: Skill Versatility
traits.description: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Biomechanical Nature
traits.description:
Your body is exceedingly good at staying alive, represented by the following benefits:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against disease and being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.
  • You have advantage on death saving throws.
  • You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
  • You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

traits.name: Tinker
traits.description: You have proficiency with tinker's tools.

subraces.name: Cerebral Augmentations
subraces.description: Cerebral implants are embedded in the brain of a cyborg to enhance mental prowess and to protect against mind-altering effects.

traits.name: Mind Shielding Unit
traits.description:
You have advantage on saving throws against mind-altering effects (such as being charmed, confused, compelled, frightened, or put to sleep) by magic.

In addition, your mind cannot be read by magical means.

subraces.name: Muscular Augmentations
subraces.description: Muscular augments are implants placed strategically at the shoulders and hips to direct pulses of energy through muscle fibers, allowing for bursts of speed, strength, and flexibility.

traits.name: Overclock Unit
traits.description: You can activate your muscular augments for a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you recharge the unit by moving 0 feet on one of your turns.

actions.name: Overclock Unit
actions.description: When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn.

traits.name: Peak Fitness
traits.description: You have proficiency in either the Acrobatics or Athletics skill.

subraces.name: Ocular Augmentations
subraces.description: Cyborgs with ocular augments replace their eyes with enchanted orbs that allow their sight to persist even in the most unfavorable conditions.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Clarity Unit
traits.description:
You have advantage on saving throws against being blinded.

Additionally, you can see in an area within 30 feet of you that is lightly obscured as if it were unobscured, and can see in an area within 15 feet of you that is heavily obscured as if it were only lightly obscured.

subraces.name: Weaponry Augmentations
subraces.description: Cyborgs sometimes augment themselves with weaponry, effectively turning their bodies into living weapons.

traits.name: Integrated Weapon
traits.description: Over the course of a long rest, you can integrate a one-handed weapon with which you are proficient into one of your arms. As a bonus action, you can retract the weapon into your forearm or extend it from there. While it is extended, you can use the weapon as if you were holding it, and you can't use that hand for other purposes. You can't be disarmed of the weapon while it is extended.

traits.name: Weapon Training
traits.description: You are proficient with one exotic weapon of your choice.

name: Cyborg

description:
Rhinox are huge and gentle, but rather dim-witted. Their bodies bear the thick skin of a pachyderm, and their heads resemble those of a rhinoceros. Their brawn rivals even that of a hill giant, but they rarely use it for violence. Most loathe to fight, using their strength only in self-defense.

Rhinox are at home on the savannah, and urban rhinox are rare. They revere the fey, from which they trace their earliest bloodlines back to.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Giant Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift, and you have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

traits.name: Horn
traits.description: Your horn is a natural weapon which you can use you make unarmed strikes.  It deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier on a hit.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: You have thick, leathery skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

name: Rhinox

description: Satyrs have a well-earned reputation for their good spirits, gregarious personalities, and love of revels. Most satyrs are driven by two simple desires; to see the world and to sample its every pleasure. While their spontaneity and whimsy sometimes put them at odds with more stoic peoples, satyrs rarely let the moodiness of others hinder their own happiness.

traits.name: Ram
traits.description: You can use your head and horns to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

traits.name: Mirthful Leaps
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can jump a number of feet equal to five times your proficiency bonus, without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this trait only if your speed is greater than 0. You can use it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Mirthful Leaps
actions.description: You jump up to <{prof} * 5> feet, without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this trait only if your speed is greater than 0.

traits.name: Reveler
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Performance and Persuasion skills, and you have proficiency with one musical instrument of your choice.

traits.name: Magic of Revelry
traits.description:
You know the Lullaby cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Tasha's Hideous Laughter spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Enthrall spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast tasha's hideous laughter or enthrall with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

name: Satyr

description: Shifters are sometimes called the weretouched, as many believe that they are the descendants of humans and lycanthropes. They are humanoids with a bestial aspect; while they cannot fully change shape they can temporarily enhance their animalistic features - a state they call shifting. Whatever their origins, shifters have evolved into a unique race. A shifter walks on the knife's edge between the wilds and the world around them. Do they embrace their primal instincts or the path of civilization?

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Shifting
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). You also gain benefits that depend on your shifter subrace, described below. Once you shift, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

actions.name: Shifting
actions.description: you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain <{level} + {mod-con}> temporary hit points and {effect}.

key.Beasthide: you gain an additional 1d6 hit points, and your armor class is increased by 1
key.Cliffwalk: you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed
key.Galewind: you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed, which you can only use if you are wearing light or no armor
key.Longtooth: you can use your elongated fangs to make an unarmed strike as a bonus action. If you hit with your fangs, you can deal piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike
key.Razorclaw: you can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action. You can use your Dexterity for its attack roll and damage bonus, and this attack deals slashing damage
key.Swiftstride: your walking speed increases by an additional 5 feet. Additionally, you can move up to 10 feet as a reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks
key.Wildhunt: you have advantage on Wisdom checks, and no creature within 30 feet of you can make an attack roll with advantage against you, unless you're incapacitated

subraces.name: Beasthide
subraces.description: Beasthide shifters take upon the forms of creatures known for their resilience, usually bears or boars.  Even in human form, they are notably brawny and tough.

traits.name: Brawny
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

traits.name: Shifting Feature
traits.description: Whenever you shift, you gain 1d6 additional temporary hit points, and while shifted, you have a +1 bonus to your AC.

subraces.name: Cliffwalk
subraces.description: Cliffwalk shifters take upon the form of creatures native to high mountaintops, typically goats or moose.  In human form, they are agile and remain adept mountain climbers.

traits.name: Agile
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Acrobatics skill.

traits.name: Shifting Feature
traits.description: While shifted, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

subraces.name: Galewind
subraces.description: Galewind shifters take upon the form of birds of prey, such as eagles or hawks.  Scrawny in human form, they make up for it with their incredible vision.

traits.name: Hawk-Eyed
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Investigation skill.

traits.name: Shifting Feature
traits.description: While shifted, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed, which you can only use if you are wearing light or no armor.

subraces.name: Longtooth
subraces.description: Longtooth shifters have the form of a great cat, such as a tiger or lion.  Fierce and brutal, they show no mercy in combat.

traits.name: Fierce
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

traits.name: Shifting Feature
traits.description: While shifted, you can use your elongated fangs to make an unarmed strike as a bonus action. If you hit with your fangs, you can deal piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

subraces.name: Razorclaw
subraces.description: Razorclaw shifters are those with the form of lithe animals of the night, such as panthers.  They are masters of the shadows.

traits.name: Stealthy
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

traits.name: Shifting Feature
traits.description: While shifted, you can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action. You can use your Dexterity for its attack roll and damage bonus, and this attack deals slashing damage.

subraces.name: Swiftstride
subraces.description: Swiftstride shifters are quick on their feet and graceful, taking on the form of slender animals such as deer or gazelles.

traits.name: Graceful
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Acrobatics skill.

traits.name: Shifting Feature
traits.description: While shifted, your walking speed increases by an additional 5 feet. Additionally, you can move up to 10 feet as a reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

subraces.name: Wildhunt
subraces.description: Wildhunt shifters have the forms of pack animals such as wolves.  Their expert tracking ability makes them powerful in groups.

traits.name: Natural Tracker
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Survival skill.

traits.name: Shifting Feature
traits.description: While shifted, you have advantage on Wisdom checks, and no creature within 30 feet of you can make an attack roll with advantage against you, unless you're incapacitated.

name: Shifter

description: Skeletons are raised by curses or necromancy, usually from remains that are so old that little to no flesh or organs remain upon the bones. Without the tiresome requirements of the body's incessant desire for food, pleasure and excretion, most skeletons awaken to find great pleasure in purpose and activity, measuring their unlife in deeds and accomplishments they never would have had the time or energy to accomplish while still alive.

traits.name: Skeleton Telepathy
traits.description: You can communicate telepathically with other skeletons within 30 feet of you, regardless of the languages you knew in life.

traits.name: Skeletal Nature
traits.description: You are immune to poison damage, and you can't be diseased or poisoned. You don't require air, food, drink, or sleep, but must rest motionless in order to regain abilities that may require a short or long rest.

traits.name: Collapse
traits.description: When you do rest, you collapse into a pile of bones, including your worn equipment. You remain aware of your surroundings, and are completely indiscernible from a corpse unless divined by magical means, such as paladin's Divine Sense or the Detect Good and Evil spell. You can resume your normal stance and stature using your reaction.

traits.name: Memory
traits.description: You have advantage on Intelligence (History) checks you make to recall events from the time period in which you expired.

traits.name: Bone Bash
traits.description: You can remove your arm up to the elbow at no harm and use it as a melee weapon with which you are proficient, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier on a hit.

traits.name: Soulbound
traits.description: Your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Undead: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

name: Skeleton

description: Similar in nature to warforged, synthsteel are beings composed of a strange magical liquid metal.  Able to reformat their appearance at any time, they are master infiltrators and charlatans.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.description:
You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided you are wearing and carrying nothing. You also have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.

In addition, you can form a limb into a razor-sharp blade as a bonus action, or convert it back to a normal limb. While an arm is a blade, you can't hold anything in that hand, and it is a natural weapon that deals piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier on a hit.

traits.name: Artificial Nature
traits.description: You have resistance to poison damage and immunity to disease, and you have advantage on saving throws against being paralyzed or poisoned. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

traits.name: Impersonator
traits.description:
As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing can also change with this trait, other than magical clothing. You can replicate the appearance of magical items, but not their magical properties.

You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

actions.name: Impersonator
actions.description:
You change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing can also change with this trait, other than magical clothing. You can replicate the appearance of magical items, but not their magical properties.

You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

traits.name: Sentry's Rest
traits.description: When you take a long rest, you spend at least 6 hours in an inactive, motionless state, instead of sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but you aren't unconscious.

traits.name: True Life
traits.description: If the Mending spell is cast on you, you can expend a Hit Die, roll it, and regain a number of hit points equal to the roll plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). In addition, your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Constructs: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

name: Synthsteel

description: Hailing from a strange and distant land, wandering tabaxi are catlike humanoids driven by curiosity to collect interesting artifacts, gather tales and stories, and lay eyes on all the world's wonders. Ultimate travelers, the inquisitive tabaxi rarely stay in one place for long. Their innate nature pushes them to leave no secrets uncovered, no treasures or legends lost.

traits.name: Feline Agility
traits.description: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your tum in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the tum. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

actions.name: Feline Agility
actions.description: When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn.

traits.name: Cat's Claws
traits.description: Because of your claws, you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Cat's Talent
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception and Stealth skills.

name: Tabaxi

description: Taurians appear to be muscular humans from the waist up, but have the bodies of deer, elk, moose, or horses where their legs should be.  Roamers at heart, taurians love open spaces and the freedom to travel. As much as they can, taurians run. They race the wind, hooves thundering and tails streaming behind them.

traits.name: Hooves
traits.description: Your hooves are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Quadrupedal Build
traits.description:
You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag. In addition, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your equine legs. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot.

In addition, you can be ridden by a creature of your size or smaller if you allow it.

subraces.name: Alcetaur
subraces.description: Massive beings with the bodies of moose, alcetaurs are unpredictable beings.  They are noble survivalists with less honor than their equine cousins, but they also lack the haughtiness of centaurs.

traits.name: Stomp
traits.description: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line towards a Huge or smaller creature and hit them with a melee attack, they must make a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus) or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.description: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line towards a Huge or smaller creature and hit them with a melee attack, they must make a DC {dc-str} Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Survivor
traits.description: You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Animal Handling, Medicine, Nature, or Survival.

subraces.name: Centaur
subraces.description: Warriors at heart, centaurs are deeply honorable people with the bodies of powerful horses.  These equine warriors fight like cavalrymen, and most see themselves as being above the concerns of two-legged races.

traits.name: Charge
traits.description: If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, you can immediately follow that attack with a bonus action, making one attack against the target with your hooves.

actions.name: Charge
actions.description: If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, you can make one attack against the target with your hooves.

traits.name: Natural Cavalry
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.  In addition, you are always considered mounted for the purposes of using weapons with the Cavalry property.

subraces.name: Rumitaur
subraces.description: The smallest of the taurians, rumitaurs are people with the bodies of deer or elk.  Their innate connection to the Feywild grants them limited druidic magics.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.description:
You know the Druidcraft cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Longstrider spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Barkskin spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast longstrider or barkskin with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

name: Taurian

description: A place rarely ventured even by powerful tritons is the deepest of ravines in the sea floor. These dark, dismal places are home to a warlike race of beings resembling crabs, covered in thick armor plating and with enormous, brutal claws in place of hands. These people are known as Testasian by tritons, a word that roughly translates to "shelled brute".

traits.name: Amphibious
