traits.description: You can breathe water as well as air, and have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Brave
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are a natural weapon which deal 1d8 + your Strength modifier slashing damage and can be used to make unarmed strikes.

traits.name: Exoskeleton
traits.description: Due to your chitinous exoskeleton and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your exoskeleton provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

traits.name: Natural Warrior
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Athletics and Intimidation skills.

name: Testasian

description:
Thri-kreen have insectile features and two pairs of arms. Their bodies are encased in protective chitin. They can alter the coloration of this carapace to blend in with their natural surroundings.

Although thri-kreen don't sleep, they do require periods of inactivity to revitalize themselves. During these periods, they are fully conscious and aware of what's happening around them.

Thri-kreen speak by clacking their mandibles and waving their antennae, indicating to other thri-kreen what they are thinking and feeling. Other creatures find this method of communication difficult to interpret and impossible to duplicate. To interact with other folk, thri-kreen rely on a form of telepathy.

traits.name: Chameleon Carapace
traits.description: While you aren't wearing armor, your carapace gives you a base Armor Class of 13 + your Dexterity modifier. As an action, you can change the color of your carapace to match the color and texture of your surroundings, giving you advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in those surroundings.

actions.name: Chameleon Carapace
actions.description: You change the color of your carapace to match the color and texture of your surroundings, giving you advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in those surroundings.

traits.name: Secondary Arms
traits.description: You have two slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms. The secondary arms can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.

traits.name: Sleepless
traits.description: You do not require sleep and can choose to remain conscious during a long rest, though you must still refrain from strenuous activity to gain the benefit of the rest.

traits.name: Thri-kreen Telepathy
traits.description: Without the assistance of magic, you can't speak the non-thri-kreen languages you know. Instead you use telepathy to convey your thoughts. You have the magical ability to transmit your thoughts mentally to creatures you can see within 120 feet of yourself. A contacted creature doesn't need to share a language with you to understand your thoughts, but it must be able to understand at least one language. Your telepathic link to a creature is broken if you and the creature move more than 120 feet apart, if either of you is incapacitated, or if either of you mentally breaks the contact (no action required).

name: Thri-kreen

description:
Ettercaps are humanoid spiders that tend, feed, and watch over spiders the way a shepherd oversees a flock of sheep. They lair deep in remote forests.

Fine strands of silk stream from glands in an ettercap's abdomen, letting it shoot sticky strands of webbing to bind, entrap, or strangle its victims. It can also use its webbing to fashion elaborate snares and nets, which often festoon its lair.

traits.name: Arachnid Shepherd
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Animal Handling skill.

traits.name: Speak with Spiders
traits.description: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with spiders.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, at 3rd level, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

traits.name: Spider's Web
traits.description: You ignore movement restrictions caused by webbing, and you know the Web spell, for which Wisdom is your spellcasting ability.  You can cast Web using this trait once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.description: While in contact with a web, you know the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

name: Ettercap

description: To be greeted with stares and whispers, to suffer violence and insult on the street, to see mistrust and fear in every eye: this is the lot of the tiefling. And to twist the knife, tieflings know that this is because a pact struck generations ago infused the essence of the lower planes into their bloodline. Their appearance and their nature are not their fault but the result of an ancient sin, for which they and their children and their children's children will always be held accountable.

traits.name: Fiendsight
traits.description: You can see in magical darkness within 10 feet of you as though it were dim light.

subraces.name: Avernese
subraces.description: Tieflings with a blood tie to Zariel are stronger than the typical tiefling and retain a spark of the angelic power she once wielded. Skilled warriors, they hold themselves above and apart from their peers. They tend to have pale gray skin and halo-like ivory horns, and while they are not the most charming of tieflings, they have a cold, classic beauty that stands in opposition to their fiery tempers.

traits.name: Devil Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Infernal and Celestial.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

traits.name: Hellish Consumption
traits.description:
Starting at 3rd level, as an action, you can cause hellfire to rage within you, demanding that you bring the world to its knees. Fire flares from your eyes and powerful wings of shadow and flame rise from your back.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. For the duration, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra necrotic or fire damage (your choice) to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Hellish Consumption
actions.description:
You cause hellfire to rage within you, demanding that you bring the world to its knees. Fire flares from your eyes and powerful wings of shadow and flame rise from your back.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. For the duration, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal {prof} extra fire or necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.

subraces.name: Disic
subraces.description: Disic tieflings generally inherit the paranoia of the Iron Duke Dispater and are even more likely than other tieflings to be isolated from other people. Still, they are intelligent and graceful creatures, able to succeed at most anything they put their powerful minds to, and as such are valued wherever they end up. They tend to have smaller horns than some other tieflings, but very often have cloven hooves instead of humanoid feet.

traits.name: Devil Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Infernal.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

traits.name: Spymaster
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Insight and Stealth skills.

traits.name: Long Game
traits.description:
When you roll initiative, you can reduce your initiative to 1 to give yourself advantage on a number of attack rolls, saving throws, or skill checks equal to your Intelligence modifier. Any instances of advantage not used before combat ends are lost.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a long rest before you can do so again.

subraces.name: Minaurosine
subraces.description: Regardless of their personal morality, Minaurosine tieflings tend to bring out the worst in others. As descendants of Mammon, they can incite avarice in people with just a few words, and most have no compunctions about debasing themselves at the drop of a hat if it means some advantage for them. Additionally, their physical features rarely engender trust. Snake-like eyes, vomit-colored scales, bony dorsal spikes, and jagged teeth are all common traits on top of the standard horns and tails.

traits.name: Devil Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Infernal.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.  In addition, you are immune to disease.

traits.name: Incite Greed
traits.description: You have proficency in the Deception and Persuasion skills. You have advantage on Persusasion checks to negotiate prices or bribe someone.

traits.name: Grovel
traits.description:
As an action on your turn, you can cower and offer your surrender and loyalty to nearby enemies. Until the end of your next turn, enemies within 10 feet of you that can see or hear you have disadvantage on attack rolls against you, too disgusted by your pathetic whining to sully their blades. Meanwhile, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against those creatures.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Grovel
actions.description: You cower and offer your surrender and loyalty to nearby enemies. Until the end of your next turn, enemies within 10 feet of you that can see or hear you have disadvantage on attack rolls against you, too disgusted by your pathetic whining to sully their blades. Meanwhile, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against those creatures.

subraces.name: Phlegethosian
subraces.description: The descendants of Fierna share her zest for life, often being adrenaline junkies or hedonists. They are the first to dive in to any exciting new endeavour and are skilled at convincing others to join them, aided by their ability to tip the cosmic scales in their favor even in failure. Phlegethosian tieflings are often tall and extremely beautiful, but razor sharp teeth and fiery eyes make their reckless grins extremely off-putting. They have small horns that are often hidden by their thick, dark hair.

traits.name: Devil Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Infernal.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

traits.name: Party All Night
traits.description: Magic can't put you to sleep. To gain the benefits of a long rest, you can spend all 8 hours doing light activity.

traits.name: Underdogs
traits.description:
When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet would normally make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage or disadvantage, you can have them roll three d12's instead. The die roll result equals the sum of the two highest d12 rolls if they were rolling with advantage or the two lowest d12 rolls if they were rolling with disadvantage. The creature cannot get a critical success when you do this, but they still count as having advantage or disadvantage in regards to qualifying for other abilities.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.

traits.name: Impulsive
traits.description: You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

subraces.name: Stygian
subraces.description: Few are as skilled at inciting betrayal as the Frozen Prince, Levistus. In his tiefling descendants, this usually manifests in being extremely popular, with even their enemies bergrudgingly finding them charming. Adapted to survive in the brutal cold of Stygia's infinite ocean, they are strong swimmers and have thin gills on their necks. They generally have pale skin and hair in shades of white, grey, or blue and large piscine eyes. While any horn type is possible, some Stygian tieflings are known to have a single spiraling horn on their foreheads instead.

traits.name: Devil Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Infernal.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe both air and water.  In addition, your range of vision is doubled underwater.

traits.name: Bladedancer's Grace
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Acrobatics and Persuasion skills.

traits.name: Stygian Ice
traits.description: You know the Frostbite cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

traits.name: Double Agents
traits.description: Charmed creatures within 60 feet of you are considered to be charmed by you as well, regardless of the source of the charmed effect. As a bonus action, you can attempt to command a creature charmed by you to do harm. The charmed creature must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failure, it must use its next action to make an attack or use a damage-causing spell or effect that targets one of its allies. If there are no targets within range but the charmed creature could move to be in range of one, it must use its movement to do so. A creature you attempt to command becomes immune to further attempts to do so for 24 hours, regardless of whether it fails or succeeds the saving throw.

actions.name: Double Agents
actions.description: You attempt to command a creature charmed by you to do harm. The charmed creature must make a DC {dc-cha} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it must use its next action to make an attack or use a damage-causing spell or effect that targets one of its allies. If there are no targets within range but the charmed creature could move to be in range of one, it must use its movement to do so. A creature you attempt to command becomes immune to further attempts to do so for 24 hours, regardless of whether it fails or succeeds the saving throw.

subraces.name: Malbolgine
subraces.description: Malbolgine tieflings are descended from the Archduchess Glasya, Dark Prodigy and daughter of Asmodeus. They can call on the corrupt flesh that forms the foundation of Malbolge to heal their wounds, and like her they delight in pranks and bending rules as far as they can without breaking them. Metallic copper skin and forked tails thinner than those of other tieflings are common among Malbolgine tieflings, and more often than not an impish grins can be found on their comely faces.

traits.name: Devil Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Infernal.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to psychic damage.

traits.name: Cliff Climber
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Cancerous Healing
traits.description: As an action, you can spend a number of hit dice up to your Charisma modifier to regain hit points as you would during a short rest.

actions.name: Cancerous Healing
actions.description: You spend up to {mod-cha} hit dice to regain hit points as you would during a short rest.

traits.name: Trickster's Instincts
traits.description: You have advantage on all Dexterity, Intelligence, and Charisma saves against magic.

subraces.name: Maladominese
subraces.description: Baalzebul is the Lord of Corruption, both physical and spiritual. Ironically, his descendants are some of the least likely to fall under his power, being extremely resilient to the attemps of others to sway them to evil. As descendants of a fallen celestial, they are extremely beautiful. Jet black skin and hair are common, and their horns (or antlers in some cases) are thin and elegant. However, nearly all Maladominese tieflings have the shimmering compound eyes of a fly, with some even being able to extend them from their heads like a slug.

traits.name: Devil Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Infernal.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.  In addition, you are immune to disease.

traits.name: Incorruptible
traits.description: You have advantage on Insight or Perception checks to detect lies as well advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

traits.name: Perfectionist
traits.description:
As a reaction when you have disadvantage on an attack roll, saving throw, or skill check, you can negate the disadvantage and roll the dice as normal.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Perfectionist
actions.description: When you have disadvantage on an attack roll, saving throw, or skill check, you can negate the disadvantage and roll the dice as normal.

subraces.name: Canian
subraces.description: The archdevil Mephistopheles is a master of magic. Canian tieflings retain his gift, as well as his specific mastery over hellfire and the bitter cold of Cania. They tend to also be prideful and prone to obsession, becoming masters of their crafts. Mephistopheles delights in looking as stereotypically devilish as possible, and his descendants look much the same. Most have large curving horns, straight black hair, sharp teeth, and talon-like nails. They are equally likely to have red or blue skin tones of any shade.

traits.name: Devil Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Infernal.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage and fire damage.

traits.name: Arcane Savagery
traits.description: Once on your turn when you score a critical hit with an attack roll or reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can cast any cantrip you know that targets an enemy creature as a bonus action.

traits.name: Frostfire
traits.description: You know the Fire Bolt and Ray of Frost cantrips. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. If you score a critcal hit with these spells, the bonus damage is necrotic damage.

subraces.name: Nessusian
subraces.description: The children of Asmodeus are among the most common kind of tiefling, less because of the Prince of Hell's promiscuity and more as a result of his schemes to ritually corrupt other tiefling bloodlines to his own. As a result, they set the standard of what tieflings look and act like for most people. Even generations removed from Asmodeus, they retain an aura of his regality. The sweep of their thick horns is like a crown, their eyes are dismissive yet calculating, and there is no doubt in the minds of others that they are meant to rule whatever domain they choose.

traits.name: Devil Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Infernal.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

traits.name: Forked Tongue
traits.description: You have proficency in the Deception and Persuasion skills.

traits.name: None Before Me
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

traits.name: Devil's Own Luck
traits.description: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die. You must use the new result, even if it is a 1.

traits.name: Lordly Command
traits.description:
As an action, you speak a command of up to 3 words to a creature you can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or follow the command on its next turn. This feature has no effect if the target doesn't understand your language, can't follow your command, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

You can use this feature once, after which you must complete a long rest before you can do so again.

actions.name: Lordly Command
actions.description: You speak a command of up to 3 words to a creature you can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC {dc-cha} Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. This feature has no effect if the target doesn't understand your language, can't follow your command, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

subraces.name: Pazuzian
subraces.description: The indescribably ancient gatekeeper of the Abyss, Pazuzu holds sway over flying and insectoid creatures.  Tieflings of his bloodline can control insects and even fly short distances.  Taller and thinner than most other tieflings, they uniquely possess vestigal wings.

traits.name: Demon Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal.

traits.name: Abyssal Resistance
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.  In addition, you are immune to disease.

traits.name: Insect Swarms
traits.description: You know the Infestation cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Vestigal Wings
traits.description: You possess small, nearly flightless wings.  As a bonus action, you can give yourself a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your current turn, at which time you fall if you are in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft.  You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Vestigal Wings
actions.description: You give yourself a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your current turn, at which time you fall if you are in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft.

subraces.name: Demogorgonic
subraces.description: Demogorgon, the Prince of the Abyss, is among the most infamous and powerful demon lords.  Tieflings of his bloodline are the most common among abyssal tieflings, and retain some of his duality and enchantment abilities.

traits.name: Demon Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal.

traits.name: Abyssal Resistance
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.  In addition, you are immune to disease.

traits.name: Demonic Influence
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can unleash raw demonic energy on the area near you. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed or frightened of you (your choice for each creature) until the end of your next turn. The DC of the save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Demonic Influence
actions.description: You unleash raw demonic energy on the area near you. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a DC {dc-cha} Wisdom saving throw or become charmed or frightened of you (your choice for each creature) until the end of your next turn.

subraces.name: Orcusian
subraces.description: The demon lord of undeath, Orcus, is among the most powerful demon lords.  Once having made himself the death god Tenebrous, tieflings of his bloodline aren't quite alive, but they aren't dead either.  Strengthened with undead might, they are nearly skeletal in appearance.

traits.name: Demon Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal and Dark Speech, the language of evil gods.

traits.name: Abyssal Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

traits.name: Deathless Nature
traits.description: Due to your ancestry, you are partially undead. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe, you don't need to sleep, and you don't age.  You are also immune to disease.

traits.name: Draw Life
traits.description: You know the Chill Touch cantrip.  Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

subraces.name: Graz'ztan
subraces.description: Graz'zt is the demon lord of hedonism.  Once a devil, he defected to the side of the demons to escape the rigid structure of devilish society.  Tieflings of his bloodline typically live for pleasure, and have an innate expertise with song and art.

traits.name: Demon Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal.

traits.name: Abyssal Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to psychic damage.

traits.name: Artistry
traits.description: You have proficiency with one musical instrument and one tool of your choice from the following list: calligrapher's supplies, cook's utensils, disguise kits, glassblower's tools, jeweler's tools, painter's supplies, potter's tools, tailor's tools, weaver's tools, whitesmith's tools, and woodcarver's tools.  In addition, you have proficiency in Performance.

traits.name: Hedonist
traits.description: Magic can't put you to sleep. To gain the benefits of a long rest, you can spend all 8 hours doing light activity.

traits.name: Charming Voice
traits.description: You know the Charm Person spell.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.  Once you have cast the spell in this way, you must finish a long rest before you do so again.

subraces.name: Juiblexian
subraces.description: The ooze lord Juiblex may seem mindless, but he is among the most diabolical of all demon lords.  More alien than any of the other prominent demon lords, his tielfings have slimy, partially transparent skin, typically in shades of green or blue.  Their bodies are partially amorphous, allowing them to temporarily convert themselves fully to slime.

traits.name: Demon Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal.

traits.name: Abyssal Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to acid damage.

traits.name: Acidic Slime
traits.description: You know the Acid Splash cantrip.  Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Sticky Hold
traits.description: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.  In addition, at 3rd level, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

traits.name: Amorphous Form
traits.description: As an action, you can cause your body to become fluid and gelatinous for 1 minute or until you end it (no action required).  While your body is gelatinous, you can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, and you have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.  You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Amorphous Form
actions.description: You cause your body to become fluid and gelatinous for 1 minute or until you end it (no action required).  While your body is gelatinous, you can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, and you have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.

subraces.name: Fraz-urb'luun
subraces.description: The demonic prince of deception, Fraz-urb'luu is an immensely duplicitous being, and a pathological liar.  The deceptive abilities are inherited by tieflings of his bloodline, including the ability to shapeshift in a limited fashion.

traits.name: Demon Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal.

traits.name: Abyssal Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to psychic damage.

traits.name: Many-Faced
traits.description: You know the Disguise Self spell.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.  You can cast the spell using this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Master of Deception
traits.description: You have proficency in the Deception and Persuasion skills.

traits.name: Polyglot
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write two extra languages of your choice.

subraces.name: Zuggtmoyn
subraces.description: The queen of the Abyss, Zuggtmoy, is less a physical being and more of a collection of fungi and spores.  A being of rot and decay, she holds sway over vast quantities of creatures through her fungi.  Tieflings of her bloodline are typically more under her sway than others, as elements of her fungi exist within them always.

traits.name: Demon Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal.

traits.name: Abyssal Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

traits.name: One Mind
traits.description: You have the magical ability to transmit your thoughts mentally to creatures you can see within 120 feet of yourself through spores. A contacted creature doesn't need to share a language with you to understand your thoughts, but it must be able to understand at least one language. Your telepathic link to a creature is broken if you and the creature move more than 120 feet apart, if either of you is incapacitated, or if either of you mentally breaks the contact (no action required).

traits.name: Spore Spray
traits.description: When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal 1d4 necrotic damage to the attacker.  You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Spore Spray
actions.description: When you are hit by a melee attack, you can deal 1d4 necrotic damage to the attacker.

subraces.name: Tharizdunian
subraces.description: Tharizdun the Chained God is the first and greatest demon lord.  Wielding tremendous dark power, he created the Abyss out of the Elemental Chaos long ago.  Fearing the danger of his creation, the gods imprisoned him deep within the Abyss, in a nearly empty layer known as Blackhole.  Due to his imprisonment, tieflings that share his bloodline are extraordinarily rare.  They feel the Chained One's madness, and his desire for freedom.

traits.name: Demon Tongue
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal.

traits.name: Abyssal Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

traits.name: Broken Chains
traits.description: You can attempt to escape a grapple as a bonus action instead of an action.

traits.name: Twisted Mind
traits.description: Your mind cannot be read by magical means, and creatures have disadvantage on ability checks made to determine your true intentions.

traits.name: Blackness of the Depths
traits.description: You know the Darkness spell and can cast it once with this trait.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.  Once you cast darkness using this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

name: Tiefling

description: What many tortles consider a simple life, others might call a life of adventure. Tortles are born near sandy coastlines, but as soon as they're able to walk on two legs, they become nomad survivalists eager to explore the wilderness, experience its many wonders, put their skills to the test, and make new acquaintances.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.

traits.name: Shell Defense
traits.description:
Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your shell provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

In addition, you can withdraw into your shell as an action. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are prone, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.

actions.name: Shell Defense
actions.description: You withdraw into your shell. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are prone, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.

traits.name: Survival Instincts
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the Survival skill.

name: Tortle

description: Tritons guard the ocean depths, building small settlements beside deep trenches, portals to the elemental planes, and other dangerous spots far from the eyes of land-bound folk. Long-established guardians of the deep ocean floor, the noble tritons have gradually become increasingly active in the world above.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can breathe air and water

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.description:
A child of the sea, you can call on the magic of elemental air and water. You know the Shape Water cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Crashing Wave spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Misty Step spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast crashing wave or misty step with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

traits.name: Emissary of the Sea
traits.description: Aquatic beasts have an extraordinary affinity with your people. You can communicate simple ideas with beasts that can breathe water. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return.

traits.name: Guardian of the Depths
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage and are acclimated to extreme depths.

name: Triton

description: Sahuagin are a predatory, piscine, four-armed race that ventures from the ocean's black depths to hunt the creatures of the shallows and shore. Though they dwell in the deepest trenches of the ocean, sahuagin view the entire aquatic realm as their kingdom and the creatures in it as blood sport for their hunting parties.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can breathe air and water

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.description: You can sense the general direction of a creature below half of its maximum hit points that is within 100 feet of you. Furthermore, when a creature you damaged on your last turn ends its turn further away from you than it started, you can use your reaction to move up to 30 feet closer to it.

actions.name: Blood Frenzy
actions.description: When a creature you damaged on your last turn ends its turn further away from you than it started, you can move up to 30 feet closer to it.

traits.name: Bite
traits.description: You have a mouth rowed with jagged, razor like, teeth, and it is a natural weapon which you can make attacks with. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

traits.name: Secondary Arms
traits.description: You have two slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms. The secondary arms can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.

name: Sahuagin

description: Vedalken are tall and slender, standing almost a head taller than humans but weighing about the same. Their hairless skin comes in a range of shades of blue. Their eyes are darker shades of blue or violet. They lack external ears, their noses are broad and flat, and they are partially amphibious.

traits.name: Vedalken Dispassion
traits.description: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

traits.name: Tireless Precision
traits.description: You are proficient in one of the following skills of your choice: Arcana, History, Investigation, Medicine, Performance, or Sleight of Hand. You are also proficient with one tool of your choice. Whenever you make an ability check with the chosen skill or tool, roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the check's total.

traits.name: Partially Amphibious
traits.description: By absorbing oxygen through your skin, you can breathe underwater for up to 1 hour.

name: Vedalken

description: The warforged were built to fight. The first warforged were mindless automatons, but their creators devoted vast resources to improving these steel soldiers. An unexpected breakthrough produced fully sentient soldiers, blending organic and inorganic materials. Warforged are made from wood and metal, but they can feel pain and emotion. Built as weapons, they must now find a purpose beyond war. A warforged can be a steadfast ally, a cold-hearted killing machine, or a visionary in search of purpose and meaning.

traits.name: Artificial Nature
traits.description: You have resistance to poison damage and immunity to disease, and you have advantage on saving throws against being paralyzed or poisoned. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

traits.name: Sentry's Rest
traits.description: When you take a long rest, you spend at least 6 hours in an inactive, motionless state, instead of sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but you aren't unconscious.

traits.name: True Life
traits.description: If the Mending spell is cast on you, you can expend a Hit Die, roll it, and regain a number of hit points equal to the roll plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). In addition, your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Constructs: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

traits.name: Integrated Protection
traits.description:
Your body has built-in defensive layers, which can be enhanced with armor.
  • You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.
  • You can don only armor with which you have proficiency. To don armor, you must incorporate it into your body over the course of 1 hour, during which you must remain in contact with the armor. To doff armor, you must spend 1 hour removing it. You can rest while donning or doffing armor in this way.
  • While you live, your armor can't be removed from your body against your will.

subraces.name: Champion
subraces.description: The front-line warriors of the warforged, champion warforged possess an innate understanding of battlefield tactics, and fight with the use of an integrated weapon.

traits.name: Legacy of War
traits.description:
You learn one 1st-degree Tactical Exploit and can use it once with this trait. For the purposes of using the exploit, your Exploit Die is a d4.

If the exploit requires your target to make a saving throw to resist its effects, the saving throw DC is 8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus. You regain the use of your exploit when you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Integrated Weapon
traits.description: Over the course of a long rest, you can integrate a one-handed weapon with which you are proficient into one of your arms. As a bonus action, you can retract the weapon into your forearm or extend it from there. While it is extended, you can use the weapon as if you were holding it, and you can't use that hand for other purposes. You can't be disarmed of the weapon while it is extended.

subraces.name: Envoy
subraces.description: Envoy warforged are the most human of the warforged.  They possess an integrated tool and often serve as workers or diplomats.

traits.name: Specialized Design
traits.description: You gain one skill proficiency of your choice, one tool proficiency of your choice, and fluency in one language of your choice.

traits.name: Integrated Tool
traits.description: Choose one tool you're proficient with. This tool is integrated into your body, and you double your proficiency bonus for any ability checks you make with it. You must have your hands free to use this integrated tool.

subraces.name: Juggernaut
subraces.description: The enormous juggernaut warforged are titans of metal, often with oversized hands and feet.  They are the strongest warforged by far.

traits.name: Iron Fists
traits.description: When you make an unarmed strike, you can deal 1d6 + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage instead of the normal damage.

traits.name: Giant Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift, and you have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

subraces.name: Skirmisher
subraces.description: Skirmishers are the most stealthy of the warforged, utilizing their advanced speed and quieter mechanics to operate behind enemy lines.

traits.name: Swift
traits.description: Your walking speed is increased by 5 feet.

traits.name: Light Step
traits.description: When you are traveling alone for an extended period of time (one hour or more), you can move stealthily at a normal pace. In addition, you are proficient in the Stealth skill.

name: Warforged

description: Wights are unique among the undead for their unique ability to raise themselves, out of nothing more than an exceptionally a strong compulsion for a singular purpose: vengeance at any cost. Most commonly, this vengeance is targeted at the individual who killed them, or the person they deem responsible for their own death, but it also may be sworn on behalf of someone else: a parent, a lover, or a child. Unfortunately little else tends to remain of their former personality.

traits.name: Sense Mortality
traits.description: The presence of living creatures registers on your senses like a noxious odor. As an action, you can open your awareness to detect life force. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any beast, dragon, elemental, fey, humanoid, or giant within 60 feet of you that is not behind total cover. You know the type of any being whose presence you sense, but not its identity (Lord Bartholomew Van Der Woodsen, for instance). Within the same radius, you also detect the presence of any place or object that has been consecrated or desecrated, as with the hallow spell. Once you use this trait, you must complete a short or long rest before you use it again.

actions.name: Sense Mortality
actions.description: You open your awareness to detect life force. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any beast, dragon, elemental, fey, humanoid, or giant within 60 feet of you that is not behind total cover. You know the type of any being whose presence you sense, but not its identity. Within the same radius, you also detect the presence of any place or object that has been consecrated or desecrated, as with the hallow spell.

traits.name: Life Drain
traits.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use a bonus action to force the target to make a Constitution saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. If they fail, they take a number of d6s equal to your proficiency bonus as necrotic damage. If they succeed, they take half the amount. You gain half the amount of necrotic damage dealt as temporary hit points. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can force the target to make a DC {dc-con} Constitution saving throw. If they fail, they take  {prof}d6 necrotic damage. If they succeed, they take half the amount. You gain half the amount of necrotic damage dealt as temporary hit points.

traits.name: Wight Nature
traits.description: You are immune to poison damage, and you can't be diseased or poisoned. You don't require air, food, drink, or sleep, but must rest motionless in order to regain abilities that may require a short or long rest.

traits.name: Soulbound
traits.description: Your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Undead: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

name: Wight

description: The serpent creatures known as yuan-ti are all that remains of an ancient, decadent human empire. Ages ago their dark gods taught them profane, cannibalistic rituals to mix their flesh with that of snakes, producing a caste-based society of hybrids in which the most snakelike are the leaders and the most humanlike are spies and agents in foreign lands.

traits.name: Poison Immunity
traits.description: You are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Poison Affinity
traits.description: You have proficiency with the poisoner's kit.

subraces.name: Yuan-Ti Abomination
subraces.description: Yuan-ti abominations resemble a snake with the upper torso of a human, though coated in scales like the rest of their body.  They rank near the top of yuan-ti hierarchy.

traits.name: Speed Burst
traits.description: By lowering your body to the ground and propelling yourself with your arms, you can move more quickly for a time. As a bonus action on your turn, if you have both hands free, you can increase your walking speed by 5 feet until the end of your turn.

actions.name: Speed Burst
actions.description: By lowering your body to the ground and propelling yourself with your arms, you can move more quickly for a time. If you have both hands free, you can increase your walking speed by 5 feet until the end of your turn.

traits.name: Natural Weapons
traits.description:
Your fanged maw and constricting serpentine body are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with your bite, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, and your target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target takes 2d4 poison damage.

If you hit with your constrict attack, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, and the target is grappled (escape DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and you can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.description: If you hit with your constrict attack, the target is grappled (escape DC {dc-str}). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and you can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: If you hit with your bite, your target must make a {dc-con} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d4 poison damage.

subraces.name: Yuan-Ti Malison
subraces.description: Malison is a term used to refer to any yuan-ti that shares a roughly equal blend of human and snake features.  These snake men serve as a warrior caste in yuan-ti society, and have chameleonic abilities.

traits.name: Chameleon Skin
traits.description: As an action, you can change the color of your scales and skin to match the color and texture of your surroundings, giving you advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in those surroundings.

actions.name: Chameleon Skin
actions.description: You change the color of your scales to match the color and texture of your surroundings, giving you advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in those surroundings.

traits.name: Snake Physiology
traits.description: Your body has varying snake-like traits.  Choose one of the following traits:

Rather than legs, from the waist down you have the long tail of a snake.  Your constricting serpentine lower half is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes.  If you hit with your constrict attack, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, and the target is grappled (escape DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and you can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.description: If you hit with your constrict attack, the target is grappled (escape DC {dc-str}). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and you can't constrict another target.

traits.description: Your entire body is covered in scales. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

Your head resembles that of a serpent, with venemous fangs.  Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with your bite, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, and your target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target takes 2d4 poison damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: If you hit with your bite, your target must make a {dc-con} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d4 poison damage.

traits.description: In place of your arms, you have masses of writing snakes.  You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws against being disarmed, and you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

subraces.name: Yuan-Ti Pureblood
subraces.description: Purebloods are the most human of yuan-ti.  Other than their eyes having slit pupils or occasional patches of scales, a pureblood could be entirely mistaken for a human.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.description:
You know the Poison Spray cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Shed Skin spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Suggestion spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast shed skin or suggestion with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

name: Yuan-ti

description: Zombies are most commonly raised by necromancy or alchemy gone awry. When a zombie devours their meals, they gain only sustenance, and no pleasure from it, and no matter how ravenously devoured, the flesh of the living tastes only of ash and filth. Awakened zombies go to lengths to spice or salt their food, stimulating their decaying taste buds any way they can. If a zombie indulges in their forbidden hunger and eats the brains of another creature, they can experience life as the living do for a short time. Most zombies become addicted to these visions, losing their former selves to them.

traits.name: Living Dead
traits.description: You must maintain a diet of living or freshly dead flesh (within 1 minute of death), in equal portion to the amount of food a living member of your original species would require. Your muscles require the same amount of rest that your original race would in order to stave off exhaustion.

traits.name: Food for Thought
traits.description: If you devour at least one mouthful of brain from a deceased creature, for the next 24 hours, you can experience memories of their life as if you had cast the Detect Thoughts spell upon the creature. The target creature does not make a saving throw, and you experience a memory of theirs as a vision from their own perspective. The nature of the vision is determined by the DM. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

traits.name: Zombified Nature
traits.description: You are immune to poison damage, and you can't be diseased or poisoned. You don't require air, food, drink, or sleep, but must rest motionless in order to regain abilities that may require a short or long rest.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.description: When you succeed a death saving throw, you can immediately regain 1 hit point. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Soulbound
traits.description: Your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Undead: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

name: Zombie

description: Born alone without memories and quickly burning out, lanternfolk are a race of enlightened pilgrims and hermits, making the most of their incredibly short lifespans.  They leave behind letters and sacred texts to lead the next lanternfolk further than ever before.  This guidance is their only form of society, for within a year, the flame dies out.

traits.name: Ghostly Nature
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed. You are immune to poison damage, and you can't be diseased or poisoned. You don't require air, food, drink, or sleep. If your lantern goes out, your essence is irrevocably dispersed, and you are unable to be resurrected.

traits.name: Inner Light
traits.description: You know the Light cantrip.  Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Soulbound
traits.description: Your strange nature allows you to benefit from common spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Undead: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, and Spare the Dying.

subraces.name: Arcane Lantern
subraces.description: Arcane lanternfolk inhabit magical crystals or orbs once used by the wizards they were in life.

traits.name: Magelight
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Arcana skill.

traits.name: Arcane Sight
traits.description: You know the Detect Magic spell.  You can cast it at will, but only as a ritual.  Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

subraces.name: Holy
subraces.description: Residing within the holy censers of missionaries and clerics are the holy lanternfolk, whose spirit is only loosely bound to this plane.

traits.name: Holy Light
traits.description: You have resistance to radiant damage.

traits.name: Escape Body
traits.description: As an action, you can release your wisp soul from its lantern, leaving your body behind.  You become a Tiny mote of light, shedding bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light 5 feet beyond that.  While in this form, you retain all of your abilities and skills, but you can't take any actions or reactions, can't wear or carry anything.  You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, taking 1d10 force damage if you end your turn inside an object.  This transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you take damage.  Once you've used this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Escape Body
actions.description: You release your wisp soul from its lantern, leaving your body behind.  You become a Tiny mote of light, shedding bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light 5 feet beyond that.  While in this form, you retain all of your abilities and skills, but you can't take any actions or reactions, can't wear or carry anything.  You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, taking 1d10 force damage if you end your turn inside an object.  This transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you take damage.

subraces.name: Oil
subraces.description: Living in the most resilient and heavy duty of lanterns, oil lanternfolk can create powerful flames and withstand heavy attacks on their metal frames.

traits.name: Metallic Cage
traits.description: While you aren't wearing armor, your metallic lantern frame gives you a base Armor Class of 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.name: Burning Magic
traits.description:
You know the Fire Bolt cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Burning Hands spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Aganazzar's Scorcher spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast burning hands or Aganazzar's scorcher with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

name: Lanternfolk
